loans.name: Tulwanirewamu Community Group

texts.en:
For 12 years, 33-year-old Deborah has been overseeing operations at her beauty salon business in Kampala city, Uganda's capital city. Beauty salons are widespread all over Kampala, and it's always the way beauticians handle clients that sells their services. If one's beauty salon has a reputation for servicing clients well, that will, without a shadow of a doubt, play in the favor of that business. That is what has been unfolding at Deborah's salon. She and her employees aim at offering the best of service to not only their usual clients but also new clients. This has endeared them to many people, most especially women.

Not everything has been going well, however. She says the rising cost of doing business in most of East Africa has not spared her business. She says most of the cosmetics and other equipment she uses at her salon are increasingly becoming expensive. As a result, her business's growth has been stifled somewhat.

She remains upbeat, hoping for a favorable turn in circumstances soon. For a woman who was previously a housewife, this progress and attitude in the face of business adversity is encouraging. This mother of three says this business's gross profits total up to 500,000 Ugandan shillings weekly.  She says this Kiva loan will come in handy in the purchase of more cosmetics, hair dryers and other hair products to use at her salon.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, hair dryers and other hair products to use at her salon

loans.name: Djénéba

texts.fr:
Mme Djénéba est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 04ans.03 vont a l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des habits d’enfants, des pochettes pour dames et des ensembles chaines et parallèlement des condiments depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont ses amis, certains voisins et les agents des services.

Elle veut s’acheter 01 balle d’habits pour enfants;3 douzaines ensemble chaine et un plat de gombo sec. 

Elle veut aider son mari dans les charges familiales avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin et aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Djénéba is married and a mother of four. Her eldest is 18 and her youngest is four. Three of the children attend school. She has seven dependents in total.

She has been selling children's clothing, clutch bags for ladies and chains with pendants for three years. In parallel, she sells condiments. She gets her supplies from the sector 10 market. Her customers are her friends, some neighbors, and local service agents.

She wants to purchase 1 bundle of clothing for children, three dozen of chains with pendants and one dish of dried okra.

With her profits, she wants to help her husband with the family's expenses. She ambitions to open a department store and to contribute to her children's schooling.

loans.use: buy one bundle of children's clothes, three dozen of chains with pendants and one dish of dried okra.

loans.name: Din

texts.en: After taking four loans, Din is looking for a loan from HKL again as the fifth loan and the first loan from Kiva to buy more piglets for her pig hall. She is a 27-year-old woman married to Ann who is in the same age community. The main business of this family is selling the local traditional Khmer medicine to their villagers. Apart from this selling activity, Ann also earns another additional income by serving as a motor taxi driver. They have two children who are under school age. So, Din would like to request some funds in order to purchase piglets. Their future expectation is to have a bigger business, bigger house, and at least bachelor degrees for their children.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
La Señora Marciana está casada con el Señor Celso, el cual se dedica a la vidriería, tienen 2 hijos, 1 D. ellos ya está casado, y el otro es independiente ya mayor D. edad.
Ella tiene una lavandería familiar en donD. todos trabajan y ayudan, Don Celso, su marido, la ayuda en la entrega D. las ropas limpias y planchadas que la la Señora Marciana con sus hijas lavan y planchan. En cuanto a su clientela comenta que tiene clientes D. grandes empresas, a los cuales le cobra en forma mensual por los servicios realizados, por lo que ya tiene un ingreso mensual asegurado.
Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con sus compromisos. Una D. sus metas es seguir creciendo D. forma gradual con su negocio, para que el día D. mañana no solo ayuD. a su familia, sino también a los demás generando puestos D. empleo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. una seca ropas industrial, lo cual le será D. muchísima ayuda en su trabajo. Está muy contenta con la oportunidad que le da la Fundación.
texts.en:
Marciana is married to Celso, whose profession is glasswork.  They have two sons, one of whom is already married, while the other is an independent adult.

She runs a family laundromat where everyone works and helps out.  Celso, her husband, helps her return the clean, ironed clothes that Marciana and her daughters clean and iron.  In terms of clientele, she has customers from big businesses whom she charges monthly for services rendered, which assures her a monthly income.

She has proven to be a very hardworking person who keeps her commitments.  One of her goals is to keep her business growing gradually so that in the future she will help not only her family, but others by creating jobs.  

She is asking for a loan to buy an industrial clothes dryer, which will be very helpful to her in her work.  She is very happy to have this opportunity from the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy a clothes dryer to use in her laundromat

loans.name: Louise

texts.en: Louise is 29 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is single and has three children aged between 7 and 14, all of whom are currently in school and living at home. Louise is a high school graduate who, for the past four years, has been selling oil, rice, pepper and soda. She is the only person in her community to sell these products, therefore she makes a lot of profit. She has many customers and too few commodities, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and soda for her business. Louise hopes to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and soda for her business.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three school-aged children. Mrs. Kin started a career as a local farmer when she was with her parents. Besides cultivating in the field, she also owns a successful business as a rice supplier. Mrs. Kin can generate an income of approximately $3.50 USD a day. In order to increase her income, Mrs. Kin is seeking a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband to offer a service business to passengers in and around the village. In the future, she wants to decorate her old house and continue supporting her children until they graduate with university degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Ermelinda has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy green and yellow bananas for resale.

Ermelinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ermelinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas for resale.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa es agricultora y realiza la actividad de compra y venta de tubérculos (papa, chuño). Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba así mejorar el riego y la producción de tubérculos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia 	Aroma; es casada  y tiene  un  hijo. Es la primera vez que Josefa obtiene un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefa is a farmer who buys and sells tubers, such as potatoes and “chuños” (freeze dried potatoes). The money from this loan will cover the cost of a water pump so that she can improve the irrigation and production of her tuber crops. Josefa lives in her own home in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. She is married and has one child.

This is the first time Josefa has obtained a loan.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for improving the irrigation of her tuber crops.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, D. 63 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía D. su esposo Julián, con quien convive desD. hace 40 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo vive con uno D. ellos: Víctor, al que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo D. Acraquia.  Una zona ganadera, donD. todos sus pobladores se dedican a L. crianza D. ganado vacuno D. buena calidad. Ahí Julia, comenzó desD. hace 20 años aproximadamente, a incursionar en L. ganadería con L. crianza D. vacas. Ahora tiene 4 vacas lecheras y 3 becerros, que le brindan leche, con los que elabora queso; un promedio D. 18 “bolillos”, diarios (quesos pequeños). Junto a su esposo, también se dedica a L. agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan D. papa, habas, arveja y maíz los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues depenD. D. sus cuidados, para que obtenga buena ganancia en L. cosecha. Ahora su objetivo se centra en L. mejora D. sus sembríos y D. sus animales, con trabajo y empeño sabe que lo logrará. ElL. pertenece al banco comunal “Acraquia” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donD. espera del apoyo D. todos ustedes para seguir con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas.  Julia, D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. una vaca D. raza Brown Swiss, que le brindan buena leche.
texts.en: Julia, 63, is a responsible woman.  She lives with her husband, Julián, and they have been together for 40 years.  They have nine children, of which only one still lives at home, Víctor, who they care for in their own house in the Acraquia annex.  This is a livestock farming area where all the inhabitants raise quality cattle.  Approximately 20 years ago Julia began raising cattle in this area.  Now she has four dairy cows and three calves who give her milk which she uses to make cheese.  She produces an average of 18 small cheese balls a day.  She and her husband also grow crops, mainly potatoes, lima beans, peas and corn which they take good care of in order to make a good profit at harvest time.  Their goal now is to improve their crops and livestock, and through hard work and commitment they know they will meet their goal.  She is a member of the communal bank "Acraquia" and this is her fifth loan through MFP.  She is counting on your support to reach her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  If you can help Julia she plans to invest the money in a new Brown Swiss cow that will give good milk.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a flexible and diligent mother of four. Aside from her hog-raising business that allows her to earn a profit every six months, she also sells processed meat products for daily income. She offers longganisa and tocino (cured and pork sausages) and hot dogs in her neighborhood. She had established this business five years ago and earns a profit just enough for the daily allowances of her children. Myrna is 45 years old and married. She wants to seek a loan amount of 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy more longganisa, tocino, hot dogs and fish balls to sell in her neighborhood. She wants to earn consistent profits to save for the future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy more longganisa and tocino (types of sausages), hot dogs and fish balls to sell in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and lives in Tinago, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married with one school-age child.

Helen operates a grocery store to earn a living.  Each month she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase more stock for her general store business.

Helen has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 9 months.  In the future, Helen hopes to expand her business.

Paglaum

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 40, has worked in construction since 1994. He specializes in pasting and polishing tiles and also offers painting services. He is a hard worker and a very kind father who works hard for his children's happiness and satisfaction. He and his wife have four children.
 
In addition to his construction business, Ali has been a partner in a bakery. Recently, he bought out his partner and now needs to do necessary maintenance to his new business. He is confident that this step will have a significant and positive effect on his family's situation.
 
Through a requested loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, Ali will buy new machines and an improved wide oven in addition to purchasing necessary raw materials. 

Ali hopes to expand both businesses in a very strategic way, and to gain and preserve his customers' trust.

loans.use: to buy new new machines for his bakery and raw materials for his construction business

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
SABALI est un groupe constitué de cinq  femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait l’achat vente de friperies, de céréales, de tubercules et des fruits et légumes.
Madame  AMINATA, debout en première position à partir de la gauche fait le commerce d’oranges.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 12 chargements de charrettes  en orange qu’elle distribuera à ses détaillants au fur et à mesure, au marché de Médine à Sikasso et en famille Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes et ses ventes se font essentiellement au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Sabali Group is made up of five married women who average 32 years of age and three children. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso.

The members of the group are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. They sell secondhand clothing, cereals, yams, and fruits and vegetables.

Mrs. AMINATA, first one standing on the left in the photograph, is selling oranges. She intends to use her loan to buy twelve cartloads of oranges, that she will gradually retail at the Médine market in Sikasso, and at her home. Her clientele comprises both men and women, and she sells mainly for cash. 

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30), to be used in part to repay the loan and its interests, and in part to be put away.

loans.use: to buy twelve cartloads of oranges

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 35 years old and married to Alice. They have two children.

He has been in the carpentry business for the last 11 years and he earns a monthly income of KES 45,000. He is applying for his fourth loan of KES 100,000. He paid his previous loan well and on time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy more timber and build a permanent business premises of his own.

loans.use: To buy timber for making furniture, glue for joinery, and sandpaper.

loans.name: Sugheis

texts.es: Sugheis  de 36 años de edad es una mujer muy emprendedora que genera sus ingresos familiares a partir de dos negocios,  por un lado se dedica a  la venta de mercancías variada,  como vestidos femeninos, ropa de dormitorios, perfumes, cosméticos, los que distribuye de cliente a cliente de acuerdo con el pedido que estos le hagan; ella vende a crédito y recupera su inversión, semanalmente, quincenalmente o mensualmente basado en lo que pacte con sus clientes. El otro negocio es el alquiler de lavadoras, cuyas clientelas son principalmente las amas de casa, que disminuyen  su carga de trabajo doméstico,  mediante la utilización de estas máquinas, que lo hacen mas efectivo su trabajo. Su negocio como comerciante lo inició hace 3 años ; como su deseo de superación empresarial es permanente, su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, especialmente en las épocas de mayor movimiento comercial, como las de fin de año. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará,  mercancías como vestidos elegantes y calzado, para responderle a sus clientes los pedidos, y que estos estén elegantemente vestidos, esperando la navidad y el nuevo año 2012.
texts.en: Thirty-six-year-old Sugheis is a very enterprising woman who generates income for her family from two businesses.  On the one hand, she sells various merchandise, such as women's dresses, sleepwear, perfumes, and cosmetics, which she delivers to each customer according to what she has ordered from her.  She sells on credit and gets back her investment weekly, biweekly, or monthly depending on the agreement with her customer.  Her other business is renting washing machines.  Her customers are mainly housewives who cut down on their household workload by using these machines, which make their work more efficient.  She started working as a merchant three years ago.  As she wants to continually improve her businesses, her working capital is no longer sufficient, especially during times when her businesses' turnover increases, such as the end of the year.  This is why she has sought out a Kiva loan through her first financing experience with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it, she will buy merchandise, such as elegant dresses and shoes, to fill her customers' orders and make sure they are well dressed for Christmas and New Year's 2012.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as elegant dresses and shoes

loans.name: Iris Suyapa

texts.es:
Iris Suyapa, tiene 39 años de edad, casada desde hace 15 años, vive en Cofradia, Cortes, su esposo se dedica también al comercio.
La señora Iris, se dedica a vender mercadería, como joyas, toallas, cortinas, manteles, sabanas y almohadas. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios, desde hace seis años, le ofrecía productos a  sus vecinas y fue incrementando su inventario según encargos o pedidos. 
Sale a ofrecer mercadería los fines de semana, la mayor parte de ventas la realiza de acuerdo a pedidos. 
Para mantener productos en existencia y satisfacer al cliente  a invertido cuatro prestamos. Con este préstamo actual va comprar juego de ropa de cama, cortinas, tollas y joyas. 
Con las ganancias que obtenga va comprar artículos de novedades y un mostrador de productos, para ampliar más en negocio.
texts.en:
Iris Suyapa, 39, has been married for 15 years and lives in Cofradía, Cortes; her husband is also a merchant.

Iris sells merchandise like jewelry, towels, curtains, tablecloths, sheets and pillows.  She started the business with funds of her own six years go.  She sells products to her neighbors and has gradually increased her inventory according to requests and orders placed.  She sells on weekends and most of her sales are based on prior orders.

To keep merchandise in stock and meet customer demand he has invested four loans.  She will use this present one to buy sets of bed linens, curtains, towels and jewelry.  With profits obtained she will buy novelty items and a display case to expand her business more.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Mayra Fernanda

texts.es: La cliente reside en Portoviejo.  Se dedicó a esta actividad debido a que su esposo era quien se dedicaba a la elaboración de los panes y ella aprendió ayudándolo todos los días.  Lamentablemente, luego se separaron y ella cogió a cargo el negocio, en donde labora hasta ahora.  Trabaja con sus hijos y su ex-suegra, de lunes a domingo.  Está soltera y tiene 4 hijos de 16, 12, 10 y 3 años quienes estudian en la escuela y colegio fiscal.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de harina y manteca para la producción del pan.
texts.en: This client lives in Portoviejo.  She’s worked in this activity because her husband was a baker and she learned by helping him every day.  Sadly, they separated and she took over the business where she’s worked to date.  She works with her children and her ex-mother-in-law from Monday to Sunday.  She’s single and has four children who are 16, 12, 10 and 3 years of age who attend public primary and secondary school.  She needs the loan now to buy flour and shortening to bake bread.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 45-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells stationery items, such as printing papers, pens, pencils, etc. He also does printing of documents. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add a stock of stationery items, such as printing papers, pens, etc. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of stationery items, such as printing papers, pens, etc.

loans.name: Nilabati

texts.en: Nilabati is 45 years old a divorced lady and has two children. She lives in Koraput district, Odisha. Nilabati is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business of drying fish and selling them in the market of Jeypore of Odisha, India. She already has had this business for more than 10 years , and it is going very well. At this time, Nilabati is requesting a loan to buy fish in bulk to resell. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand. The goal Nilabati is to increase her business activity and make a great asset for herself.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk to resell

loans.name: Deisy Vicenta

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Deisy, tiene  61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es maestro jubilado.
Deisy es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo para ayudar con los gastos que genera su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, siempre aprovecha los créditos para ir a comprar y así a ella le sale más barato ya que compra al contado y de esta forma mejoran sus ganancias, son más de 17 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son necesarios para su vida. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.

loans.use: comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños.

loans.name: Veselina

texts.en:
Veselina I. is 58 years old. She has two daughters who after their graduation were not able to get a job in Bulgaria and live abroad at the moment.

Veselina I. has been a teacher for 24 years but after but 6 years ago the school staff was reduced and she lost her job. Then she decided to start small business – yarn trade. She rented a small stall in one of city trade centers. The business improved and a year ago she rented another stall in the same center.

Some people say knitted clothes have been replaced by modern stuff but Veselina I. does not share this opinion. She is happy with what she does as long as she is able to pay off with her suppliers. Veselina I. needs this $ 1 500 loan to supply some extra yarn.

loans.use: To supply some extra yarn

loans.name: Lemapu

texts.en:
Lemapu, 37, is a mother of four who has a small taro plantation.  Before joining the SPBDF program, she was unemployed and relied upon family overseas for funds.

The SPBDF helped Lemapu expand her family's plantation from which she sells three or four sacks of taro per week, earning her 300-400 tala per week.

She wishes to borrow an additional $875 to enable her to purchase fertilizer, chemicals and fungicides  for her farm to expand her sales in order to finance her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, chemicals and fungicides for her taro farm.

loans.name: Gatiba

texts.en:
Gatiba has been in the retail business for 7 years. 
She sells clothes, blankets, and bed linens.
This 32-year-old single woman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, Madirkhanli  village. She lives in the Khirdalan settlement.
She used her first loan of $500 to buy stock to sell. After repaying that, she borrowed
$1000 to increase her inventory.
She is asking for a loan of $1200 to build a shop.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Anty

texts.fr:
Anty K., age 36, is married and the mother of three. Her husband, a motorcycle taxi driver, has trouble feeding his family. This leads Ms. K. to assume most of the household expenses. Having a primary school education, she was a domestic for two years in Kpalimé before enter an apprenticeship.

An energetic and honest woman, she had gotten an initial loan that she was able to manage as expected upon accepting it. Today, she is requesting a second loan in order to sell "pagnes" (colorful traditional cloths commonly worn as sarongs). This will allow her to clear a big profit to participate in improving the living conditions at home.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agé de 36 ans, Madame K. Anty est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants. Son mari conducteur de taxi moto arrive difficilement à nourrir la famille. Ce qui fait que Madame K. Anty assume la grande partie des charges du foyer. De niveau primaire, elle fut domestique pendant deux ans à Kpalimé avant d’aller en apprentissage.

Dynamique et honnête, elle avait reçu un premier crédit qu’elle a su gérer normalement suivant l’engagement pris. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite encore un second crédit pour la vente de pagne. Ce qui lui permettra de dégager un grand bénéfice pour participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Commerce in traditional cloths

loans.name: Tofu

texts.en: Tofu is married with two children. Shestays at home and does not have a job, but she is very good at making pork buns and she spent all of her first $300 loan to buy the most needed ingredients for her business doing these. She is planning to extend her business with her next loan, adding German buns, donuts and pies, because she is good at making them. She believes that without the help she got from the SPBD program, she would not have been able to do it, and she will be happy to stay for a long time in the programme.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for the business

loans.name: Olinda Mariela

texts.es:
Olinda is 42 years old. She lives in Mache, in the Otuzco province, Department of La Libertad. She has one son who still lives with her because he is young and attends high school. Olinda only completed elementary school.

She began by selling some products (groceries), sweets and juices from her house. With this business she became a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres con Futuro” and obtained her first loan of 300 soles (approximately $100). She bought hens and ducks with the loan, to raise and sell to the people who bring products to Trujillo. At the same time, she also ran a kiosk at the school in Mache.

With this loan of 1,000 soles from Manuela Ramos (approximately $333), which she will repay within four months, she will buy candy to supply the kiosk and use another part of the loan to buy hens that she will fatten to sell for the New Year’s celebrations. She dreams of seeing her only son become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Olinda tiene 42 años de edad, actualmente vive en Mache provincia de Otuzco Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 1 hijo, que aun depende de ella ya que está pequeño y va al colegio. La señora Olinda estudió solo primaria completa.

Se inició vendiendo unos cuantos productos (abarrotes), golosinas y jugos en su casa, con este negocio ingresó al Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Futuro” y obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 ($ 100 aprox.) con este dinero compró gallinas y patos para criar y vender a la gente que lleva productos a Trujillo. Paralelamente a estas actividades también vende en el kiosko de la escuela de Mache.

Con el reciente préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 ( $ 333 aprox.) para pagarlo en 4 meses, comprará golosinas para surtir el kiosko y otra parte para comprar gallinas las que engordará para vender en las fiestas de fin de año. Ella sueña con ver a su único hijo profesional.

loans.use: Buy sweets; Buy hens.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen I. is 45 years old, is married with five children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food, water and drinks to people living in her community. She learned her business from her mother as a child. According to her, with $450 she will be able to buy more water and drink to sell.

loans.use: Helen woud like to buy more foodstuffs & drinks to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
My home is very comfortable for my family, but in reality, we would like to make it a bit larger. I am thinking about making some modifications to the kitchen and buying some doors which we need; you can see our furniture is a bit cramped. I am asking for $1000 to expand the kitchen and buy doors.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi casa en muy cómoda para mi familia, pero en realidad nos gustaría ampliarla un poco, pienso hacerle algunos arreglos a la cocina y comprar unas puertas que me hacen falta ya que si se dan cuenta tenemos los muebles un poco amontonados ” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para ampliar un poco la cocina de mi casa y comprar unas puertas .

loans.use: Expanding the kitchen and buying doors for my home

loans.name: Redi Dwi M.s

texts.id:
Redi sells VCD’s at the Anyar market to support himself and his school-aged younger sibling. He needs additional capital to open similar business at a different location. He will be very grateful to receive the loan from DINARI. He will use the loan to buy selling supplies and VCD inventory. He is hoping that his business explansion plan will allow him to have enough money to save, and set him up for a better future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva Volunteer.

Redi adalah penjual VCD dipasar Anyar, usaha ini dia jalani untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya setiaphari dan membantu adiknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah. Untuk meningkatkan pendapatannya dalam berusaha Redi membutuhkan modal untuk membuka usaha yang sama ditempat lain, dan dia sendiri sangat senang ketika mendapatkan bantuan permodalan yang diberikan oleh DINARI. Modal tersebut nantinya akan dibelikan sarana untuk berjualan dan VCD yang baru tentunya. Dia berharap lewat pengembangan usahanya ini dia dapat menabung dan mempersiapkan hari depan dengan perekonomian yang lebih baik.

loans.use: To buy kiosk supplies and VCD inventory

loans.name: Rahma's Upendo 2 Group

texts.en:
Rahma is 25 years old and is a single woman. Rahma has been selling clothes, Television and DVDs since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales. Rahma now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Deusdeditha.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Sofia Magda

texts.es:
Mrs. Sofia Magda M. A. is a 39 year old woman who attended school through the second grade. She has one child still at home. She lives in the El Cortijo section of the Trujillo district in the La Libertad department of Peru. Sofia raises birds – particularly chickens, and has set up a small farm at her home. Additionally, she prepares chicken sausage in the afternoons which she makes from the chickens that she raises. On weekends she makes cebiche (a fish dish made with citrus juice) and pasta dishes. She is well known among her neighbors for offering tasty cooking at a reasonable price. Sofia joined the “Nuevo Peru” community bank, where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles ($100) which she used to purchase chicks and feed. With this 500 sol loan, ($200) which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 30 chickens, feed, and medicine to protect her chickens from sickness. Her greatest dream is to outfit a fully equipped restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sofía Magda Martínez A. tiene 39 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector de El Cortijo en el distrito de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Se dedica a la crianza de aves en especial pollos, en su domicilio ha ambientado una pequeña granja para criar a los pollos; además por las tardes prepara salchipollo, para lo cual aprovecha los pollos que ella misma cría y los fines de semana prepara cebiche y tallarines. Los vecinos ya la conocen porque aparte de tener una buena sazón lo vende a un precio muy cómodo. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varios pollos bebes y alimento balanceado. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 30 pollos, purina y medicina para proteger a las aves de cualquier enfermedad. Su mayor sueño es ambientar un restaurante con todos los implementos, en su casa.

loans.use: With this loan 30 chickens will be purchased, along with feed and other items for the business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Fatuma R.. She is married and has one child aged 14. In 2004, Fatuma established her tailoring mart business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock of boutique in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of boutique in bulk.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Denis T. is from the El Sauce municipality of the city of León. Currently, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. He is the father of three small children who he cares for and has the responsibility of educating.

It’s important to note that Denis is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. It’s for this reason that he turned to CEPRODEL to obtain a loan to purchase some pregnant cows to help him increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Denis T. es originario del municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León, actualmente se dedica al negocio de la ganadería ya que este municipio se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera en altos porcentajes. Es padre de tres pequeños hijos los cuales atiende y esta en el deber de proporcionarles todas las condiciones necesarias para que ellos se desarrollen en sus estudios.

Es necesario destacar que hoy en día, el señor Denis esta consciente de que debe de apoyar a su familia con el recurso económico para subsistir. Es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual poder comprar vacas en preñez para sacarles el máximo provecho y comercializarlas en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cows.

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en: Etevise T., 53, is widowed with 6 children.  She has many years of experience with growing and selling cabbages, cucumbers, peas, pumpkin and spring onions. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Etevise’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also use the loan to  buy timbers, iron roofs and cement for home improvements She has two children that  help run the business and with  family needs

loans.use: Purchase chemicals,  pesticides and vegetables seeds

loans.name: Sonia Alvina

texts.es:
Sonia S. lives in her own house with her two children and has been separated from her husband for 10 years. She is a stylist by profession and her hair salon is in the center of the city of La Paz (she is the only one who works there as she doesn’t have many customers and can’t afford to pay for an employee).

She is asking for a loan to purchase the beauty products she uses every day (shampoo, conditioner, hair dyes, etc). Her objective is to reduce her costs by buying in larger quantities. The beauty salon is her only source of income (her children are at university and don’t work).

Her credit history is excellent, which allows her to request a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia S. vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, esta separada del esposo hace ya 10 años, la profesión que tiene es la de estilista, su salón de peinados esta en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz (ella sola atiende la peluquería ya que no todavía no tiene mucha clientela y no puede pagar una empleada).

Solicita crédito para adquirir productos de belleza que usa todos los días (shampoo, acondicionador, tintes, etc.). Su objetivo es reducir sus costos al comprar en mayor cantidad, el salón de belleza es la única fuente de ingresos (sus hijos están en la universidad y no trabajan).

Su antecedente histórico es excelente, por lo tanto, puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina is 35 years old and a widow. She lives with her three children; Anais, 17, Yesesiño, 15 and Faviola 7. She is dedicated to seasonal sales. During these months, she sells beer at her town during their festivities. She also constantly travels to the small towns of Imata and Pinaya where she offers this beverage with the goal of providing to her children because she is the main breadwinner of the family since her husband's death. Marcelina travels a lot and usually works all day where there are festivities or parties where she can sell the liquor at the town. There are also days where no events take place and the sales are not good at all. What she likes about her work is how it makes her feel: independent and useful. But the difficulties are present too. The transportation of the beer cases is dangerous due to the fragility of the cases and also when some people consume in excess and are drunk, they don't want to pay.

Marcelina works ardously to make her children contributing citizens, happy, professional and with some money to fulfill their goals. With the money from the loan, Marcelina will be able to buy more cases of beer to sell. With time, she expects to establish a small grocery store so she doesn't have to travel that much and spend more time with her children

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Marcelina tiene 35 años, es viuda, vive con sus tres hijos; Anais de 17, Yesesiño de 15 y Faviola de 7. Se dedica al comercio según la temporada, en estos meses vende cerveza en su localidad durante los días de fiesta, también viaja constantemente a los pueblitos de Imata y Pinaya, donde ofrece esta bebida, con el único fin de mantener a sus hijos, ya que se quedó sola con la muerte de su esposo. Marcelina viaja mucho, usualmente se dedica todo el día a trabajar los días donde hay alguna fiesta, donde ella pueda vender este licor, pero también existen días en los cuales no las hay y la venta no es buena.Lo que le gusta a Marcelina de su trabajo es como la hace sentir, independiente y útil, pero las dificultades también se hacen presentes, por un lado el traslado de las cajas de cerveza es peligroso, por la fragilidad de estas y por otro cuando algunas personas que consumen en exceso y ebrias no quieren pagar, Marcelina trabaja arduamente para hacer de sus hijos gente de provecho, feliz, profesional y con dinero para cumplir todas sus metas. Con el dinero que adquiera podrá comprar más cajas de cerveza, para venderlas, con el tiempo, espera poner una pequeña tienda de comestibles, para no tener que viajar tanto y poder pasar más tiempo con sus hijos.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of the product (beer) that she sells during her town festivities.

loans.name: Hanča

texts.en:
Hanča, born in 1954, lives with her husband, a painter, in the village of Omazići near Banovići. Hanča, as almost every woman in a village, does much in her garden, field and home. She produces vegetables for her own use and has a cow whose milk she both sells and uses for home consumption. As well, she has a few chickens and now wishes to begin raising poultry.

Hanča’s husband helps her in his free time with all things and the request for a loan of $725 was a joint decision. Hanča will use this amount to buy poultry and poultry feed, with the ultimate goal of raising the family income through the establishment and expansion of a poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy poultry and poultry food.

loans.name: Olga Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y vive en el Jr. Atuspararia s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.
Tanto ella como su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y a la venta de abarrotes, negocio que está ubicado en el mercado campo ferial de Yungay.  Con este negocio viene trabajando 15 años. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como 5 cajas de aceite, 10 bolsas de fideos, 5 bolsas de arroz y 10 sacos de azúcar. Con esta inversión se podrá surtir el negocio. 
Sueña con hacer grande su negocio y vender tanto al por mayor como al por menor.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old and has three children. She is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay (Fighting Women of Yungay) and lives on Atuspararia Avenue, in the district and province of Yungay in the department of Ancash.

She and her husband work in agriculture and in selling groceries at their business located in the country fairground market in Yungay. She has been working in this business for 15 years.

With this loan of 1,700 Soles, which will be paid off in 8 months, she will buy basic necessity products, such as 5 boxes of oil, 10 bags of noodles, 5 bags of rice, and 10 sacks of sugar. With this investment she will be able to stock up her business. She dreams of making her business bigger and selling as much in bulk as in smaller amounts.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy oil, noodles, rice, sugar

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is married and has 3 dependents. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a mechanic.

Esther sells cooked food to her customers at Boatase near Elmina. She started selling cooked food not long ago. She is responsible for assisting her husband in providing the basic needs of their family. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business for reinvestment.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 52 years old and is married with 5 children. She sells food. She started this business in 2005. She is a LAPO client. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more food to sell. She says "thank you" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Ngai

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Ngại 33 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Hiện nay chị Ngại đang chăn nuôi lợn ở nhà còn chồng chị làm thợ xây. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với tổng thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. H. Thi Ngai is 33 years old, and joined TYM fund since 2002. Currently Ms. Ngai raises pigs at home while her husband is a construction worker. These are their main sources of income totaling 233 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 700 USD to buy more pigs and feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Paula Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Paula Antonia C. C. tiene 53 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús María y vive en el sector de Cochaya en el caserío de Salpo en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo de secundaria y ya no continuó estudiando debido a que solamente vivía con su madre y esta tenía la idea de que las mujeres no deben recibir educación.  Se casó a los 16 años y tuvo 10 hijos siete de los cuales dependen de ella.
La actividad económica que realiza es la venta de queso, carne, jamón, además tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.
El primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en cuatro cuotas y lo invirtió en comprar queso.
Con este crédito de 100 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en compra de zapatos escolares.
Paula desea tener una casa en Trujillo.
texts.en:
Paula Antonia C. C. is 53 years old, belongs to the Jesús María Communal Bank and lives in the Cochaya sector in the Salpo neighborhood in the Otuzco province of the department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the second year of secondary school and did not continue because she only lived with her mother who had the idea that women should not receive an education. She married when she was 16 years old and had 10 children, seven of which are her dependents. The economic activity that she carries out is the sale of cheese, meat, and ham in addition to having a small grocery store. The first loan for 300 soles was re-paid in four installments and she invested it in the purchase of cheese. With this loan of 100 soles that will be paid back in 4 installments she will invest in the purchase of school shoes. Paula wishes to have a house in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school shoes that she wants to sell in her store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha Adjei-F. is forty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to four children, two boys and two girls. She says some of her children are in senior high school and others are in junior high and primary school. Martha lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. ,P>

Martha’s husband is a professional teacher while she is a school proprietress. Martha has established a basic school in her community. Currently, she has up to basic stage five. "Jesus Preparatory School" is the name of Martha’s school. She wants a loan to procure writing desks for the pupils. Martha aspires to develop the school to at least the junior high level. According to her, she has qualified teachers as a staff. She has been a proprietress for six years now.

loans.use: To buy school desks

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresita S. is a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner. She is married to Egmidio S. and has five children, two of whom are still studying. She is a resident of Roxas, Zambo Norte. Income from labor is her husband's major source of income.

During her membership, she has had five loans. The purpose of this loan is to buy piglets and feed. This will add to her existing pig-raising business to support her husband in generating household income. She dreams that her family will experience a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est Composé  de neuf  femmes (huit mariées et une veuve) vivant majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques. Elles  sont âgées en moyenne de 38 ans avec  4 enfants et vivent toutes dans le village de Sirakoro  (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage,  de parenté, de voisinage et  font essentiellement  le commerce d’articles divers au marché de Médine.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement  remboursés ses six précédents prêts solidaires, il est à son septième  qui sera  utilisé pour acheter,  40 sacs de henné transformé en poudre, 6 cartons de sparadrap (bandes collantes pour le henné), 1sac d’urée (utilisé pour renforcer la couleur noire du henné), 10 cartons de savon en morceau, 3 douzaines de savon liquide, 3sacs de mil, 2sacs de haricot, 50kg de gueni et de magnonkissèni (noyaux de plantes sauvages exotiques) et 5 bouteilles d’eau de Cologne. Le gueni, le magnonkissèni et les eaux de Cologne sont transformés en encens pour la vente. Elles s’approvisionnent  au grand marché de Ségou et quelques fois à Tissala. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement  composée de femmes à domicile, en ambulant au village, au marché de Médine et quelques fois au grand marché de Ségou. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 39 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt, la participation aux évènements sociaux et la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales. 
Elles ont pour ambition l’achat des vaches pour avoir du lait  à boire, à vendre et utiliser leurs bouses  comme  fumure organique pour fertiliser leurs champs
texts.en:
The Danaya is a group composed of nine women (eight married and one widowed) living in monogamous families and averaging 38 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of Sirakoro (fourth administrative region of Mali). The women know one another through ties of marriage, kinship, or community, and they essentially do commerce in various goods at the Médine marketplace.

Wanting to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing customer base, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. After having correctly repaid their six preceding solidarity loans, they are now on their seventh, which will be used to buy: forty bags of henna processed into powder, six boxes of band-aids (for the henna), one bag of urea (used for enriching the black color of the henna), ten boxes of bar soap, three dozen of liquid soap, three bags of millet, two bags of beans, 50 kg of gueni and magnonkissèni (seeds of wild exotic plants), and five bottles of eau de cologne. The gueni, magnonkissèni, and the perfume are made into incense to be sold.

Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Ségou and sometimes in Tissala. Sales are made to customers essentially composed of women, cash or credit accepted, in their homes, door-to-door in town, at the Médine marketplace, and sometimes at the grand marketplace of Ségou.

The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 39,500 francs CFA that will be use to repay the loan, to participate in social events, and to cover certain family expenses. Their ambition is to buy cows to obtain milk to drink and to sell, as well as to use their dung as organic manure to fertilize the fields.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Burhoniddin

texts.en:
T. Burhoniddin is 55 years old. He is married with three children. He sells cattle and also provides transportation service. As a rule, he purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and than resells them for higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 20 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills make his business successful to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family.

Burhoniddin has a large and friendly family who are always trying to help each other. Today knowing that the prices for the animals are not so high now, but will increase for sure, Burhoniddin is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase cattle. With this purpose, he requests $800. You could become an important part in the Burhoniddin family's life and he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Ester M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 9. Ester has been selling traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women called kanga and vitenge since 2008. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with a wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures and traditions of native African people. She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her husband. Ester currently earns about $100 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Ester thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk

loans.name: Beatrice Aseyo

texts.en:
Beatrice Aseyo K. is a 27-year-old married mother of two children. She sells maize and cosmetics, purchased from Busia, and sold in Nyamasaria slum. Beatrice’s challenges in business are allowing too many customers to have credit. She does not like collecting debt. Her hope for the future is to have a larger business. In her free-time, Beatrice likes to watch videos and have a few drinks. She hopes to use the loan for selling more goods out of her house.

In this video, you can hear me greet Beatrice saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Beatrice responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "thank you" and "Erokamano", which in Luo means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post.

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. You can read more about K-MET’s work here.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics supplies.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa P. owns and operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 31 years old, married and has one small child. She is from Oroquieta City. Marissa has been in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2001, Marissa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marissa is now requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 17th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Eulecita

texts.en:
Eulecita S. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Eulecita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eulecita owns & operates a specialized retail store selling a variety of food products in the local community. Eulecita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eulecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eulecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Eulecita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eulecita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve fund for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Franklin David

texts.es: El Señor Franklin C. tiene 30años de edad, habitante de la comarca  Carlos Fonseca del municipio de Villa del Carmen, casado su esposa ama de casa tiene un hijos de cincos años de edad. Brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia es unos de los objetivos más importantes. Trabajo en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo del técnico de catastro desde hace seis meses, anteriormente trabaja en su casa y a domicilio como albañil, hombre emprendedor que coloca todo su empeño para ofrecerle un mejor presente y futuro a su familia. Don Franklin tiene un solar en donde tiene planes de sembrar maíz, se le ha presentado dificultades de falta de recurso económico lo cual es un alto pero no cambia sus ideas de llevar acabo sus planes. Agradece a la Institución por el préstamo comprar semillas y abonos para aplicar en el siembro. De este proyecto obtendrá ganancias para ir mejorando y aumentando las siembras y la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Franklin C. is 30 years old, a resident of the Carlos Fonseca region in the municipality of Villa del Carmen. He and his wife have a 5 year old son. One of Franklin's most important goals is to provide greater security for his family. He has worked in the mayor's office as a land/property registry clerk for 6 months; previously he worked from home as a builder. Franklin is an entrepreneur who puts everything he has into offering a better life and future life to his family. He has a plot of land where he plans to sow maize, but is having financial difficulties. These difficulties have not changed his mind about carrying out his plans. He appreciates the institution for their loan to buy seed and fertilizer. From this project he will obtain income to continue improving and increasing his crop yield as well as the infrastructure of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer for the sowing season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase charcoal stock

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella S. is from the city of Katipunan. She is 55 years old, married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns on average 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2006, Estrella joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her ninth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Mrs. Khem P., 47, and her husband, Mr. Sam-oeun Thoek, 48, were married in 1985. They have three children; one son and two daughters. Two of them married and lives in separated house. The family lives in a small village along national road number two about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Khem has been a cleaner for five months. She works for a garment factory. Her husband has been a driver since he was married. The couple is in the process of building new house, but they don’t have enough money to finish it. Therefore, Khem is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to make the finishes.

loans.use: To finish her house building.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en:
Marifat M. is a small producer in the small village of Imishli city. He and his father have been raising sheep for 10 years. This provides the income that allows him to feed his parents and build a future for a future family. He decided to raise sheep because it is a very profitable business and people in Azerbaijan use meat in their meals every day.

Marifat has asked for this loan to buy more sheep in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock.

loans.use: Purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Alfred Lumbasi

texts.en:
Alfred is a 30-year-old married father blessed with three children.  He runs a motorcycle transport business located in Mautuma, a part of Eldoret.

Alfred decided he wanted to expand his business opportunities and decided to seek out a loan with KADET.  He plans to use this loan to buy a pick-up truck for transportation and to expand his other business, which is in farming.  He hopes to improve his ability to meet his family's basic needs.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to the economic empowerment of their clients across Kenya by providing financial services to improve living conditions for the micro-entrepreneurs and their children. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. You can obtain more information on KADET from their website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a pick -up truck for business transportation.

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito S. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Paquito owns and operates a business running a "sari-sari" retail store. He sells a variety of different products such as  shampoo, sugar, salt, toothpaste and sweet candies in the local community. Paquito has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $220 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Paquito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Paquito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to invest in expanding the business. Paquito is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his fifth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sopheng Pok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people who live in the Ta Reab Doun Sar village in Kandal make up this village bank loan.  Sopheng P. was selected by the members to serve as bank president.  

They will use their individual loans for different purposes.  Sopheng is a good housewife. Her husband, Dun Narith, is employed with a company. The couple has five children who are enrolled in the local schoO.. 

They face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy study materials for their children.  In order to deal with this problem, Sopheng decided to ask for a loan.

loans.use: Buy study materials for their children.

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es: La señora Gloria María
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria is very grateful for the cooperation she received on her previous loan, which she invested in a greater variety of foods for her business.

Once again, she is soliciting your cooperation for a loan to invest in the business and buy more inventory and shop furnishings, in order to give employment to two more people

With the earnings she will obtain from this new investment in her business, she plans to pay off the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INVEST IN INVENTORY AND SHOP FURNISHINGS

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr: Monsieur Jean Pierre N.  est un père de famille ,marie ,habitant dans le quartier de Dalifort .Il fait de la culture maraichère  depuis qu’il a pris sa retraite, cela  fait maintenant plus de 5 ans. Il exerce aussi l’élevage de poulets de chair qu’il vend a l’occasion des fêtes de pâques et de fin d’années. En plus du soutien financier de son fils qui vit en France il gagne en moyenne 200 000 frs mensuellement et parvient a entretenir convenablement sa famille .Monsieur N.  est expérimenté en matière de prêt a LU-IMCEC car ce n’est pas son premier crédit. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs pour augmenter son stock d’aliment de poulets de chair et faire face aux besoins urgents  de ses volailles Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mr. Jean Pierre N. is a married father who lives in the Dalifort neighborhood. He has been selling his goods at the farmers’ market since retiring over five years ago. He also raises poultry that he sells during Easter and New Year’s. In addition to the financial support from his son who lives in France, he earns on average 200,000 francs monthly and succeeds in comfortably supporting his family. Mr. N. has experience in the loaning practices at LU-IMCEC for this is not his first loan. He is seeking a loan of 400,000 francs to add to his feed stock for the poultry and to address the urgent needs of his animals. Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to reinforce working capital

loans.name: Sok Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Chea M. is 37 years old and she lives in Prey Chambak village, Takeo province. She is a silk weaver and earns some income to help support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chan Brarch, is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. 

Since her business is going well, Sok Chea wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk, and the rest of the loan she would use to support her husband's farming. 

Mrs. Sok Chea M. has five children, two of whom are silk weavers, and the others are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Lenny Achieng

texts.en:
Lenny O. is a lady from Migori who is married to Samuel O.. They have two children: Monica, who is in primary school, and Millicent, who is in high school.

Lenny is a tailor in Migori town. She has been doing this tailoring business for the last four years and has thus created a big clientele due to the fact that she normally looks out for the latest designs and this makes her beat her competitors.

Lenny is looking for a loan through KADET to enable her buy more sewing machines as well as employ one person to help with the increasing demand for clothes. She took another loan previously and repaid it well, giving her a good credit history.

Lenny intends to use the profits to educate her children to university level and to improve their living standard. Her future plan and hope is to expand her business by opening a tailoring school in her area.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and add to her stock of fabric

loans.name: Nestor

texts.fr: D. Nestor est né le 26 Février 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marié et père de cinq enfants, Nestor  vit depuis 21 ans environs au quartier Tokplégbé à Cotonou. Nestor vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Nestor n'a fréquenté que le cours primaire. Depuis près de 27 ans, Nestor fabrique et vend des statuettes au hall des arts à Cotonou. Nestor s'approvisionne à Cotonou. Nestor a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Nestor voudrait renforcer son activité et fabriquer plus de statuettes, en vue de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. C'est ce qui conduit Nestor à solliciter un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Nestor D. was born February 26, 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married and father of five children, Nestor has been living for the past 25 years in the Tokplégbé neighborhood of Cotonou. He lives there with his children and his wife, with whom he shares responsibility for family expenses. Nestor has only attended primary school. For over 27 years he has been crafting and selling statuettes at the Cotonou Arts and Crafts Hall. He gets his supplies in Cotonou. Nestor has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, and reimbursed it in full. He would like to reinforce his activity and produce more statuettes in response to customer demand. For this reason he is now requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and paint

loans.name: Dayo

texts.en: Dayo, 39 years old and well-known in her community of Ibadan, Oyo  State, Nigeria, is trained in the treatment of bones and also sells medicines.  She has three children, and her husband also works to support their home. Dayo has been in this business for two years and is now requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says a big thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 48 years old; she is married with 6 children. Her children are doing well in school and this makes her happy. Her husband is a farmer. She sells goats in the market. She has been in this business for 11 years. Grace hopes to improve her family’s standard of living. Grace is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more goats to sell. Grace says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Elena, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la Zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, ella vive en alquiler en la casa de sus padrinos, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, convive con el Sr. Roberto  que trabaja como empleado, y con el aporte de los dos mantienen a sus 2 hijos.

La Sra. Elena tiene un puesto en la Av. Tumusla este lugar es conocido en la ciudad de la paz ya que es llena de comerciantes minoristas y de comerciantes ambulantes, en su puesto de venta ofrece varios artículos en especial los de plástico, trabaja desde muy temprano hasta finalizar el día. la Sra. Elena tiene el sueño de contar más adelante con una tienda propia donde pueda vender sus productos y así mejorar su economía y calidad de vida. 

El destino del crédito es para comprar artículos de plástico, pañales desechables, cinta de embalaje y otros productos que se venden por el lugar.

La Sra. Elena esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la Otorgacion del Credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elena is 35 years old and lives in the Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz. She rents a room in her Godparents house. She has 2 children who are in school. Her partner is Mr. Roberto who works as an employee and with the contribution of their two incomes they are able to raise their 2 children. Mrs. Elena has a booth on Tumusla Avenue which is well known in the city of La Paz as it is full of small businesses and ambulatory businesses. Her booth sells a variety of articles, especially those made from plastic. She works from very early in the morning until the end of the day. Mrs. Elena’s dream is to eventually own her own store where she can sell her products and in this way improve her economic situation and her quality of life. The loan will be used to buy plastic items, disposable diapers, packing tape and other products that she sells from her booth. Mrs. Elena is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in awarding her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy plastic goods.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
John K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. He is 69 years old, married, and has six children whose ages range from two to 24 years old. John is a college graduate.
