She has applied for a $300 loan to buy chemicals and tools to use in her garden, and also to buy different types of vegetable seeds to plant. Silomiga sells her produce to shops in her village during the week, and in the town market on weekends. She earns about $38 a day during the week and more on weekends, but believes she can increase her income by buying the right tools, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools to use in a vegetable garden

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata had to find a way to support her two small children when her husband died 30 years ago. She started working at a stand at the market but had to leave it because she could not take care of her children. Hence, the idea to set up a small store out of her home was born.

Thanks to this business she has been able to provide a good education for her children and to build a house that was previously made of adobe.

Now that her children are grown, Fortunata works to support herself and to pay her household expenses. This is the reason she needs the loan to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Cuando falleció su esposo hace 30 años, Fortunata tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus dos pequeños hijos. Comenzó a trabajar en un puesto del mercado, pero lo dejó al no poder cuidar a sus hijos. Fue así como nació la idea de poner una tienda en casa.

Gracias a este negocio, pudo darles una buena educación a sus hijos y construir su casa que antes era de adobe.

Ahora que sus hijos están grandes, Fortunata trabaja para poder mantenerse y pagar los gastos de la casa. Es por esto que desea surtir más su tienda.

loans.use: Expand and stock her store

loans.name: Wakimese D(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret N.. She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to boost business. Margret is 23 years old and is married. Her husband is a hair dresser. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business.

Margret is joined in her small group by Madina N., Teo M., Rose N., and Brendah N.. Madina N. has a business running a market stall and wants to add stock. Teo M. is currently operating a poultry keeping business and wants a loan to purchase more chicks and feed. Rose N. operates a business selling matooke and wants to start purchasing in bulk. Brendah N. is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy a hair dryer.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina lives in the small Batey de Palavé community of San Cristobal. She’s the proud mother of a son who is in his twenties.

Miguelina owns and operates a cafeteria within her house. The entrepreneur explains that the cafeteria is her family’s main source of income. She would like to boost her business. Miguelina wants to increase her sales volume so as to put aside money for her son’s studies.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy various goods to supply her cafeteria.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Francisco G. currently owns a business making and selling bricks in the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. He does this with much effort, making bricks for use in construction to sell them in that sector of the municipality.

Currently, his business is facing the immediate need for materials for the production of the bricks. For this reason, Mr. G. seeks support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow him to purchase these materials and continue to run his brick business from his home in Villanueva.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Juan Francisco G. actualmente es dueño de un negocio de elaboración y venta de tejas ubicado en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a esta labor con mucho esfuerzo elaborando las tejas para construcción para ofrecerlas en el sector de ubicación en el municipio.

Actualmente la necesidad que este negocio atraviesa es la pronta inversión en los materiales para la elaboración de las tejas. Es por este motivo que el señor G. busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener crédito que le permita la compra de estos materiales y así proseguir con su negocio de tejas en su localidad de habitación en Villanueva.

loans.use: Purchase material to make bricks.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en: Jumagul S. lives in the Asht region and she is married with three children. She has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but has showed herself to be a serious client. She is engaged in the family business of livestock. She works also works on a collective farm. Mrs. S. dreams of buying a pedigree bull to increase her livestock. So she is applying with KIVA with the request of financial support for her business's development with a loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months. Mrs. S. thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Jumagul would like to buy a pedigree bull to breed.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is married, and has two children. Both children currently attend school. Augustina sells smoked fish in her village, where she has many loyal customers, who purchase the fish or soup, popularly known as Light Soup in Ghana. Augustina would like a loan to restock and improve her business, as well as continue to finance her children’s education. Augustina would like to keep her prices set and avoid raising them, but the only way she can do this is with more capital.

Augustina is also a member of a group called Isaiah. Members support one another in repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of smoked fish

loans.name: Tamasha's Warumi Group

texts.en:
Tamasha is a single woman with two children aged twelve and five years old. She also cares for someone who is 70 years old. She has owned a food vending store since 2002. Every day she works from 7am to midnight at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Tamasha now hopes for a loan to buy more food items to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses selling clothing.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Grocery Store Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. Sharif and lives a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. Nasreen baji has been living in this city for the last 15 years. She is the mother of six children: one son and five daughters. Her son is a daily wage labor. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nasreen baji's husband runs a grocery shop, with experience of 10 years. Nasreen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her husband's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sabra baji wants a loan to buy more chickens to resell. Sakina baji and Shamim baji each want a loan to buy a sewing machine. Ansar baji wants a loan to buy goats to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for the grocery shop

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita Osarinwian is a tailor. She also sells tailoring materials like zippers, landings, needles and tailoring designs. She learned how to sew clothes from a friend. Rita is 44 years old and is married with 4 children. Her eldest child is a boy and he is in a private secondary school. Rita has a store in Oba market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of $875 to buy more tailoring materials and a sewing machine. Rita makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials for sale and one sewing machine

loans.name: Mrs. Uon Khoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Four people in Sdok Prei Village in Takeo Province make up this group loan and Mrs. Uon K. is the group leader. She is a farmer and pig breeder. Since the second business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

Her husband, Mr. Eng Sok, is a recyclable goods collector who usually buys empty bottles, cans, and plastics to re-sell in recycling factory. Mrs. Uon K. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled the local school while the remaining one is too young to work or study because that child is only one year old.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla A. sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, milk and others at Elmina new market. Priscilla has received Junior high education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman. Priscilla has been selling groceries since 2006. She is responsible for assisting her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice, tin tomatoes and other groceries. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of the business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice, tin tomatoes and other groceries.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 37 years old and married and 3 children. She sells phones accessories. She travels to Onitsha to purchase phones accessories to sell in Benin City. She has been in this business for a long time. Victoria needs a loan of N70, 000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more phones accessories to sell

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mr. Sary S. is a villager who lives in Kampong Por village in Kandal province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His field, however, is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Sary S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and purchase fuel for his irrigation pump. His wife, Mrs. Yem Sokha, helps him in the plantation. Mr. Sary S. is 55 years old and the father of two children who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for an irrigation pump.

loans.name: Meyer Jhasmani

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53417
Meyer es socio del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa.
Meyer es del departamento de San Martín, soltero, tiene 23 años; su mama lo trajo cuando tenia tres años a Lima, aquí estudio hasta terminar estudios secundarios en el colegio.   
Desde los quince años vende en las calles con su mamá; él trabaja de 9 a 4 pm, vendiendo helados, de 6 a10 pm, vende golosinas y  habas. 
Meyer presenta dificultades en su salud, a los doce años se disloco la rodilla jugando fútbol, por falta de dinero no se hizo atender, ahora se cansa rápido, tiene poca fuerza en la pierna, y cada día  llega de trabajar  adolorido a su casa.
Meyer necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar golosinas,  habas y  helados.
Meyer tiene muchos sueños, quiere estudiar mecánica automotriz, comprar un moto-car y  alquilar una tienda para venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Summary of first loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53417 Meyer is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa ('Miraculous Medal') community bank. He is from the department of San Martín, 23-years old and single. At the age of 3 his mother moved him to Lima, where he studied until finishing high school. Since he was 15 Meyer has worked with his mother as a street vendor, working from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. selling ice cream, and from 6:00 to 10:00 p.m. selling candy and roasted bean snacks. Meyer suffers from health problems; when he was 12 he dislocated his knee playing soccer and didn't have the money to seek medical attention. As a result, he gets tired easily and doesn't have much strength in his leg. Every day he arrives home from work aching. Meyer needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy candy, beans, and ice cream. He has many goals and wants to study automechanics, buy a moto-car, and rent a store to sell groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy, roasted beans, and ice cream.

loans.name: Real Group

texts.es:
Este banco se denomina “REAL”, es un grupo formado de 13 personas en su mayoría integran familiares, dentro de los cuales tenemos a  08 socias mujeres y a 05 socios varones.

Nuestros socios tienen sus reuniones en las oficinas centrales en la ciudad del Cusco; cada uno de ellos tiene diferentes actividades y desean anexar a estas un nuevo proyecto que es el de formar sus pequeñas y propias empresas.

Los socios son gente emprendedora, y está es su primera etapa en este banco, desean el préstamo para poder formar un poco más de capital y realizar sus pequeñas empresas,  04 socios abrirán un restaurante de comida local,(precisamente uno de los socios, dejo una carta poder debido a que viajó por motivos de salud a la ciudad de Lima, y no aparece en la foto) para lo cuál solicitan el préstamo y así poder cubrir con los gastos que genera la misma al inicio de toda empresa, otros 3 miembros abrirán un snack café en su barrio, 3 socios mas pondrán su pequeño negocio de comida rápida y venta de jugos, 2 socias pondrán su pastelería y comida rápida, 1 socia invertirá par sus estudios de ingles.

Estos socios están muy agradecidos con el apoyo que recibirán y desean manifestar su compromiso de pagar las cuotas en los plazos determinados, hasta cancelar el total del préstamo.
texts.en:
This bank is called "REAL"; it is made up of a group of 13 people who are mainly related to each other: eight women and five men. Our members hold their meetings in the downtown offices in Cusco. Each member has different activities and they wish to add to these a new project: creating their own small companies. The members are entreprising people; this is their first time in this bank. They are asking for a loan to have a bit more capital and open their small businesses. Four members opened a restaurant selling local food. (One of the members left a note that he had to travel due to health reasons to the city of Lima and he is not in the picture). They will use the loan to pay for the expenses incurred in starting up their business. The other three members opened a snack and coffee spot in their neighbourhood. Three other members opened their small fast-food business and toy sales business; two members opened a cake shop and fast-food place, one other member paid to take English courses. These members are very grateful for your help and want to express their commitment to making the repayments on schedule, until the loan is entirely repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the security deposit on the snack bar lease, to buy dishes for the restaurant.

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr: Madame A. est une résidente du quartier d’agoè un quartier nord de la ville de lomé, cette dame a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’huile de palme qui est stocké dans des bidons. Cette huile est très utilisée dans la cuisine togolaise pour préparer des sauces telles que l’adémé, la sauce gombo, etc… elle s’approvisionne au sud du Togo où cette huile est produite. Les bonnes dames de son village s’approvisionnent chez elle. Elle veut rehausser son stock pour accroître ses bénéfices, elle sollicite de wages un crédit pour l’achat d’huile de palme. Elle est mariée avec 03 personnes à charge.
texts.en:
Ms. A. is a resident of Agoè, a district in northern Lomé. This is a lady who works to earn an income. She does commerce in palm oil, which is stored in drums. This oil is much used in the cuisine of Togo for making sauces, such as adémé sauce, okra sauce, etc.... She stocks up in southern Togo, where this oil is produced. The good women of her village get their supplies at her place. She wants to replenish her stock in order to grow her profits. She's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy palm oil. She is married and has three people to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Saidzhafar

texts.ru: Алимов Саиджафар, проживающий в районе Восе возрост 37 лет, женат имееет троих детей. Имеет среднее обоазование клиент занимается торговлей мясом на местном рыеке Хулбук этим видом деятельности занимается уже более 12 лет. На получившие деньги, клиент хочет закупить скот откормить и  перепродать в виде мясо.От получаемого  дохода клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Saidzhafar A. lives in the Vose region. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. He finished secondary school and sells meat in the local market, Xulbuk. He has been in this sort of business for more than 12 years. With the money he will receive, he wants to purchase cattle to fatten to sell for the meat. The client will support his family off the income.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for resale as meat

loans.name: Laisene

texts.en: Laisene L., 47, is married with nine children.  She has two years of experience in the plantation and vegetable garden business. She sells to the villagers and public, four days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 900 Tala (~$285 US).  SPBD loans are Laisene’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for loans with the traditional banks. She will use her loan for home improvements and business needs.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, spray garden and weed killer

loans.name: Mwajuma's Group

texts.en:
N. Mwajuma, 34, is the leader of Kweyamba group in Lugazi. She is a married lady with four children aged 15 – 7 years. She also cares for other orphans.

Mwajuma is a hardworking lady who has run her business for fifteen years. Yet she still has a dream of expanding her business more, educating her children, buying more plots of land, and so on. 

Mwajuma has been able to pay back her loan on time and, this time round, she needs a new loan to be able to buy more soft drinks to increase her stock. With the loan, she will buy more sodas, mineral water and juice from the factories for her employees to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas, mineral water and juice to increase her stock

loans.name: Ricmar

texts.en:
Ricmar G. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old. Ricmar is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ricmar sells fish to the local community. Ricmar has been engaged in his business for more than10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ricmar joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ricmar is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing net. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ricmar from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business and to support his family's basic needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net

loans.name: Adepeju

texts.en: Adepeju makes native beads worn on the hands, neck and ears. She supplies them to customers by retail. She also has a shop where she sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for over three years and needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. sells goods like panties, clothing and cosmetics at Elmina. Rebecca has received a senior high school education. She is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a captain in a boat.

Rebecca has been selling goods like panties and cosmetics since 2006. She is responsible for paying the school fees of her children and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy to buy more panties, clothing and cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to to build a house and to save the rest.

loans.use: To buy more panties, clothing and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma Q. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old. Emma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Bellie Grace

texts.en:
Bellie Grace is 26 years old. She is married to Reynaldo and he works as a farmer. The couple were blessed with two children: Dianne Faye, who is 6 years old, and Jesiekiel, who is 3 years old. Bellie Grace wanted to provide all the needs of her family, most especially to support the education of their children.  According to her, she needed to double her time looking for a better business and earn a living.  As a result, she ended up raising hogs, and she can see that it really helps their family.  

At the moment, she is now requesting business capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000.  This amount will assist her in maintaining her hog raising.  She believes that, through patience and hard work, someday she can expand her enterprise.  She hopes that lenders will grant her loan request for it will really give her hope to have a progressive life someday.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Ethelinda

texts.en: Ethelinda A. a resident of Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 54 years old, married and has five children. She makes a living running a sari sari (or variety) store, but would also like to go into a new line of business by buying fishing nets. She plans to use the income made possible by this new venture to better support her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores A. D. C., resiD. en municipio D. Ilopango del departamento D. San Salvador. María tiene 37 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. María ha montado su propio negocio desD. su casa, el cual le permite trabajar y a la vez no descuidar a sus hijos que tanto necesitan del cuido D. su madre, María maneja un inventario en productos D. belleza; como perfumes, cremas corporales, maquillaje, entre otros. El crédito que solicita María es para surtir su inventario con nueva mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Dolores A. D. C. lives in the Ilopango department in San Salvador. María, 37, lives with her husband and their three children. María set up her own business from her house. This allows her to work and take care of her children, who greatly need their mother’s care, at the same time. María maintains an inventory of beauty products like perfumes, body creams, make up, and others. The loan that María is asking for is to stock her inventory with new merchandise to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa is a 30-year-old married woman with one child. She has been working as a home-based hairdresser since 2002 to earn income to help her husband in the household. Today, Randa is requesting to borrow $1,200 to renovate the room specialized for her work to meet the demands of her clientele.

loans.use: renovate the room specialized for her work

loans.name: Lucrecia Clementina

texts.en:
Lucrecia Clementina Q. is married and has two children 16 and 19. The eldest is getting married and has suspended studies, though the younger one is still in school. Lucrecia’s primary business is the sale of various juices and soft drinks, additionally, she sells foods typical to Nicaraguans, plates with yucca and pork. Lucrecia dreams of the continued improvement of her business as a way to provide improvements to her home, like adding brick walls and a floor.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jacqueline Jerop

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 24 years and married. Her clothing business is located at Strawbuk.

She was introduced to KADET by a group member. She is planning to use the loan to purchase more clothing stock for both children and adults. Her future dreams are to expand her business.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more clothing stock.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice sells sarongs and tailoring materials at retail prices. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She is 33 years old and married with four children. With her combined businesses, she sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes for a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs and tailoring material to sell. 
She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Synzhibek's Group

texts.ru:
Чортонова Сынжибек – лидер данной группы. Сынжибек тридцать семь лет. Муж Сынжибек работает кочегаром в школе. В течение многих лет Сынжибек вместе с мужем копили деньги, чтобы приобрести хоть какую – то живность. Наконец-то их труды увенчались успехом, и они приобрели первую корову. Так как муж Сынжибек находился постоянно в школе, основные обязанности по ухаживанию за коровой легли на плечи Сынжибек. Она быстро привыкла к новому занятию и вскоре даже начала проявлять желание на счёт приобретения бычков. Она пришла к выводу, что в нынешних условиях заниматься животноводством – выгодное дело. Муж помог с новым вложением, к тому же у них появился дополнительный доход от продажи молока. И вот уже пятнадцать лет Сынжибек вместе с мужем занимаются животноводством. Они покупают бычков, откармливают их в течение года и перепродают. Теперь Сынжибек получает удовольствие от своего занятия. Ведь за пятнадцать лет, животноводство являлось источником мяса, молока и источником значительных средств при продаже скота или мяса. Также Сынжибек и её мужу удалось построить дом. Одна только продажа молока приносит им ежемесячно две тысячи четыреста сомов. Хотя, когда Сынжибек свою первую корову купила всего лишь за две тысячи сомов. Теперь Сынжибек намеревается купить телёнка для откорма и продажи. Но у Сынжибек нет наличных средств, чтобы осуществить покупку. Поэтому она и обратилась за кредитом. 

У Сынжибек три партнёра по группе:

Осмоновой Эркингуль тридцать семь лет. Она – мать двоих детей. Муж Эркингуль занимается стройкой. Сама же Эркингуль разводит скот, занимается его перепродажей, а также продажей молока. Эркингуль нужен кредит, чтобы купить телёнка.

Джузумалиевой Салтанат сорок восемь лет. У Салтанат трое детей. Супруг Салтанат – медик, работает в больнице. Салтанат дома держит скот и продаёт молоко. Салтанат надеется купить бычка. Для этого ей нужен кредит. 

Саткеевой Анаре пятьдесят лет. У Анары двое детей. Оба уже взрослые: дочь замужем и живёт со своей семьёй. Сын живёт вместе с родителями. Муж Анары – разнорабочий на стройке. Сама Анара развозит груз. Анара хочет получить кредит и купить корову. 


 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Synzhibek C. is a leader of this group. Synzhibek is thirty seven years old. Her husband works as steam engine fireman at a school. During many years Synzhibek together with her husband have been saving money so they could buy some kind of livestock. Finally, their labor efforts have been successful and they have bought their first cow. Because Synzhibek's husband is always at the school and main responsibilities for taking care of the cow have been placed on Synzhibek's shoulders. She got used to the new business quickly and soon started to show interest in getting a calf. She has concluded that in today's circumstances animal husbandry is a profitable business. Her husband helped with the new investment and they also started to get additional income from milk sales. It has been fifteen years as Synzhibek and her husband have been doing animal husbandry. They buy calves, feed them for one year and then resell. Right now Synzhibek enjoys doing her business. During these fifteen years animal husbandry has been a source of meat, milk and a substantial income from the sales of cattle and meat. Synzhibek and her husband were able to build a house. Just the milk sales alone bring them 2,400 somoni a month. Synzhibek has bought her first cow for only 2,000 somoni. Right now she is planning to buy a calf for feeding and resale, but she does not have the finances to realize her purchase. This is why she has asked for a loan. Synzhibek has three group partners: Erkingul O. is thirty three years old. She is a mother of two children. Erkingul's husband works in construction. Erkingul breeds the cattle herself and also resells it as well as sells the milk. Erkingul needs a loan to buy a calf. Saltanat D. is forty eight years old. She has three children. Saltanat's husband is a medical worker in a hospital. Saltanat keeps the cattle at home and sells the milk. She hopes to buy a calf and she needs a loan for this. Anara S. is fifty years old. Anara has two children. They are both grown ups: her daughter is married and lives with her family. Her son lives with the parents. Anara's husband does miscellaneous work in construction. Anara transports freights. She wants to get a loan to buy a cow.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calves for resale

loans.name: Rosa Ángela

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora Rosa M. se destaca por vender ropa ambulantemente en las calles del municipio ofreciéndola en diferentes lugares y exponiéndose al sol y a los días de lluvia. A su edad, ella continúa en su actividad porque ésta le genera el sustento para llevarlo a su casa de habitación y así suplir las necesidades de su hogar. 

También ella vende cosméticos los que son ofrecidos de igual manera en diferentes lugares ambulantemente. El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa y algunos cosméticos para seguir ofreciéndolos y así generar ingresos para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is known around the town of San Rafael del Sur for selling clothing from her push cart. She travels around the streets offering her product, putting herself out there rain or shine. Even at her age, she keeps at it because it provides her the support she needs to keep up her house and provide the basic household needs. She sells cosmetics, too, traveling around the same way she does with her clothing. She is seeking a loan to purchase clothing and cosmetics so she can keep on selling products and generating income to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es:
Las Azucenas es una alcancía comunal conformada por 10 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes se dedican a actividades D. comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- prosperidad desD. hace 5 años.
Julia con 43 años, conviviente, tiene 7 hijos D. 5, 9, 11, 16, 19,23 y 25 años, asume el cargo D. presidenta.
Julia y su esposo se dedican a la fabricación y comercialización D. chompas D. lana, alpaca e hilo desD. hace 12 años,  quienes con esfuerzo y dedicación  han logrado adquirir una maquina tejedora, comprar su terreno y mejorar así su nivel D. vida.
Nuestros socios con el reciente préstamo lo destinaremos para la compra D. mercadería, agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen en la puntualidad D. sus pagos.
texts.en:
Las Azucenas is a communal credit union maD. up of 10 enthusiastic and enterprising members who are dedicated to wholesale commerce. They have worked with EDAPROSPO Prosperity for 5 years.

Julia, currently the president, is 43 years old, living in a stable relationship, and has 7 children, aged 5, 9, 11, 16, 19, 23, and 25. Julia and her husband have dedicated 12 years to making and selling sweaters of wool, alpaca, and thread. With much effort and dedication they have acquired a sewing machine and bought their own land, and thus improved their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad has owned a medical shop in his town since 2008 after seeing a need for such services in the region. He has specialized in selling medical supplies and equipment. He is a 52-year-old single man, living alone. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase new medical supplies for inventory in his shop.

loans.use: purchase new medical supplies

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores S. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, widowed, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Dolores owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Dolores has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2001, Dolores joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her tenth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken for her business and a canoe motor for her husband's crab fishing business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie N. is a 48-year-old woman living in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and the mother of four children. Madame N. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 13 years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Madame N. raises sheep, which she sells on the grand agricultural market of nearby Bambey. She has a lot of experience in this domain and will use this loan to buy 10 young sheep. The revenues from selling them at the market allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To puchase young sheep for sale.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati K. lives and works in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo. She is 45 years old, married to a taxi driver, and has one child. Mrs. K. has been running her business from home since 2002. She sells a variety of grocery products as well as charcoal. This will be her first loan from WAGES which she will use to replenish her supply of groceries and charcoal.  Approximately 75% of the total amount will go towards the purchase of charcoal and the remainder will be used to purchase any groceries needed for resale. With this loan, Mrs. K. will be able to keep her shelves full of food and her tins full of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and grocery supplies

loans.name: Veronica Renee

texts.es:
La Sra. Veronica tiene 41 años D. edad, vive en la Zona villa Santiago I en la ciudad D. El Alto en un domicilio familiar. Ella está casada con el Sr. Hernan que es empleado D. una gasolinera ubicada en la zona D. San Pedro, tienen 3 hijos a los cuales aun mantienen, este es el segundo ciclo que trabaja, anteriormente ya saco la misma suma para la compra D. un equipo D. sonido para su hogar, la sra. Veronica se siente satisfecha por trabajar con el credito Kiva otorgado por Emprender es por eso que solicitó la renovación del crédito
Doña Veronica tiene una tienda D. artefactos electricos ubicada en la calle Eloy Salmon D. la zona Gran Poder, este lugar es muy conocido en la ciudad ya que venden artefactos electricos, camaras digitales, celulares, etc el destino del credito es para comprar unas máquinas D. afeitar que se encuentran en promoción. Esta muy agradecida cxon Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Veronica is 41 and lives in a residence in the Villa Santiago area in the city of El Alto. She is married to Mr. Hernan, who is employed at a gasoline station in San Pedro. They have three children whom they still support. This is the second loan cycle for Veronica. Previously, she borrowed the same amount to buy a sound system for her home. She is pleased with the results of having received a Kiva loan through Kiva partner Emprender, and she is seeking a new loan for this reason. Veronica owns an electric shop located in Eloy Salmon Street in the Gran Poder area. This location is well known in the city as a place where electric fixtures, digital cameras, cell phones, etc., are sold. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase electric shavers that are on sale. Veronica is very grateful to Kiva and field partner Emprender for the confidence she gets from being granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electrical appliances.

loans.name: Pedro Alberto

texts.pt:
Pedro Alberto M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 47 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 15, 08 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu da província de Maputo, actualmente encontra se a residir no bairro da Machava. Trabalha como docente, é do quadro do Ministério da Educação ha mais de 29 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.999.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar cerca de 800.00mt na sua conta Bancária.
Ja teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito Tchuma, mais tarde não continuou. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, varões de ferro, mão de obra  e outros) para concluir com a construção da sua residência.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para a construção do murro de vedação e sanitários.
texts.en:
Pedro Alberto M. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique. He is 47 years old, married, and the father of 3 children who are 15, 8, and 6 years old. All go to school. He only finished 12 grade and did not continue due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and supports one nephew who lives with them. He has never left Maputo province; Pedro Alberto currently resides in the Machava sector. He works as an instructor and has been on the staff of the Ministry of Education for more than 29 years. He does not have any employees and earns a salary of 5,999 MZN each month, which he uses to pay for household expenses. He even manages to save about 800 MZN in his bank account. Pedro Alberto has had loans with the Tchuma credit cooperative, but did not continue with them later on. He found out about Hluvuku through co-workers who are also clients of this institution. This is his 1st loan [with Hluvuku], which has a value of 17,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy construction material (cement, iron rods, etc.) and to pay for labor in order to finish building his home. He promises to pay off the loan on time so he will be able to have access to others. In the future, he intends to request more loans to build a protection wall and bathrooms.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, iron rods, etc.) and pay for labor

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: La señora Sandra es madre de familia de una hija,  su esposo labora como jardinero, juntos han logrado hacer la casa de concreto, su negocio es la venta de cosa de horno, que día a día labora en su casa de habitación, hay días en donde las ventas son bajas, pero otros lo superan, con la entrada del invierno baja el maíz lo que permite hacer el producto mas grande y al mismo precio lo que genera buenas ventas. Con este financiamiento invertirá en comprar ropa usada para obtener mejores beneficios de sus ventas en conjunto. Ya que la canasta básica esta cara, los pagos  básicos, de luz, agua, es por eso desea invertir más para poder equilibrar sus costos.
texts.en:
Sandra has a daughter. Her husband works as a gardener. Together they have built a concrete house. Her business is selling baked goods. Day to day she works in her home. There are days when sales are low, but other days they are excellent. With the start of winter, corn is down. This allows her to make a larger product for the same price, which generates good sales. She will use this loan to buy used clothes to get better benefits from her joint sales. Basic food items and expenses for light and water are expensive. That is why she wants to invest more in order to be able to stabilize her costs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothes to increase her production of bakes good to improve sales

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 59-year-old widowed lady with nine children.  She has been able to raise and educate her children with the income from her Thomazen Kenya shop.  She makes soap and detergents and sells them in her shop.  In addition, she sells sodas to supplement her income. She has employed three people to whom she pays wages. 

As a business lady, Sylvia has learnt how to manage her money by saving in a group called 'Transparency' in Faulu Kenya.  She has requested a loan of Kes. 60, 000 from Faulu Kenya and has been guaranteed by the group members.  With the loan, she plans to buy materials for making soap. She hopes to enlarge her business and get more customers in the future.  Slyvia describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making soap

loans.name: Rehemah

texts.en:
Residing in a rented one-roomed house with no access to electricity or piped water, Rehemah, who is a married mother of two children, both attending school, also takes care of her mother.

Rehemah owns a stall in Kawempe selling chicken, a business she has operated for ten years, and works seven days a week. Using public transport, she buys chicken from poultry farmers in Kawempe Maganjo and Kazo areas in Kawempe Division. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken, and she aspires to invest in a second-hand clothing business.

Rehemah joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting additional capital. Her greatest monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 40 años de edad, ella vive con Santos su esposo de 47 años de edad y sus dos hijos. Todos juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de joyas como: aretes, collares en variedad de colores y diseños, que son del gusto de la mayoría del cliente. Carmen durante toda su vida ha realizado variedad de oficios y ahora con esta actividad le es más conveniente por que le permite dedicarse a su hogar. Su gran poder de convencimiento es una de las armas que tiene para poder vender la mercadería que posee. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio mucho más grande donde pueda ofrecer tranquilamente la joyería que tiene. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará joyas en cantidad y diversidad para así lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old. She lives with her 47 year old husband Santos and their two children. They all live together in their own home. She sells jewellry such as earrings and necklaces in a variety of colours and designs, which appeal to most of the customers. All her life, Carmen has worked at a variety of jobs and finds this one the most convenient because it lets her focus on her home. Her great power of persuasion is one of the tools she uses to sell her merchandise. In the future, she'd like to have a much larger store where she could offer her jewellery more quietly. This is her first loan with MFP and she has committed to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy a greater quantity and diversity of jewellery to be able to make better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
The young man shown in the photo is Mr. Lang K., 22, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish in and around the Tunle Sap River. He catches around 10 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market.

Lang’s wife’s name is Sinath; she is 20 and works with him in the fishing business. The young couple is blessed with two young kids who are still not enrolled in school.

Lang will use his loan to purchase nets, traps, and other fishing equipment so that he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann A. is a married woman who lives in San Jose, Taytayan, Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: wholesaling electronic reloading credits, fattening pigs and operating a tricycle transportation business. Her husband Vicente A. Jr., who is 40 years old, works as a forwarder (Margie's Door to Door Services) to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child, who is 17 years old. Mary Ann joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Ann has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to pay for more load (mobile-phone credits) so that she could continue to save up for future, build her own house and widen their pig-fattening business. Mary Ann A. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase of load (mobile-phone credits) and materials to sell

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda S. is a widow who lives in Barangay Ticad, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a food-vending business. She has eleven children aged between 22 and 42 years. Alfreda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past twelve loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Alfreda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 56,000, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, Alfreda is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business, while some she gave to her daughter who is looking for a job, and some she will continue to save for future capital and for tuition fees. Alfreda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell and to assist her daughter

loans.name: Dionesia's Group

texts.en: Dionesia K. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Dionesia is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Millions. Dionesia is married and has an adult child. To make a living, Dionesia owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Dionesia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Dionesia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Dionesia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish, meat, bags of rice, salt, seasoning, cooking oil, onions etc

loans.name: Silvia Dinora

texts.es:
Doña Silvia tiene 44 años D. edad y resiD. en el Departamento D. Usulután junto a su familia y sus hijos tienen las edades entre 17 y 25 años, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas y meriendas desD. hace 12 años sus hijas le ayudan a atender el negocio ya que lo hacen en un horario D. 10:00am a 4:30 pm; según cuenta la señora tiene bastante demanda y desea reforzar el negocio comprado mercadería por lo que hoy solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la inversión y aumentar su producción .
Su objetivo es tener un buen record crediticio para contar con esta ayuda e ir progresando con el negocio y mejorando su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Silvia, 44, lives in Usulután department with her family.  Her children are between 17 and 25 years old.  

She has sold tortillas and lunches for 12 years.  Her daughters help her tend to the business which is in operation from 10am until 4:30pm.  According to what she tell us, demand is high and she wants to strengthen the business buying merchandise for which she is asking for funds that will make this investment possible thus increasing production.

Her goal is to attain a good credit history so that she can count on this support and make progress with the business thus helping to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Adonis De Jesús

texts.es: El Sr. Adonis de Jesús J. M. es trabajador Activo para la Empresa ULTRA DE NICARAGUA S.A  desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad tiene dos  años de trabajar para esta empresa, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para ampliarle a su negocio de recarga de teléfono movistar y claro, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Adonis de Jesús J. M. is an active employee of a company called Ultra de Nicaragua, S.A., where he has been working as a security guard for the past two years. He is married and currently has two school age children. Adonis has had two loan with CEPRODEL that were used to buy construction materials to expand and improve his home. With the loan he is currently requesting, he wants to expand his business of selling rechargeable phone cards from Movistar and Claro.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit and will help him improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: Operating capital for his rechargeable phone card business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana se dedica desde hace cinco años al comercio de ganado ovino el cual trae desde la localidad de Morochata donde los venden por cantidad  y lo comercia en pie como también carneado en la localidad de Quillacollo, tiene dos hijos un niño de doce años y otra de ocho, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como chofer de camión, solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo y para hacer la obra fina de su casita ya que esta haciendo construir con mucho sacrificio, su esposo también le ayuda en su actividad  transportando el ganado, es una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
For the past five years, Sra. Juana has been selling sheep that she brings in from the town of Morochata. She sells the animals in quantity or by the piece since she also operates a slaughterhouse in the town of Quillacollo. Juana has two children, a twelve year old son and an eight year old daughter. Her husband works as a truck driver.

Juana is requesting a loan to use as operating capital and to begin the work on her house that she is building with great sacrifice. Her husband helps with her business by transporting the animals. Juana is a hardworking individual.

loans.use: Operating capital for her business & funding for the construction of her home

loans.name: Nelida Isabel

texts.es:
Nelida es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad, tiene tres hijos dependientes, reside en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega situada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace dos años y durante este tiempo se ha hecho bastante conocida entre los vecinos de la zona, los que siempre acuden a su negocio porqye prefieren la calidad de productos y el buen trato que ofrece.

Nelida desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio, en especial durante la temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Nelida is a 46-year-old mother of three children and lives in the district of Lamayeque, an area with quite a lot of commercial movement located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She runs a small bodega out of her home where she offers a wide variety of products, including primary-need items and groceries, to her customers for daily consumption. She has dedicated herself to this activity for the past two years, during which time she has become well known among her neighbors, who always visit her business because they prefer the quality of her products and her good customer service. Nelida wants to acquire more products to expand her business, especially during Christmastime when demand is typically high. To achieve this objective, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles.

loans.use: Purchase products to expand business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 31 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 33 años, que es chofer, y sus dos pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de diversos comestibles y productos de primera necesidad, en su tienda que esta ubicada en su casa. El tiempo le ha permitido adquirir mayor variedad de mercadería, además de buenos clientes que prefieren  comprar en su tienda de comestibles, pues la zona por donde vive es algo alejada. Le gusta mucho su labor pues le permite obtener considerables ganancias, sin descuidar su labor de madre, y por esta razón esta muy satisfecha pues ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Así transcurren los días de Carmen que se da un tiempo para atender su negocio y también para educar a sus hijos, además como es muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio pues quiere ofrecer mayor cantidad de comestibles a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Carmen tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en panetones, chocolates y algunos comestibles que desea ofrecer a sus clientes para la campaña navideña que se encuentra próxima.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 31, lives in her own house with her 33 year old husband, José, and their two children.  José is a driver.  Together they work hard each day to get ahead.  This hard-working woman sells various foods and basic needs items.  She sells them in her store, which is in her house.  Time has allowed her to get a greater variety of merchandise and good customers who prefer to shop at her food store.  The area where she lives is fairly remote.

She really likes her work.  It allows her to earn considerable income without neglecting her work as a mother.  That is the reason she is very satisfied.  She helps her husband with the household expenses.  Carmen’s days consist of spending some time taking care of her business and also bringing up her children.  Also, as she is very enterprising, in the future she plans to expand her business site.  She wants to offer a greater quantity of food to her customers.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She does not want to disappoint the people who made this help possible.  It allows her to continue working in the pursuit of progress.

Carmen plans to use the requested loan to buy merchandise like “panettones” (sweet breads typically sold at Christmas), chocolates, and some food that she wishes to offer her customers for the Christmas season, which is coming soon.

loans.use: To buy panettones, chocolates, and some food products

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a una hija en el sector Chosica del Norte del distrito de La Victoria, una zona marginal poblada por personas bastante trabajadoras, en su mayoría son obreros y comerciantes. El lugar pertenece al distrito de La Victoria y se encuentra ubicado a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de uso diario y abarrotes. Francisca siempre trata de ofrecer productos de buena calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes, con lo que su clientela está fidelizada. Adicionalmente comercializa golosinas en los recreos de una de las instituciones educativas de su localidad. Su esposo se dedica a la fabricación y comercialización de muebles y con los ingresos que ambos perciben tratan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Francisca desea ampliar su bodega adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1500 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Fransicsa, 37, is a mother living with her husband and daughter in the Chosica del Norte sector of La Victoria district, a marginal area inhabited by very hard working people who are mostly laborers and merchants.  The place belongs to the La Victoria district and is located fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small establishment in her house where she sells various daily use items and groceries.  Francisca always tries to stock good quality products and provide good customer service which has led to a stable customer base.  In addition, she sells sweets during recess at a local school. Her husband is a furniture maker and with the income both earn they strive to support the family.

Francisca wants to expand her store acquiring more products to that she can meet current customer demand.  She, therefore, has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan she plans to use to reach this objective.

loans.use: To buy more stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Adelsy is a single mother with four children. She shares her home with her father, in a house made of cement block, in a village structured as a Batey, a small town surrounded by sugar cane fields, in San Pedro. Bateyes are poor rural communities built by sugar companies to house their field workers. Over time, conditions in these communities have deteriorated heavily and houses are in poor shape. Bateyes typically lack potable water, any kind of reliable electricity and sufficient medical services.

Adelsy is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres en Accion (Women in Action), groups 1 & 2 of around 7 other groups in her community. Most of the members of these groups are Haitians immigrants or part Dominicans, and Adelsy's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally.

Adelsy operates a comedor (a small neighborhood restaurant), where she cooks lunch, with sugar cane workers as her main customers. She will invest this loan to buy vegetables, rice, oil, and other goods to prepare the lunches. She hopes that with profits from her business she can eventually purchase her own home. Adelsy also looks forward to continuing to develop her business which allows her to support her children and raise them with good health and education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, rice and other goods

loans.name: Martiniana

texts.en:
Martiniana Y. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 50 years old. Martiniana is married and has six children. Four of her children are still going to school. To make a living, Martiniana raises crops, primarily rice, for sale. Martiniana wishes for her children to have bright futures.

Martiniana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and  living situation. Martiniana is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be the first loan taken out by Martiniana from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides its clients credit, but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Thin

texts.en:
Living in the province of Kompong Chhnang, Thin M., a 47 year-old married woman  tries to earn a living by cultivating crops on her own farmland. She and her husband have spent most their life time farming. They grow rice crop following the rainy season and the dry season. The couple has received great success from their farming business year after year. 

Thin M. has five single children, and one who is married. Two of them are working in different occupation to earn incomes. Her daughter works in the garment factory and has no vehicle to ride to her job location. When she needs to go to work, she has to rent a motor taxi. To resolve this problem, Thin M. is requesting a Kiva loan for her daughter to purchase a motorbike to ride to her place of work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to ride to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To reinvest in her boutique

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Jocelyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a general store. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase goods like rice and corn grits, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk and coffee . This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase goods like rice and corn grits, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of manure and to hire laborers to help her with the sowing.

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene  2 hijos dependientes. Vive junto a su familia en un caserio del distrito de Tambogrande, na zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Se dedica a la crianza de ovinos y aves de corral como pavos y gallinas. Los cria en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Una vez que los engorda los comercializa en el mercado local. Ademas cuenta con un pequeño terreno agricola donde tiene sembrado limon el cual cosecha semanalmente  Tiene una antigüedad de mas de 3 años en su negocio. Solicita un credito para la compra de alimentos para engorde de ovinos y aves de corral y para la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón. Desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable, lo que la ayudará mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, is married and has 2 dependent children. They all live in a tiny village in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area around Piura, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region. She lives in the rural part of this district and does not have basic services. 

She raises sheep and poultry such as turkeys and chickens in a pen behind her house. Once she fattens them up, she sells them in the local market. In addition, she has a small farm where she has planted lemon trees which she harvests every week. She has more than 3 years' experience in her business. She is requesting the loan in order to buy commercial feeds to fatten her sheep and poultry, and to buy fertilizers for her lemon grove. She wants to continue investing in her business in order to achieve an adequate income, so she can help improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase commercial feed for her animals and fertilizers for her lemon grove

loans.name: Batsukh

texts.en:
Mr.Batsukh is 57 years old and a veterinarian. He has been working as a veterinarian for 31 years. His wife used to run a bakery shop making bread, but now she is planning to help with her husband’s business. 

Mr.Batsukh recently decided to run a veterinary business by opening a shop to treat animals and selling medicine for animals. He has already done some business planning and found a place to rent. Currently he is planning to do some proper restoration work on the building. The loan he is applying for will be used to buy necessary building materials and to do restoration work on the veterinarian shop.

loans.use: To buy necessary building materials and repair the veterinary shop which he is renting.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng C. is a 39-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom still go to school. Heng C. is a professional teacher at a local school in Kompong Cham province. She is a salaried employee. Her husband earns a daily income by driving his motor taxi, and his income helps assist Heng C. with the family expenses. Heng C. seeks a loan from Kiva to build a new cage and to buy pig-food, chicken-feed, piglets and chicken for raising. She will sell them out when they grow up.

loans.use: to build a new cage, and buy pig-food, chicken-feed, piglets and chicken for raising.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad, from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City, is 42 years old, married and has four grown children. To make a living, Felicidad owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Felicidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her fifth loan for 17000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. Felicidad plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages.

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dolores de oficio administradora labora en una empresa privada, pues es el apoyo de sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera. 
Como objetivo ha sido la mejora a su casa, en donde ha venido reparando atreves de los años, hoy con Afodenic ha avanzado más rápido ya que se beneficia con los plazos, ya que tiene que cubrir otros gastos.
Con este nuevo préstamo será para comenzar hacer la cocina de concreto en donde comprara: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, piedrín. Teniendo mejor espacio, y una cocina en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Dolores works as an administrator in a private company, and is a single mother that supports her children.  She seeks credit to improve her housing conditions by making various repairs, and a loan from Afodenic will allow her to begin her project to build a better kitchen by obtaining construction materials such as cement blocks, sand, iron and stones.  Once finished, this will greatly improve her family's kitchen and living space.

loans.use: to buy cement for housing repairs

loans.name: 3 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyên  has a service business cutting hair. She is requesting a loan to remodel her shop.

Tuyên  is 65 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 7.1.3 Phú Sơn  solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Tuyên's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyên  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tuyên  faces in her business is her lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyên  hopes to improve her quality of life and to help her children in their work.

loans.use: to remodel the barber shop.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio forma parte del banco comunal “Brisas Marinas”, perteneciente a la comuna de Calbuco, ciudad de Puerto Montt.
El se dedica al rubro del comercio, vendiendo ropa nueva exclusivamente para niños y niñas. La temporada de más alta demanda en su negocio es durante el mes de abril hasta el mes de septiembre. Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago una vez al mes. Patricio ofrece sus productos por internet, a través de las conocidas páginas sociales. Sus clientes frecuentes son aproximadamente 20 a 30 personas, ellos solicitan y compran sus productos en su mismo domicilio.
Con el crédito comprará poleras manga larga y polerones para niños.
Su meta es instalar su negocio en un local establecido, además de ser reconocido en el rubro y poder brindarles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.
Patricio vive junto a su esposa, su hija de 6 años de edad y sus suegros. 
Las motivaciones de continuar con su negocio son para brindarle a su familia una calidad de vida más confortable.
Patricio está muy agradecido del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, además comenta que el grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy unido y solidario. 
Calbuco, es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, en la región de Los Lagos. Su  origen etimológico es del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) y significa "aguas azules". Es un archipiélago conformado por 12  islas. Su economía está basada fundamentalmente en la extracción de los productos del mar. En la actualidad existen numerosas fábricas de conservas, centros de cultivos de salmones, ostras, choros etc.
