texts.en:
Patricio is a member of the "Brisas Marinas" (Sea Breezes) community bank which is located in Calbuco, in the city of Puerto Montt.

Patricio is a salesman who sells new clothes for boys and girls.  The peak season for his business is from the month of April through the month of September.  He buys his merchandise in the city of Santiago once a month.  He sells his products through the Internet, through well-known social pages.  He has approximately 20 to 30 regular customers who request and buy his products from their own home.

Patricio will use his loan to buy children's long sleeve t-shirts and hoodies.  His goals are to set up his business in established premises, to become well known in his field and to be able to provide his customers with a better range of products.

Patricio lives together with his wife, his 6 year-old daughter, and his in-laws.  His motivation to keep working in his business is the desire to provide his family with a more comfortable quality of life.

Patricio is very grateful for the support he has been offered by Fondo Esperanza.  He comments that the community bank he belongs to is very united and supportive.

Calbuco is a town which is located in the south of Chile, in the Los Lagos region.  The etymological origin of the name comes from Mapudungan (the langugage of the Mapuche).  It means 'blue waters'.  This is an archipelago which is made up of 12 islands.  Its economy is mainly based on extracting products from the sea.  There are currently many canning factories and also salmon, oyster and mussel farms.

loans.use: to buy children's long sleeve t-shirts and hoodies

loans.name: Elmer Alfredo

texts.es:
Elmer, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, él trabaja en la siembra de hortalizas, aprendió a sembrar con su abuelo hace 20 años, actualmente este trabajo es el que le permite llevar la alimentación a su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, pues está sembrando hortalizas para lo que solicita un financiamiento que cubra los gastos del tratamiento para el cultivo.
Su aspiración es tener una buena siembra, que de buenos frutos, que sea abundante, y que le ayude para comercializar a buen precio la producción.
texts.en:
Elmer is a farmer.  He lives with his wife and their children.  He grows vegetables.  He learned how to do this from his grandfather 20 years ago.  This work is now what allows him to feed his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy natural and chemical fertilizers.  He is planting vegetables, and he is requesting a loan to cover the expenses of treatment for his crops.

His aspiration is to have a good harvest with good, abundant fruits that help him sell his production for a good price.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers for his vegetable crops.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 28 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Rose has a beauty salon, which she has had for seven years.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  

In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business.    Rose is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on groceries

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
El Señor Pablino tiene 32 años de edad, está soltero. Don Pablino se dedica a la venta de teléfonos celulares y accesorios para los mismos. Está en este rubro hace más de 6 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2005, comenzó estudiando esta profesión en una institución reconocida de la ciudad, y de allí se fue haciendo camino hasta poder tener su propio local, de forma independiente.
Comenta que el rubro al que se dedica tiene mucho movimiento, además de competencia, ya que con el tema de los teléfonos siempre hay mucha demanda. Dice que genera buenos ingresos por medio de su local, por lo que en la actualidad tiene un familiar trabajando con el, ya que tiene muchos clientes. Le gustaría poder seguir creciendo y desea forma dar trabajo a más personas en su comunidad.
El solicita el crédito para ala compra de celulares y repuestos para los mismos, ya que tiene muchos pedidos, además de teléfonos que necesitan ser reparados. Agradece a la Fundación por esta oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablino is 32 and single.  He sells cell phones and accessories, and has been in business for over six years, since 2005 approximately.  He learned about this profession when he studied at a well-known institution in the city.  He worked his way up to having his own independent store.

He claims the sector is very active and there is a lot of competition as well as a lot of demand.  His shop generates considerable income so he has a relative working with him to attend to the many customers.  He wants to continue growing so he can provide more work for people in the community.

He is requesting a loan to buy cell phones and repair parts since he has many orders for both new phones and repair work.  He is grateful to the Fundación for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy telephones and repair parts.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a hardworking businessman aged 40. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last four years, he has been operating a retail shop to earn a living. He has managed to boost his business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya. He also earns extra income from dairy farming. In the next five years, he wants to buy a piece of land. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, soap, rice, maize flour and sodas.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, rice, maize flour and sodas.

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en: Waheed is a 29-year-old young man. He is married and has two sons. He owns a barber shop which is the only source of income for the family. Waheed wants to expand his shop and make some repairs and improvements on the inside. Also, he wants to purchase a new barber kit including items such as a shaving kit, hair products, etc. but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for it, so he needs to take out a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Waheed takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase a new barber kit and make the necessary repairs in his shop. This will impact his work positively and he will work extra to get a better income in order to live in better conditions with his family. Waheed is photographed in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase a new barber kit and to make some repairs to his shop.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba sells meat pies by peddling in the vicinity of Abura. She has received high school education. She is divorced and has 3 children. Her meat pie business is about 3 years old. She sees to the well-being of her home. 

Araba will use her loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients. She hopes to use the profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is 57 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and six daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard. 

Be supports her family by making doors and windows. She started her business over 3 years ago. She intends to take a loan to invest in her business by buying more materials to increase her production of doors and windows. 

Be hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and can save enough money for her family's emergencies.

loans.use: To buy more materials to increase her production of doors and windows.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Tomas tiene 28 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad Ollantaytambo y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Tomas es la venta de comida y tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado por las mañana sirve desayuno, al medio día sirve almuerzo y por las noche elabora pollos a la brasa con papitas fritas. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Tomas requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del local ya que se están acercandose la época de lluvias pues el techo esta con goteras.
 
Tomas agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Tomas belongs to the communal bank “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo”. The members of the communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Ollantaytambo in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Tomas is 28 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which he has 2 children. He was born in the city of Ollantaytambo and lives in the same city he was born in and where he carries out his economic activities. Tomas' main business is selling food and he has a restaurant in a rented property. In the morning he serves breakfast, at noon lunch and in the evening he makes roasted chickens with chips. He has had the business for 3 years and is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

This time Tomas needs the loan for building maintenance as the rainy season is fast approaching and the roof is leaking.

Tomas is grateful for and values the loan and agrees to make his repayments on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to carry out building maintenance.

loans.name: Bumate Kweyimukya Women Group

texts.en: John is a 39-year-old married man with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children and improve on the living conditions of his family. He is currently running a motorcycle business and this has helped him to provide for his family. His challenge is high fuel costs and his dream is a car. John needs the loan to pay school fees for his children. One of the group members in the photo did not take the loan.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур примерный семьянин женат, отец четверых детей. Его старший сын помогает ему в бизнесе. А занимается он постройкой решеток для виноградников из арматуры. Бизнес востребованы, так как на селе у всех есть виноградные поля. Он хочет создать хорошие условия для дальнейшего обучения своих детей в ВУЗах. Место деятельности у него дома, никаких расходов по транспортировке у него нет. Он хочет получить займ для закупа сырья и просит займ в размере 1000$ США. Он надеется на милосердие добрых людей и благодарен вам всем за помощь.
texts.en: Bahodur is an exemplary family man, who is married and is father of four children.  His oldest son helps him with the business.  Bahodur is involved in constructing barred fence fixtures for vineyards.  This business is in demand because their village has vineyards.  Bahodur wants to create good conditions for his children's continued education in universities.  His place of business is at home, and, thus, he has no transportation expenses.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of raw materials.  Bahodur relies on the mercy of kind people and is grateful to all of you for the help.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Mauzu

texts.en:
Mauzu is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling bread in Kator, South Sudan, for six years.

Mauzu requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread to sell. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread for resale.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito is married and is a responsible father of two children. He is involved in farming where he lives his family. He grows corns for sale and wishes to yield many crops for the next harvesting season. For him to achieve his goal, he is requesting a loan amount of P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. He hopes that through this loan amount he can grow his desired crops. By this means, he hopes to then save for the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is 59 years old and married with three children. She sells furniture in the central market and has more than 20 years of experience in this field. Latifa sells home furniture. This is very popular for dowry products among brides and newly married families.
 
Latifa tries to keep up with demand and always purchases different styles of furniture. Her monthly profit is 50 AZN. Her husband helps her to sell furniture.

Latifa needs to invest more capital in her business to purchase more furniture and diversify her products.  For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN.  This will be her third loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture and diversify products

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is single and has 4 children.  She sells fanti kenkey at Mbem near Abura, which she has done for 10 years. Efua uses her income to help her husband to pay their children's school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase bulk maize to prepare her kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ayetuah plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Nohemí

texts.en:
Nohemi is a single mother and has three children, two of them are women and the other one is a man, they are studying. Nohemi live with her family and started her business three years ago, she started her own business because she had to maintain her family and also she had a family member who was sick and she had to support all necessities of her family. She began her business when a friend of her invited her to sell cosmetics articles house by house and she had success because Nohemi is a good saleswoman and has talent to do this kind of business, so she opened her mind and saw that she could sell other kind of things so she started to sell clothes by orders, and little by little her demand began to grow.

Nohemi thinks purchase merchandise in a great quantities because do it this she could offers her merchandise to her clients in a lower prices and for that reason she is requesting for a loan of USD $ 275 and make this investment and also can grow up in her business. She offers to repay the loan in a term of 4 – 8 months.

\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Nohemí es madre soltera con tres hijos, dos de ellas son mujeres y el tercero es un hombrecito, los tres están en estudiando. Nohemí vive con su familia y empezó su negocio hace tres años atrás, justo por la necesidad de sacar a su familia adelante y por que también tuvo a un familiar que se enfermo y tuvo que ver por el. Cuando se inició fue invitada por una amiga a la venta de cosméticos de casa en casa y le fue bien ya que ella es una buena vendedora, entonces al ver que tenía talento para las ventas ella no solo se quedo con ese negocio de los cosméticos, sino que también empezó a incursionar en la venta de ropa a pedido, y poco a poco fue teniendo buena aceptación entre sus clientes.

Nohemí piensa comprar mercancía al por mayor para así poder otorgar mejores precios a sus clientes obteniendo también buenas utilidades de este ahorro en la compra, ya que al por mayor le dan la mercancía a un mejor precio, por ello esta solicitando un préstamo de USD $ 275 para realizar esta inversión y poder sacar a su familia adelante y seguir creciendo con su negocio. Ofrece pagar el crédito en un plazo de 4 -8 meses.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics articles

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is 45 years old and a mother of 9 children, some of whom are in school. Even though she is married, her husband is not earning any income to support the household expenditures. She therefore sells some household items to support herself and the children as well as her husband. These items include bread, suger, washing detergents and charcoal.

Having participated in KRABAN'S 'TEACH' learning sessions last year, she is in a better position to manage the loan from KIVA if granted.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Kinh

texts.en:
Kinh is 34 and his wife Hong is 37 years old. They have 3 children; two, aged fourteen and five, are going to school. Mr Kinh suffers from stomach problems and he has to pay $5 per month for medical treatment.

The family have only about 5000 square meters of land to plant corn and rice. Besides that, they use the land around their house to plant various vegetables. Their living depends on this activity so they need a loan to buy fertilizer.

They borrowed $50 which increased their income by about $1/person/month. Their average income is low at $7/person/month. They want to borrow $75 for fertilizer.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Agbo-Komi

texts.fr:
Born in 1978 in Amégnran (VO Prefecture, Togo), Mr. Agbo-Komi B. still lives in that same village and does motorcycle repair there. He is married and father of two, as well as being responsible for nephews, cousins, and nieces. It is the income from his motorcycle repair work that supports him and his extended family. The quality of this dynamic gentleman's work had earned him a large clientele, however, when his repair shop was devastated by a storm, his income dropped considerably as his clientele dispersed. In order to reestablish himself and regain his client base, he is asking for a loan of $1200 to outfit a new workshop. He is confident that this entreprise will be very remunerative since he will be able to win back his old clients and new ones as well.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1978 à Amégnran (Préfecture de VO), Monsieur B. Agbo-Komi vit dans le même village et exerce son activité de mécanique moto. Marié et père de deux (2) et à sa charge d'autres neveux, cousins et nièces. C'est à l'aide de cette activité qu'il arrive à prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Très dymanique, la qualité de ses prestations lui a vallu une clientèle importante. Mais depuis que son atelier est ravagé par un orage, son revenu a considérablement chuté à cause de la dispersion de la clientèle. Pour sa stabilité et la mise en confiance de cette clientèle, il sollicite un apport financier de $1200 pour remonter un nouvel atelier et l'équiper. Il est très confiant que ce projet lui sera très rentable dans la mesure où il va récupérer ses clients et d'autres encore.

loans.use: open and equip a new repair shop

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: I am Najma S. and I have 25 years of experience in making plastic flower bouquets. After my husband’s death, this has been our only source of income, which provides for my family. My two sons and their wives also help me in this business. Over the past four years, I have taken out loans to purchase larger amounts of flowers and have been making progressively better profits each time.  However, the income we earn is still not enough to send our grandchildren to school.  With my sons and daughters-in-law helping me, I would like to further expand my productivity and hence need a loan of $325 to purchase more raw materials.

loans.use: To expand her business in order to earn more money to send her grandchildren to school

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth U. is 57 years old and lives in Benin City; she is married and has children. She sells drinks. She learned the business from her sister and started her own business in 2002. She is seeking a loan of $1,175 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell. She is a member of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy Udoh is 38 yrs old, married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO member, and she sells cloth, tailoring materials, hat materials and other materials. She also makes hat, beads, and sews cloth for people. This is a business started in 1997. She is requesting for a loan of $600 to buy more cloth, hat and tailoring material to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cloth, hat material and other materials

loans.name: Lucy's Garden Group

texts.en:
Lucy, age 48, is the single parent of 3 children (ages 18, 20 and 22). She runs a nursery school for small children, which she started in July 1998. She works managing the school from 7:30am to 5pm daily. This business brings her a monthly profit of about $70. She has a dream of starting a primary school one day.

In the past, Lucy took out a loan to buy aluminum for the roof of the school. Having paid this loan back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan to increase her school's services. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in food, clothing, and timber sales.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Lourdes Patricia

texts.es:
"I have a "casa de interes social" (a publicly-subsidized house) where I live alone with my daughter. I'd like, bit by bit, to fix it up. I want to start by installing "vitropiso" (tiled flooring) so I can keep the floors cleaner. I worked many years to get this house and I want to leave it to my daughter. I'm asking for US$550 to install vitropiso in my house."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

“Tengo una casa de interés social, vivo sola con mi hija y me gustaría poco a poco ir arreglándola pero quiero empezar por ponerle vitropiso ya que así podré mantenerla más limpia, trabaje muchos años para que me dieran esta vivienda y es el patrimonio de mi hija” Solicito $ 550.00 dlls para poner Vitropiso en mi casa.

loans.use: Install tile flooring.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama G. works on the docks of the Elmina fishing village.  She is married to a security guard and has 2 children.  To help support her family she buys fish from fishermen and sells them to her customers.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish as well as equipment to cook and smoke the fish.

Ama is the group leader of a lending group called “Nkor Ma Ahoto Traders”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy more fish as well as equipment to cook and smoke the fish.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en:
María Del Carmen, a single mother of four school-going children, lives in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal, her hometown.

María Del Carmen has a lot of experience in running a business. She had been owner and operator of a grocery store, an auto repair shop and other small businesses.

Currently, she is running a clothing store. People visit her store each day to purchase fashionable pants, shirts, slippers, beauty products and the like.

The entrepreneur wants to increase her earnings from the business. With her loan, she will buy products that are running low in the store and also new products in order to attract new people.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of clothing to supply a small business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Ms. R. has been working with our institution for the last four years. She has obtained six loans which she has used as working capital. Growth in her business is apparent since her business has diversified and she now sells natural medicine. She is a single mother and has a son who is ill. She lives in her own home where she also has her business. Because Ms. R. was out, her employee is shown in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora R. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace cuatro años obteniendo seis creditos los que ha utilizado para capital de trabajo, se puede observar crecimiento en su negocio ya que ha tenido un crecimiento considerable, actualmente ha diversificado el negocio ya que tambien vende medicina natural, Es madre soltera tiene un hijo el cual es enfermo vive en casa propia donde tiene su negocio. en la foto aparece un empleado que ella tiene en su ngocio ya que ella estaba fuera

loans.use: Working capital to purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom K. lives in the Asht region and she is married with three children. She has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but she has showed herself to be a serious client. She is engaged in the family business of livestock. She works also on a collective farm. Mrs. K. dreams of buying a pedigree bull to increase her livestock. So she has applied for a loan with KIVA for financial support. She's asked for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 8 months. Mrs. K. thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Dilorom would like to buy a pedigree bull for breeding.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a savvy entrepreneur selling women’s clothing at one of the local markets in Kherson. In the twelve years she has had her business, she has gained valuable experience and insight into running a successful business. She sells a variety of clothing and is careful to offfer the best products she can. She watches what other vendors are selling then tries to distinguish her business by selling different products. Currently, Tatyana has about $10,000 in inventory.

This has been a big help to Tatyana and her family. She has already repaid 17 loans to Nadiya Ukraine. Tatyana has requested a loan of 3,000 Grivnas so that she can purchase additional inventory for her business. She would like to increase the selection of clothes sizes she has available and buy seasonal clothing in bulk for the busy summer season.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her clothes store

loans.name: Lot

texts.en:
Mr. Lot M., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Ry Sim, 34, live in a small village off of National Road #2 south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have six children: one son and five daughters. Three of their children are in school and one daughter is a garment factory worker.

Mrs. Lot has been a motor taxi driver for eighteen years. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh City. His wife has been selling Khmer noodle and gruel in the village for over one year. Lot's motorcycle is broken and he needs to install a new one but he lacks the money for buying it. So, he is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a new motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir (his son is pictured ) was born in 1958. This man has been in the farming business for 8 years. He lives in Khachmaz town. Zakir is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the fertilizer and pesticides necessary for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María Cristina C. nació en la ciudad de Santa Rosa Misiones, esta casada hace mas de diez años con Francisco Aquino con quien tuvo dos hijos que hoy trabajan en el exterior.

Ella es comerciante, tiene un comedor frente a su domicilio negocio que la ayuda para el ingreso familiar, ahí ella vende comidas rápidas, también ofrece desayunos, almuerzos entre otras cosas. Sus principales clientes son los trabajadores de la zona.

Ella desea adquirir el crédito para invertir en la ampliación y mejora de su local comercial.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina C. was born in the city of Santa Rosa Misiones and she has been married to Francisco Aquino, with whom she has 2 kids who now work abroad, for 10 years.

She is a saleswoman and she has a diner opposite her house, and it is a business which helps the family's income. She sells fast foods as well as breakfasts, lunches and other things. Her main clients are workers from the area.

She would like to get a credit to invest in enlarging and improving her store.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refit her business/Refracción de su negocio.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin K., 26, buys rice and sells it for profit, earning around $5 per day. She is married to Mr. Kol Kung, 33, who has business of providing rechargeable battery services, earning around $3 per day. She has three children, all of whom are small. The family lives in Kroyea Commune, Kampong Thom Province. To expand their business for another source income, Kin needs a loan of 3000000 Riel to purchase a motorcycle washing machine to use for business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle washing machine to use for business

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: La Sr. Karla tiene 31 años de edad,  habita en villa reconciliación de la ciudad de Managua, es casada y concibió tres adorados hijos de 1, 9 y 15 años de edad, dos los tiene estudiando en una escuela del barrio. Trabaja de sol a sol con su esposo en ventas de hierro en su casa ya que es una forma de cuidar a sus hijos y trabajar. Inicio recogiendo aluminio, hierro y todo tipo de chatarra en la calle con carreta de caballo, ahora tiene una camioneta. Con la solicitud del préstamo va a comprar mas materiales para ofrecer a sus clientes siempre variedad ya  con esta solicitud es la novena, y ha sido de gran beneficio para su negocio.  Sus planes son tener una ferretería grande y fuerte en la venta de productos de construcción sobre la pista principal. Por medio de los préstamos de Afodenic lograra aumentar sus ventas y a la vez sus ingresos y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Karla is 31; lives in Villa Reconciliación in the city of Managua; is married; and has 3 children whom she adores, who are 1, 9, and 15. Two are studying in the school in the neighborhood. She works from sun up to sun down with her husband selling iron out of her home, so she can care for her children and work. She started by collecting aluminum, iron, and all types of scrap metal off of the street with a horse cart. Now she has a small truck. With the money from this loan, she is going to buy more materials to offer to her customers so she will always have a variety. This is her ninth loan, and the loans have been of great benefit to her business. Her plans are to have a large hardware store to sell construction products along the main highway. Through these loans from Afodenic, she will succeed in raising her sales and her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase iron materials

loans.name: Lucila Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sr. Lucia tiene 58 años de edad, habitante del barrio 380, casada su esposo trabaja como taxista lo cual es trabajo agotador ya que anda por toda la ciudad en la capital de Managua, y a veces la gente no quiere tomar el servicio de taxi, por que andan con el dinero completo, pero es una ayuda económica mas para la casa. Sus planes es crear un futuro mejor económico y social para sus hijos, 
Doña  lucia se desempeña como auxiliar de enfermería desde hace doce años de experiencia laboral y vendedora de cosmético, zapatos, ropa y prendas inicio su negocio con ingreso propios ya son ocho años en el campo de venta lo cuales son de crecimiento y aumento de utilidad. Sus metas en corto plazo es la construcción de su casa, unos detalles en su cocina asegurando a su familia.  
Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra la compra los materiales para la culminación de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old. She lives in the 380 neighborhood. Her husband works as a taxi driver, a very exhausting job traveling around the entire city of Managua. It is sometimes hard to find clients as people don’t want to that a cab because they don’t have enough money, but the job still helps support their home economy. Their long term plan is to create a better economic and social environment for their children. Lucia has worked as an auxiliary nurse for twelve years, but she also sells cosmetics, shoes and clothes. She started her business out of her own money eight years ago, and it has been growing since then, having a very positive impact on her home economy. Her short term goal is to make home improvements, especially in the kitchen so her family can be more comfortable. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans, she will be able to purchase construction material to finish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material for home improvements

loans.name: Kiwedde-Amina Mohamad Group

texts.en:
N. Bageya (far left) is a 42 years old married of 4 children. Just like her group members, she is a hardworking hairdresser in Pallisa with skills  in plaiting, weaving, braiding, retouch and treatment. The loan proceeds are enabling Bageya boost her 7 years business by purchasing hair additions and treatments. 

Her profit margin lies at approximately 30% of the revenues. Her ambition is to open up a cereals store in her locality. It is the income from the business that pays for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Purchasing hair additions and treatments.

loans.name: Ande Liguéye Group

texts.fr: Depuis une dizaine d’années, les femmes du groupement évoluent dans le domaine de la teinture. Elles possèdent leur propre matériel de teinture et disposent de leur atelier. De plus, elles ont renforcé leurs compétences en suivant plusieurs formations de teinture. A Mékhé, cette activité est en pleine expansion et un marché est à pourvoir. C’est pourquoi, le projet de teinture représente une réelle opportunité. Ce projet permettra d’acheter les matières premières (tissus et les produits de teinture) en grande quantité qu'elles vont teindre et vendre dans les marchés environnants pour fair valoir leur savoir-faire artisanal dans le domaine de la teinture.
texts.en:
For twelve years, the women of the group have been advancing in the field of dyes and tinting cloth. They own their own dyeing equipment and have their own workshop. In addition, they have enhanced their skills by taking several training course in this trade. In Mékhé, this business is actively expanding, and there is a market to be served. This is why the dye project represents a real opportunity. This project will allow the purchasing of raw materials (cloth and dye-related products) in large quantities. The group members are going to dye their materials and sell them in the surrounding marketplaces in order to put their artisanal know-how to good use.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dyes and tinting work

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio B. works on a farm. He has a small rice field which he tills to support his family needs. He is 58 years old and has 9 children. He started his farm business in 1991 using his 3-hectare land. His harvest benefited his family, especially his children, in paying their tuition and books. Her wife Eva also grows crops on their farm. Together, they work hard to provide their children a future.

Eusebio is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. In this way, he believes he will increase his yield. When that happens, he will increase the support for his family.

CEVI provides Eusebio credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage. These help him grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 33-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Hassan has been working as a car repairer for twelve years. He also sells spare parts. Hassan requested a loan of $1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase spare car parts for his garage. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan.
Hassan is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his garage. Hassan decided on doing this business because of his experience; he also needed to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts for his garage.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria’s occupation for more than 15 years has consisted of raising pigs, and she has learned this work from her parents ever since she was a child. She owns 20 pigs at this time but soon she will increase their number. Taking into account that the price for fodder is lower at the moment, Maria aims to acquire a lot of fodder. Maria is doing all the necessary activities – producing, examining, selling, etc. The pork is sold at markets in the towns of Balti and Vulcanesti. The price of pork in that region is constant and high. For the future, Maria aims to increase the number of pigs she has from 20 at this time to 50.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 35 years old, married, and has three children aged 16, 10 and 4. She also looks after one additional dependent. Mwanahawa has been a perfumes and khanga seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to Mapatano group loan (Group code 2070). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $95. She works at her business for 12 hours daily.
 
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more perfumes and khanga for sale to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase, and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes and khanga for sale to improve her business

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is 36 years old and lives in Saida, south Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. He has been selling used furniture for ten years and also works as a furniture mover.  Khalil's clients can be anyone.  Khalil has requested a loan of $2200 from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance on his truck and to purchase used furniture.  

Khalil has been a loan client for nine years now and has always paid on time.  His previous loan helped him improve his business as well as his financiA. situation.  When Khalil first started this business he had difficulty convincing people to purchase used furniture and his financiA. status was also less secure.  Khalil chose this business because he was convinced that it would succeed since not everyone can afford to buy new furniture.  In the future, Khalil hopes to expand his business by opening a warehouse.

loans.use: For maintenance work on his truck and to purchase used furniture

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.en:
Eulogio is a farmer. He is married to Elsa D. G. and they have two children: Emerson is 15 years old and in the first year of college while Richard is 21 years old and works as a teacher. His wife manages a dry-goods business and sells second-hand clothes. They are living harmoniously in Barangay St. Tomas in Alicia, Isabela, which it is a rural village where most of the residents till rice fields as their major source of income. 

He was encouraged to request a loan of PHP 13,000.00 due to his need of financial support. The amount will enable him to buy his needed farming inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and insecticiD.. He further said that through hard work, he will become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Adewusi

texts.en:
B. is 37 years old and married with two children. She sells materials for making beads and also makes and sells them herself. She has been in business for two years now. Her weekend is spent training people on how to make beads.

B. needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase bead-making materials for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more bead-making materials to sell

loans.name: Peragia's Group

texts.en:
N. Peragia, 50 years old, is a hard working and determined widow. She cares for her 5 children who are all in school and she also cares for 2 dependants. 

Peragia has sold produce in Rushaka Trading Centre for over 10 years. She sells produce from her farm and buys produce from farmers in the villages using her loans to avoid shortages. The secret behind her success is the commitment and loyalty she has toward those she serves and works with.

She is now in a position to make a profit of 400,000 shillings per month. She requests a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale.  

Peragia says that although the father of her children is long gone, she has managed to have a happy family amidst all odds and this gives her fulfillment in life.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce for resale.

loans.name: Uktamchon

texts.ru: Уктамчон Шамсиддинов проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 26 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Уктамчон, имеет высшее образование. Он более 2 лет работал "экономистом". В данный момент он занимается ратениводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи и продает их на рынке. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Кредит просит для обработки 10га земли и повторного посева.
texts.en:
Uktamchon S. lives in the Yavan district. He is 26 years old, married and has 2 children. Uktamchon has a higher education. He worked as an economist for over 2 years. Currently, he is involved in horticulture. He primarily grows vegetables and sells them at a market. He has been involved in this business for over 5 years. He is requesting a loan for processing 10ha of land and second sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Land processing for sowing

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn F. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a "sari-sari" or general store. She sells both food and daily use products in this local community store and has been engaged in her business for over a year, earning approximately 2,500 PHP a month..

In 2009, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay tuition for her children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar H. S. reside en Apopa municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Julio vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales tres de ellos son menores de edad y estudiantes, solo su hijo mayo de 20 años de edad trabaja como mecánico. Julio posee un taller de hojalatería donde elabora diversos moldes en lata, el crédito que solicta Julio es para comprar mayor cantidad de letra que permita producir mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is a very diligent entrepreneur from the village of Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Isaias and is very determined in helping her husband in uplifting their living condition to be able to give their three children a better future. Two of her children have already finished their college education and are presently applying for a job while the youngest is still studying in the secondary level of education.

Paulita manages a food-vending business in front of their house. She cooks different viands (tasty dishes) and some snacks to generate income that will help them meet their daily needs and support the education of their youngest. Her husband, on the other hand, cultivates their land twice a year by planting rice and some vegetables.

Paulita is now asking to borrow PHP 15,000 from Kiva lenders to be used as additional capital for her business. She is positive that lenders will grant her the financial assistance that she needs. She always believes that hard work and patience are some of the factors that will make her business grow and enable her to become successful.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

location.town: Ineangan Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Taghrid

texts.en: Taghrid is a 38-year-old married woman with one child. She has owned an accessories shop since 2001 called "Taghrid". Today, Taghrid is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional accessories and merchandise for her shop to meet the requirement of her clients and make a good income for her family.

loans.use: purchase additional accessories and merchandise

loans.name: Saly Seydou

texts.fr: Saly Seydou S., 51 ans, mariée, avec 5 enfants en charge dont 2 qui vont à l'école est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans. Elle y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle rembourse toujours sans difficulté. Elle développe une activité de vente de "nététou" (produit alimentaire locale)et des balais artisanaux. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille, telle que la dépense quotidienne, la santé des enfants et leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Saly Seydou S. is 51 years old, married and has 5 children, 2 of which attend school. She has been a member for 7 years of Banc Villageois (or "Village Bank") of TENGHORY DIAMALAYE. She has been the beneficiary of 14 loans which she repayed without difficulty. She is developing a business selling "nététou" ( a type of grain and a local food product) and artisanal brushes. She is an important caretaker of her family taking responsability for daily money matters as well as her childrens' health and their schooling.

Translated from French by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her small business selling local food products and artisanal brushes

loans.name: Ngone

texts.fr: Madame Ngone B. est membre de la caisse de OUAKAM DEPUIS UNE dizaine d années.C est une femme dynamique qui collabore positivement avec la caisse.Elle est même parvenu a faire adhérer tous ses enfants a la caisse.Elle a déjà bénéficié de 4 crédits qui lui ont permis de construire étape par étape des chambres qui sont destines a la location.Actuellement elle dispose de 6 chambres qui lui génère des revenus.La maison qui abrite ces chambres lui a été acquise par héritage de ses parents.C est une veuve qui a en charge un enfant mineur ainsi que sa mère.Le reste de ses enfants sont majeurs.L objet de son crédit est la construction de chambres qui lui permettront d accroitre ses revenus et d améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Ainsi elle pourra renforcer son épargne et en cas de besoin résoudre les problèmes ponctuels.
texts.en:
Ms. Ngone B. has been a member of the Ouakam fund for about ten years. She is a dynamic woman who has collaborated positively with the fund. She has even managed to get all her children to join the fund. She has already benefited from four previous loans that allowed her to build, in stages, some rooms that are destined to be rented out. Currently, she has six rooms that provide her with income. The house that contains these rooms was passed down to her from her parents. She is a widow who has one young child in her care, as well as her mother. The rest of her children are grown up. The goal of this loan is to build more rooms, which will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. In this way, she will be able to strengthen her savings and, in times of need, resolve occasional problems.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build rooms for rent

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is a 66-year-old widowed mother of ten children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Afia is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She sells at the market square in her community and supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. Afia buys the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over 30 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish

loans.name: Tolulope

texts.en: Tolulope, a 45-year-old married mother of two children, sells foodstuffs and food spices at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, which she has operated for a long time, Tolulope hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members.  She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn J. is from the village of Rosebelt, Iligan City. She is 38 years old. Merlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merlyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Blass Group

texts.es:
En este año nuevo el grupo Blas integrado por Elizabeth Martínez, Rosa G. y Luisa Emilia desean seguir laborando para que sus negocios crezcan. Es por está razón que ellas desde los primeros días de este año trabajaran arduamente. 

Elizabeth Martínez es la coordinadora del grupo y comercializa cosméticos de distintas marcas. Mientras su compañera Rosa G. tiene una panadería la cual en estos días posee muchos pedidos de pan, tortas y repostería para está época por ello invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes como  leche, levadura, harina, huevo entre otros.

De la misma manera Luisa Emilia L. tiene pedidos  de carne  para este 31 de diciembre y los primeros días de enero ya que gran parte de la población realiza los típicos nacatamales para esta fecha, el relleno…etc.
texts.en:
In this new year the Blas group consisting of Elizabeth Martínez, Rosa G. and Luisa Emilia wish to continue working in order to make their businesses grow. For this reason they will work hard from the first days of this new year. Elizabeth Martínez is the coordinator of the group and she sells various brands of cosmetics. Her colleague Rosa G. has a bakery where these days she has many order of bread, cakes and desserts for this seasn and she will invest in buying ingredients such as milk, yeast, flour, egg and others. Likewise Luisa Emilia L. has order of meat for December 341 and the first days of January as many people make nacatamales (a traditional steamed corn cake) during this time period, stuffing, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics, baking ingredients, meat

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene ocho hijos de los cuales cuatro son independientes y los demás están en el colegio. La ciudad de Rayanniyoc esta ubicado a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Luisa se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y mandar a sus hijos menores al colegio. Luisa se dedica a la venta de cereales. La socia nos cuenta que los días miércoles, viernes y domingos vende sus productos en el mercado de Urubamba y los sábados lleva sus productos a la ciudad del Cusco y los vende en el mercado “Molino II”. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Luisa requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como trigo, tarwi  y muchos cereales más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the Villa Rayanniyoc Community Bank which is part of Kiva partner’s Arariwa Association. She is 50 years old, married, and has eight children, four of whom are independent and the others are in school. The town of Rayanniyoc is located about 30 minutes from Cusco. Luisa gets up very early to do the household chores such as prepare breakfast and get her younger children off to school. Her job is selling grain. On Wednesdays, Fridays, and Sundays she sells the grain in Urubamba market, and on Saturdays she takes it to Cusco and sells in the Molino II market there. She’s been doing this for several years, and all has gone well thanks to the effort she puts in to her work. She requires a loan to buy more products such as wheat, tarwi (Andean bean), and many other grains. Lucia is grateful for the opportunity to get this type of loan and promises to make the repayments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more grains such as wheat, tarwi etc

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en:
Abiola is 30 years old and married and she has three children. Her youngest child is only 2 months old. Her husband is a sales representative and he also supports their home. She is a LAPO client. 

Abiola sells jewelry at retail prices to make a living. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says "thank you" and promises to repay her Kiva loan promptly.

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 48-year-old single woman who runs a mixed farm near Kitale, Kenya. She has three children, ages 13, 26, and 28, with her youngest child still in school. She has been farming for more than ten years, and earns most of her income by selling maize and beans in the local markets. She also earns extra income from her part-time involvement in the local timber business. She says that the main challenges she faces in her work are high fluctuation in market prices and increasingly high competition for sales.

Jacinta requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 20,000 to start her own poultry business, in an effort to diversify her production. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her family in many ways, including supporting her youngest child in finishing school. She said that with enough effort on her part, she will be able to successfully expand her business and take care of her family's basic needs, now and in the future.

Jacinta is thus far pleased with her first foray into microfinance, and she hopes that she will continue to be funded so that she can be empowered as a woman in Kenya.

loans.use: To start a poultry business

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is very concerned about the growth of her business and that of her family. She sells charcoal to make a living in Lagos state. Charcoal is made from burnt wood and it is used for roasting and cooking food. She has been in the business for some years. 

She wants to expand the size of her business, so she is requesting a loan of 150,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more charcoal to sell. She said this will attract a discount, reduce her cost of transportation and maximize her profit.  

Dorcas is 35 years old and married with two children, who are 5 and 7 years old. She hopes to assist her husband in educating the children and improving their living standards. She is grateful to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta  vive en la zona Villa Alemania, ubicada en una zona de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es casada y vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo el cual posee una panadería  ubicada en su mismo domicilio; gracias a sus ahorros lograron adquirir una movilidad de transporte interprovincial la  cual por el trabajo constante requiere reparaciones.

Trabaja  en la venta de pan, que ellos mismos elaboran. 


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de un motor a medio uso y otros repuestos que necesita para el normal funcionamiento de su vehiculo. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Vicenta lives in the Villa Alemania region, which is located in an area of the city of El Alto. She is married and lives in her own house with her husband. He has a bakery, which is located in their house. Thanks to their savings they were able to acquire a vehicle for inter-province transportation. It needs repairs because it is constantly used. She works selling bread that they both make. The loan is to buy a used motor and other replacement parts that they need for the normal functioning of their vehicle. It is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motor and other replacement parts for the minibus they bought for inter-province transportation

loans.name: Esperanza Estela

texts.es: Doña Esperanza Estela posee un negocio que es la elaboración de dulces en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 40 años que se dedica a este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes dicen que son muy deliciosos, con su esfuerzo logro sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues ha demostrado ser una mujer muy admirable ya que  a su edad es muy difícil mantener un negocio. Ella realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas de igual manera. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como azúcar, leche, dulce, leña entre otros productos. Su deseo es mejorar cada día la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Esperanza Estela’s business is making sweets in her house. She has been in this business for 40 years. Most of her customers say they are very delicious. Through her effort she was able to get her children ahead. She has shown herself to be a very admirable woman. At her age it is very difficult to maintain a business. She makes her purchases with cash, and she sells the same way. She is requesting this loan to buy raw material like sugar, milk, sweetener, and firewood, among other products. Her wish is to improve the quality of her products each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: God Is In Control Group

texts.en:
Rose C. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Is In Control. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children who range from 5 to 10 years old. Rose was only able to attend school through junior high due to a lack of support.

For five years, Rose has been selling provisional goods such as sugar, candles, batteries, milk, and tea at the Duport Road Market, which is near Monrovia, Liberia. She says that she talks to her customers in a friendly manner and meets their demands, which keeps customers returning.

Rose plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more provisional goods for her shop. Her dream is to expand her business and return home to Nigeria one day.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Rose is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase addtional provisional goods such as sugar, candles, batteries, milk, and tea  for her shop.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata D. est 29 ans et une mère célibataire d'un enfant. Elle a été avec IMCEC depuis 5 ans déjà et a pris 3 prêts. Avec son quatrième prêt, elle voudrait continuer à développer son entreprise de confection. Elle achète du tissu provenant du principal marché de Ziguinchor appelée Boucotte pour fabriquer des vetements pour les femmes, notamment des robes. Elle peut acheter 5 mètres de tissu pour environ $20, ce qui rendra 1-2 robes. Avec 5 ans d'expérience, elle a une clientèle fidèle dans son quartier et les villages environnants. Avec ses bénéfices, elle continuera à soutenir son enfant.
texts.en:
Fatouma D., 29 years old, is a single mother with one child. She has been with IMCEC for five years already and obtained loans three times in the past. With her fourth loan, she would like to expand her garment-making business. She purchases fabrics at the main market of Ziguinchor, called Boucotte, in order to make women’s garments, especially dresses. She can buy 5 meters [5.5 yards] of fabric for about $20; this is enough to make 1-2 dresses. She has five years of experience in this work and a loyal customer base in her neighborhood as well as in the villages nearby. She will use the revenue to continue supporting her child.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric for making garments

loans.name: Yojana

texts.es: Yojana tiene  24 años, vive  con su madre y su hijo en casa de un familiar. Hace mas de 10 años vende granos, como: maíz, quinua, cebada y éstos son adquiridos al por mayor para luego ser vendidos en ferias comerciales de su localidad, así como de otros lugares aledaños a su zona. Paralelo a ello, se dedica a la crianza de cerdo y vaca, que son comercializados luego de varios meses de alimentación para así ofrecerlo a un precio mayor del inicial. Su madre siempre la acompaña en realizar esta tarea, de esa manera logra conseguir el sustento económico. Eligió vender granos, debido a que sus compradores pagan un buen precio  por cada kilo que vende y eso le  trae buenas ganancias por lo que quiere comercializar en mayor cantidad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su grupo comunal, se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de granos para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Yojana is 24 and lives with her mother and child in the house of a family member. For 10 years she has sold grains, such as corn, quinoa and barley which she buys wholesale and sells in local commercial markets and other nearby locations. She also raises pigs and cows, which she buys and then sells at higher prices after feeding them for several months. Her mother always helps her with this work; this is how they sustain themselves economically. Yojana chose to sell grains because her customers pay a good price for every kilo she sells, and this gives her a good income to invest in more stock. This is her first loan with MFP; she was invited to become part of her community group. She promises to be very responsible with her repayments, and thanks those who support her loan. It will be very helpful in the growth of her business. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of more grains to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of grains

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 31-year-old lady who runs a Mini Boutique Shop.  Her business is two years old and has one employee.  She also does car hire to earn extra income.  She is an active member of 'Keen Ventures' in Faulu Kenya and she has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 through the group.  She plans to install car track and anti-theft gadgets on her vehicle.  Emily, a mother of two, hopes to expand her business and buy many cars for hire in the future.

loans.use: To install car track and anti-theft gadgets

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Bancomunal Manantial, tiene 58 años, es madre de 4 hijos, el mayor tiene 34 años y el último 25 años. Maximiliana se dedica a la venta de pescados como son jurel, bonito, lisa y merluza, tambien vende choros, pota, pulpo y cangrejo. Maximiliana se dedica a este oficio desde hace 5 años, la mayor dificultad que tuvo en su negoció es cuando bajan los precios de los pescados o cuando escasea, en estos casos sube el precio y la gente no quiere comprar. Por ello Maximiliana tambien tiene una tienda de regalos que esta implementando con variados productos, el préstamo que esta solicitando lo va ha invertir en la compra de peluches y relojes para su tienda.
Las capacitaciones que recibe de su bancomunal la han hecho una mejor madre y esposa, agradece por los prestamos recibidos porque son de gran ayuda cuando ella necesita. El sueño de Maximiliana es poder construir su casa de material noble para poder vivir comodamente.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, 58, is a member of the Manantial (The Spring) communal bank. She has 4 children. The oldest is 34 and the youngest is 25. Maximiliana sells fish and seafood. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. The biggest obstacle she faces in her business is when fish prices fall or when fish is scarce prices rise and people don’t want to buy. Because of this, Maximiliana also has a gift shop that she is stocking with assorted products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy stuffed toys and watches for her store. The training she has gotten in her communal bank has made her a better wife and mother. She is grateful for the loans obtained because they are of great help to her when she needs them. Maximiliana’s dream is to be able to build her house out of substantial materials in order to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stuffed toys and watches.

loans.name: Las Aretillas Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA LAS ARETILLAS. ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN, TETELA DEL VOLCAN, EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 4 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN Y SON VECINOS. ESTE ES SU PRIMER PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION REALIDAD.
LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO SE LLAMA CELIA M. F., TIENE 43 AÑOS ESTUDIO HASTA EL 6º. AÑO DE PRIMARIA, TIENE 3 HIJOS 1 HOMBRE Y 2 MUJERES (EUDOCIO TENE 28 AÑOS Y TRABAJA EN LOS ESTADOS UNIDOS, MIRIAM TIENE 20 AÑOS Y HERMINIA TIENE 16 AÑOS ACABA DE TERMINAR DE ESTUDIAR LA SECUNDARIA.
CELIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE REFRESCOS Y CHICHARRONES EN SU CASA EN RANCHO LOS TEJOCOTES, SU CASA ESTÁ EN LAS ULTIMAS CASAS DEL CERRO Y SOLICITO SU PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR REFRESCOS POR CAJA DE LAS MARCAS: "JARRITO Y RED COLA" DE 2 LITRO, ACEITE, AZUCAR, CHICHARRONES. COMENTA QUE INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 2 AÑOS, SU HIJO QUE ESTA EN LOS ESTADOS UNIDOS LE ENVIO DINERO Y DECIDIO COMPRAR REFRESCOS Y CHICHARRONES PARA COMENZAR CON LA VENTA.
SUS CLIENTES SON SUS VECINOS QUE SE VAN A TRABAJAR AL CAMPO PASAN A COMPRAR REFRESCOS O CHICHARRONES, LE AYUDAN SUS HIJAS CON EL NEGOCIO YA QUE LO CONSIDERAN IMPORTANTE PORQUE DE AHÍ TIENE INGRESOS PARA LA COMIDA Y LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA, ESTA MUY CONTENTA CON EL PRESTAMO QUE LE DIERON Y ESPERA VER SU NEGOCIO MAS SURTIDO, MAS GRANDE. EN SU PUEBLO DE HUEYAPAN HAY MUCHA VEGETACION, PINOS, ARBOLES FRUTALES COMO PERA, MANZANA, DURAZNO, CAPULIN, TEJOCOTE, EL CLIMA ES TEMPLADO Y TAMBIEN HAY ANIMALES
LOS DEMÁS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON:
*HERLINDA P. A. VA A COMPRA PLANTAS FRUTALES, CIRUELA, DURAZNO, MANZANA PARA PLANTAR
* YOLANDA A. C. VA A COMPRAR ABONO, INSECTICIDA POR KILO Y POR BULTO PARA DARLE MANTENIMIENTO A SUS ÁRBOLES FRUTALES
*JUDITH M. P. VA A COMRAR BORREGOS Y CERDOS CHICOS PARA CRIANZA Y VENTA
LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO QUIEREN DECIR A KIVA Y A FUNDACION REALIDAD “AGRADECEMOS EL APOYO Y CONFIANZA QUE NOS ESTAN PROPORCIONADO CON SU PRESTAMO, GRACIAS”
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Las Aretillas. It is located in the Hueyapan community, Tetela del Volcan, in the state of Morelos. The group is comprised of four members who are neighbors and know each other. This is their first loan with the Fundación Realidad. Celia M. F. is the group’s representative. She is 43 years old, and she has a sixth grade education. She has three children, one boy and two girls. Eudocio is 28 years old and works in the United States. Miriam is 20 years old. Herminia is 16 years old, and she just finished high school. Celia sells soft drinks and “chicharrones” (fried pork rinds) in her house in Rancho Los Tejocotes. Her house is one of the last houses on the hill. She requested her loan to buy cases of soft drinks; the brands Jarrito and Red Cola in the two liter size; oil, sugar, and chicarrones. She says that she started her business two years ago. Her son that is in the United States sent her money, and she decided to buy soft drinks and chicarrones in order to start selling. Her customers are her neighbors. When they go to work in the fields they pass by and purchase soft drinks or chicharrones. Her daughters help her with the business because they realize it is important. That is where they get income for food and the household expenses. She is very happy with the loan she was given. She expects to see her business bigger and better stocked. In her community of Hueyapan there is a lot of vegetation and pine trees. There are also fruit trees like pear, apple, peach, cherry, and “tejocote” (Mexican hawthorn). The climate is mild, and there are also animals. The other members of the group are: *Herlinda P. A.: Will buy cherry, peach, and apple plants to plant *Yolanda A. C.: Will buy fertilizer and insecticide by the kilo and in bulk to provide maintenance to her fruit trees *Judith M. P.: Will buy young sheep and pigs to raise and sell The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “We appreciate your faith in us and the support you are providing us with the loan. Thank you.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, oil, sugar, and "chicharrones" (fried pork rinds)

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 30 years old and married to a policeman.  She is blessed with two daughters, aged 10 and 1.  She owns and operates Mabel N. Knitting Shop where she sells cosmetics and jewelry and provides knitting services. She has engaged in the business for two years.  She is also employed as a primary school teacher. 

Mabel was previously employed as a quality assurance inspector.  She joined 'Mercy' group in Faulu Kenya so as to access loans.  She has requested her first loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  With the loan, she will purchase knitting thread and jewelry.  She hopes to expand her business and employ many people.  She describes herself as sociable and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy knitting thread and jewelry

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is an active member and treasurer of Kelelwa Socham Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She has been practising mixed farming for 5 years and has employed one farmhand. Her farm produces pinneapples, which she sells to the local market.

Agnes is 32 years old and a single mother of 2 children, ages 5 and 8. Both children attend school.

Agnes has requested this loan, from Juhudi Kilimo, of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Her biggest challenge has been lack of good market and the unpredictable prices in the market.

In future, she would like to purchase a car for transport. She is grateful to Juhudi for the support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en:
L. Nghiêm Thị is 49 years old living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has one school-aged child. Nghiêm has a butcher shop from which she butchers and sells pork to the local community. She has been in business for over 17 years and earns approximately 2,800,000 VND a month.

In 2007 Nghiêm joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid her previous L. of 6,944,000 VND from SEDA that she used to invest in expanding her business. Nghiêm is now requesting a new L. of 8,736,000 VND that will also be used to invest in the business. The L. will be the fifth L. taken out by her from SEDA. She plans to use all additional revenue to expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English and Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. L. Nghiêm Thị (20201020043) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 1 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương. L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 17 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 2.800.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2007, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet T. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 41 years old. Juliet is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet sells fish in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. The education of her children is Juliet's main reason for managing the business. In 2009, Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Juliet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hortencia  Nelson

texts.pt:
Hortência Nelson M. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 5 filhos maiores de idade. Fez somente 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa de aluguer com seus filhos e ainda sustenta sua mãe que vive com ela.

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo com a sua mãe ainda muito nova. Trabalha numa empresa como contratada ha mais de 3 anos, tem um salario mensal de 2.850.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pregos, pedra, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência de forma a sair da casa de aluguer.

O seu sonho é poder concluir a sua casa para poder viver na casa própria com a sua família. Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir sua obra.
texts.en:
Hortencia Nelson M. was born in the district of Manjacaze, in the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. She has 5 grown children. She only studied through 7th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives with her children in a rented house and helps support her mother, who lives with them.

Hortencia left Gaza for Maputo with her mother when she was still quite young. She has worked on contract for a business for more than 3 years, with a monthly salary of 2850 Meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and occasionally saves some in her bank account as well.
