Hortencia has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 10,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, bricks, stone, sand and other items) in order to continue working on the construction of her home and move out of the house she is renting.

Hortencia's dream is to finish with the construction and live in her own home with her family. She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan as indicated and take out another loan to finish the job.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, bricks, stone, sand and other items)

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 44, wants a loan to pay school fees for his son. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a permanent house in which he lives with his wife and seven children. He operates a retail shop in which he sells sugar, soap, cooking oil and other domestic items. He dreams of turning the retail shop into a wholesale shop and educating his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: Paying school fees for his son.

loans.name: Waziran Iqbal Hussain's Group

texts.en:
Waziran is a 51-year-old lady who belongs to a poor family. She lives in Kasur, a mid-sized city in Pakistan famous for its sweetmeats. Waziran is married to I. H., a private entrepreneur who runs a business selling clothes. He buys clothes from wholesale markets in the city of Lahore named “Ichra & AnarkA.” and sells them to the local market at a profit.
Waziran is a mother of two sons, both of whom are involved in an embroidery business. They run an embroidery shop in the market where they offer their services to customers in order to generate income for the family. The sons did not get an education because their parents were not in a position to afford it.
Waziran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase unstitched clothes of different varieties in bulk. The bulk purchasing will help him to increasing his sales and grow his business towards success. He has been in this business for over 25 years and Waziran is hopeful that this loan investment will bring good profits for her family. She is a new loan applicant to Asasah.
Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds the book (an Asasah passbook) in her hands is Waziran.

loans.use: To buy unstitched clothes in bulk

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor es casdo, vive en el barrio Villa Paso de esta ciudad , posee un negcio donde comercializa productos de primera necesidad, bebidas y cigarrillos en general.
 Es un señor muy trabajador tienen un hijo adolecente, su señora atiende el negocio y el señor se dedica a la venta y reparto de panificados a todos los negocios de pilar, dicho producto es retirado de una empresa familiar de donde proviene la mayoria de su ingreso economico.
Solicita el crédito para  invertir en la compra de insumos para su  negocio y agradece a la fundación paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado como asi tambien el queda comprometido en cumplir en tiempo y forma el copromiso adquirido con la empresa.
texts.en:
He is married and lives in this city’s Villa Paso neighborhood.  He has a store where he sells basic needs items, beverages and cigarettes in general.

He is a very hard working man and he has a teen-aged son.  His wife tends to the store and he delivers baked goods to all the businesses in Pilar. These items come from a family business which is the source of most of his income.

He is asking for funds to buy ingredients for his business.  He thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the good services it has provided while at the same time committing to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, beverages, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban S., age 35, is a fisherman who now lives in Takhmao City. Ban S. and his wife work in the same business, and they normally earn an average of $6 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. This couple has been married for many years, and they have five children. All of them are still studying in school. 

Ban S. and his wife always get up every morning and drive their boat toward the middle of the river and then fish. After fishing is done, they hurry up to bring their fish to the busy market and sell it to their regular buyers. Ban S. will use his loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish. Ban S. was not available that day, so his wife and her daughter are pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase nets and other fishing implements

loans.name: Medalit

texts.es:
Medalit tiene 44 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola conocida a nivel regional por sus festividades religiosas. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un establecimiento en su domicilio en donde brinda servicio de centro de llamadas y venta de golosinas. Este es un negocio con bastante acogida ya que ella siempre brinda un buen trato a sus clientes. Los ingresos que percibe le sirven para solventar la economía de su familia.

Medalit desea implementar su negocio con más productos de modo que pueda seguir creciendo como comerciante, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Medalit is 44 years old.  She is separated from her husband and lives with her family in Motupe district, an agricultural area known regionally for its religious festivities.  It is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Medalit has an establishment in her home where she provides call center services and sells candy.  This is quite a popular business as she always provides her customers with good service.  The profits which she makes in her business help her to support her family financially.

Medalit would like to keep her business going with more products so that she can continue growing as a saleswoman.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy products to keep her call center and candy-selling business running

loans.name: Jofre Descarte

texts.es:
Jofre Descarte G. P. tiene 42 años, vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos,  vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.
  
Jofre Descarte se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la comercial Olivo.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
42 year old Jofre Descarte G. P. lives with his partner and children in Ventanas county, los Ríos province. He has 3 children. 

The members of the V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE are located in the Cachel and Grande precints of Ventanas county. This group primarily farms fast growing crops such as corn, rice, beans. They have been farming for a long time.

Jofre Descarte is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his products from Agro Karlyta and sells his products in the Olivo market.

He seeks a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn, rice and beans. This loan would provide the economic support to meet his needs. Farming challenges include pests, diseases, and weather. His dream is to be able to buy land.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 49 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Juana, de 44 años, y su querido hijo Tomas, de 14 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos.

En la provincia de Chanchamayo se encuentran las chacras de Luis, sus tierras son amplias y con los cuidados que les brinda las ha convertido en uno de los cultivos mejores trabajados del poblado. Por ese motivo, cuando lleva a vender sus plátanos y café al mercado de la ciudad, obtiene muy buenos precios debido a la buena calidad de sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar sus cultivos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Luis con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo.
Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old.  He is a very humble and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 44 year-old Juana, and his beloved son Thomas who is 14.  His wife and son are the main motivation behind all his hard work.

Luis' plantations are located in Chanchamayo province.  He has a lot of land and the care that he provides for his crops has made them some of the best looked-after crops in town.  For this reason, when he takes his bananas and coffee to the city market to sell, he obtains very good prices because they are good-quality products.

What Luis most likes about his work is sowing his land and making it fertile.  He has been in this business for 10 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be protecting his crops from the pests that can affect them.  Over time, he would like to buy more land in other towns so that he can increase his production and vary his crops.

This is Luis' second loan with MFP.  He knows that he must make his repayments punctually if he wants to access another loan in the future.  Luis is a very responsible member of his community bank and he is always aware of the agreements that are reached in his group.  Luis will use the 800 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure and fertilizers to improve his land.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Ichinkhorloo

texts.en:
Ichinkhorloo A. is 44, is a mother of three and micro-entrepreneur. She lives with her husband, three daughters and younger sister, who has a disability, in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in the outer ger districts of the city. Her hobby is floriculture. There are many flowers in her home, which makes her home cozy and inviting.  Ichinkhorloo is a very caring person who takes care of her sister. Her husband is a car dealer while her older two daughters attend college and youngest daughter is in secondary school.  Thus, her children’s education expense is quite high.  

Ichinkhorloo supports her family by operating a jewelry retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She began her business in 2000. She sells silver rings, necklaces, earrings and bracelets to local customers. Now her working capital is 1.7 million MNT. She purchases her products from a wholesale supplier who brings jewelry directly from Turkey. 

With this loan of 500,000 MNT, Ichinkhorloo will purchase more jewelry before the Mongolian Lunar New Year Holiday, and she believes this loan will help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.

She wants to expand her business with Kiva loans and be able to support her children’s education and their future goals.

loans.use: To purchase silver rings and earrings

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita E. is from the village of Linggangao, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Teresita is separated from spouse and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food & toothpaste in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia does embroidery for her neighborhood clients to support her family financially. She is very skillful in her work and learned this art from her mother before her marriage. She earns a reasonable income every month. She uses that money to pay utility bills and the school fees of her children.  
She is the mother of 4 daughters and 2 sons. Her elder son is a daily wage laborer, and her elder daughter does embroidery to help her mother in fulfilling the orders on time. The other three are enrolled in school.  Razia is a resident of Haji Ghaggan, which is a small residential area in Kasur, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its leather industry. She came here 25 years ago.  

Her husband, J. I. M., runs a construction supply business from a shop in the market.  He also has a dairy business, selling milk from the buffalo at his home.  He is very good dealing with customers and receives a good number of orders every month. Both businesses are a good source of income for him.  

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo, which will increase the milk productivity for him.  Razia is hopeful that the investment will be a productive one for her husband, and that her family’s life style will be improved.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: 16 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 16 de noviembre está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Candida Silva de 27 años quien se dedica al comercio, fresco, helado, comida desde hace 6 años. Ella tiene dos hijos por los que trabaja arduamente e invertirá el crédito en la compra de granos básicos, carne, verduras etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Glenda C. de 29 años que comercializa productos varios desde ropa, perfume, chinelas etc. y Miguel Orlando C. tiene una vidriería donde fabrica persianas, vitrinas, ventanas, puertas etc.
texts.en:
The 16 de Noviembre group is made up of three hard-working, driven and enterprising people.  One of them is 27 year-old Candida Silva who is a saleswoman.  She has been selling fresh food, frozen food and meals for 6 years.  She has two children for whom she works hard.  She will invest her loan in buying basic grains, meat, vegetables, etc.

The other members of the group are 29 year-old Glenda C., who sells a variety of products including clothes, perfume and thongs (flip-flops), and Miguel Orlando C. who owns a glassworks where he makes blinds, glass cabinets, windows, doors, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 33 years old, married and the father of three children. He lives with eight family members, of whom only two work.

Ahmad has been the owner of a car painting shop since 2000. He has a long experience in this field going back to when he was a kid. He has an excellent reputation and he is well known in his area.

After benefiting from the old loan, now he is applying for a $2400 loan to buy a car's paint mixing machine. He is aiming to expand his business so he will be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a car's paint mixing machine.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is a hard-working father and husband. He does his best to make his wife and daughter happy.

Avelino is a farmer working in Santo Niño, South Cotabato. He grows rice to sell. He earns about 5,000 PHP per month from this farming. He also raises cows. Avelino wants to improve his earnings.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda R. is 50 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nilda has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is from the village of Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is 53 years old. Cecilia is married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a home furniture-making business in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cecilia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for her home furniture-making business. This will be the first loan taken out by Cecilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her home furniture-making business.

loans.name: Segundo Gustavo

texts.es:
Segundo es padre de familia  de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, nocuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Se cacteriza por laactividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Segundo se dedica hace unos años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral como gallinas, pavos y patos al por menor, los cría en su corral que se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad de sus animales, los alimenta con comidad balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que han completado su desarrollo los vende a sus clientes, con los ingresos podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de un lote (terreno) para habitarlo, con los ingresos que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá pagar el crédito adquirido y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Segundo es una persona responsble y trabajador con la única intensión de mejorar  económicamente y  poderles dar una profesión a sus hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 38 year old father.  He lives with his wife and children in his own house.  They do not have basic services in that rural zone in the district of Mórrope, Lambayeque department.  The area is known for its agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

Segundo has been raising and selling barnyard fowl like chickens, turkeys, and duck for some years.  He sells them retail.  He raises them in a pen that is in the back of his house in order to make the animals safer.  He feeds them balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they have finished growing, he sells them to his customers.  With the income that he gets he will be able to pay for the family necessities.

He has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy a plot of land to live on.  With the income he gets from his animal sales he will be able to pay for the loan he got.  And, he will give his family a better quality of life.

Segundo is a responsible and hard-working person.  His only intention is to financially improve and to be able to give his children a profession in the future.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to live on.

loans.name: Jessica Veronica

texts.es:
Jessica de 34años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Es casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer y tienen 2 hijos de 5 años estudia en escuela fiscal y otro de 6 meses. Ella se dedica a la confección y ventas de telas.

Comenzó su actividad hace 4 años ya que tiene un titulo de corte y confección y de allí decidió abrir su propia negocio de confección. Labora diariamente con una persona que le ayuda. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas material para su costuras como rollos de telas hilos y botones. En un futuro desea tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Jessica, 34, lives in a peri-urban zone in El Fortín in Guayaquil.  She is married and her husband works as a driver.  They have two children; one is 5 years old and goes to public school and the other is 6 months old.  She is a dressmaker and fabric merchant.

She started her activity 4 years ago because she earned a degree in dressmaking and she decided to open her own dressmaking business.  She works every day with help from one other person.  With support from the loan she wants to buy more dressmaking supplies like bolts of fabric, thread and buttons.  In the future, she’d like to have her own locale.

loans.use: to buy bolts of fabric and other dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a farmer and raises cows and a goat to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. Erlinda is married with five children. She is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. Erlinda has requested a loan for 30,000. She has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Erlinda hopes to use the extra income from her business for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cows and goat.

loans.name: Nyame Wo Yenho Do(Ankyernyin) Group

texts.en: In the picture above Beatrice is in red trousers and a sleeveles top. She is the leader of this group called Nyame Wo Yenho do (literally means God loves us). She sells rice at Talkoradi. Beatrice has been through junior high school. She is single and has two children. Her business is just 2 years old and so she wants to increase her sales volume. A loan will help buy bags of rice in bulk to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop and to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 42 years old and married to John. They are blessed with four children ages twenty, eighteen, fifteen and ten years old. She has been running a retail shop for six years with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by the KADET staff. She will use the loan to add to her stock of sugar, rice, and wheat flour for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children and buy goats to raise. Her hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop and a hardware shop.

loans.use: To add sugar, rice, and wheat flour to her shop

loans.name: Genniper

texts.en:
Genniper is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Genniper has a retail shop that sells vegetables & spices. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Genniper is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Genniper hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices for sale.

loans.name: Petrona Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Petrona tiene 26 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo y otro en camino, convive con el señor Cacimiro quien es oficial de policía, viven en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Itá, se dedica a la venta de aros, evillas, pulseras, cadenas y artículos de librería como cuadernos, lapices, correctores, borradores y otros artículos a alumnos y docentes de una escuela que se encuentra cerca de su domicilio.
La señora Petrona demuestra ser una persona muy emprendedora y responsable, dice que todo lo que realiza es por el bien de sus hijos, ya que ellos son su mayor fortaleza, además de eso ayuda a su compañero con los gastos de la casa. Desea darle a sus hijos todo lo mejor, todo aquello a lo cual no pudo tener acceso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, lapices, borradores, y otros para el abastecimiento de su stock de mercaderías. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda en sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Petrona, who is 26 years old and has one child with another on the way, lives with with Cacimiro who is a police officer. They live in a well-known neighborhood in the city of Itá. She sells rings, buckles, bracelets, chains and stationery items such as notebooks, pencils, correcting fluid, erasers and other items to students and teachers from a school located close to her home.

Petrona proves to be an enterprising and responsible person. She says that everything she does is for the benefit of her children because they are her greatest strength. She also helps her partner with the household expenses. She wants to give her children the best of everything, everything she never had. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase notebooks, pencils, erasers, and other items in order to stock her merchandise.  She thanks the Foundation for the opportunity that this gives her, because getting a loan will be a great help in her plans.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pencils, errasers, and other supplies for the business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a mother of four children who are aged 7-17 years. Rose is 47 years old. She owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as rice, beans, sorghum and peanuts. She has been doing this business for the past 10 years. This business has enabled her to meet all her needs and she has also improved her standard of living. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs  for sale.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Мухаббат занимается торговлей у себя дома. Она продает детскую одежду и ткани. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 21 год. Кредит берет для покупки женской и мужской одежды, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Muhabbat lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 42 years old, married and has four children.  Muhabbat is involved in sales at home.  She sells children's clothing and fabrics.  She has been in this business for 21 years.  Muhabbat is requesting this loan for the purchase of women's and men's clothing in order to expand her merchandise assortment.

loans.use: to purchase women's and men's clothing

loans.name: Susan B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in the city of Kenema who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 2,500,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will then repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Their leader is Susan, a 40-year-old native of Segbwema who is married and has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. Susan, who has been in the teaching profession for the past six years, is requesting this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Fawwaz

texts.en: Fawwaz is a 62-year-old man. He is married and has three sons and three daughters. Fawwaz drives a taxi that is used for cargo, and he has another source of income from agriculture. Fawwaz wants to improve his work through making some repairs to his taxi, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Fawwaz gets the loan, he will be able to pay for repairing the taxi. This will increase the taxi capacity positively and enable Fawwaz to work extra and increase his income and provide better life conditions for the family. Fawwaz is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for making repairs to the taxi.

loans.name: Py Renda Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través D. la Sra. Romelia, quien se había acercado hasta la Oficina D. la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más al respecto del  Programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma invito a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo D. vida, son 15 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. 
La señora Romelia se dedica a la venta D. mercería, allí venD. todo tipo D. artículos, como zapatillas, perfumes, artículos para regalos y demás. Ya que su negocio está muy bien surtido atrae a muchos clientes, lo cual consecuentemente le trae buenos ingresos. Desea poder seguir abasteciendo su negocio por lo que solicita el crédito, ya que quiere comprar zapatillas, perfumes, artículos para regalos y otros.
Agradece a kiva y a la fundación por la oportunidad que estas le dan, pues es una gran oportunidad D. seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This committee was created through Ms. Romelia, who had approached the Office of the Fundación Paraguaya in order to familiarize herself with the Entrepreneurial Women's Committee Program. She invited her friends and companions from the neighborhood and they decided to join the group effort to get ahead and so improve their lifestyle. They are comprised of 15 hardworking and humble women who must earn a living every day. 

Ms. Romelia devotes herself to selling supplies. There she sells all manner of items such as sneakers, clothing, perfumes and other things. Since her business is well-stocked it attracts many customers, which consequently brings her a good income. She wishes to be able to keep her business going and so she is seeking the loan. She wants to buy sneakers, clothing, perfumes and other items. 

She thanks Kiva and the foundation for the opportunity they afford her, since it is a great chance to keep growing.

loans.use: to purchase sneakers, perfumes, gift items, and more

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with five children. Rey has a bakeshop that sells snacks and pastries like binangkal and yema, or milk candy. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks and pastries. Rey has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks and pastries.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is from the village of Tskarostavi, East Georgia. He is 37 years old, married and lives with his wife Lela and two sons, 12 and 7 years old. Both children go to school.

Zakaria and Lela earn a living through family farming. They have two milk cows and sell milk and yogurt in the local market. In addition, they grow maize on family owned one hectare of land. Last year they harvested four tons of maize and plan to sell it in winter when the price of the maize goes up. 

This year, Zakaria decided to sow wheat instead of maize. According to his estimations, wheat will give him a higher profit. He requested credit for covering land cultivation expenses as well as purchasing the wheat to sow. 

Zakaria and Lela hope that they will have a good harvest and will get more profit to use to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and to cover land cultivation expenses

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single mother of one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

Beatrice has operated a vegetable grocery for the past two years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase vegetables and build a business stall. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and build a business stall.

loans.name: Dyala

texts.en:
Dyala is a 21-year-old lady from Al Haashmi, Amman, Jordan. 

Dyala is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase clothes for trading purposes. 

Dyala is looking to open a shop to sell her products in.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Sehrana

texts.en:
Sehrana is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She breeds poultry such as turkey, chicken, and goose. She has nine years of experience in this field. Her monthly profit is 250 AZN.

Sehrana usually buys small nestlings, raises them, and sells them at a profitable price to neighbors and in the central bazaar.  Poultry is very popular in Azerbaijan and people eat particular poultry in a particular season. For instance, chicken is popular during the year, goose in winter, and turkey in autumn and winter. Many national dishes are made of chicken. Her husband helps Sehrana to look after poultry and raise them.

Sehrana is requesting a loan for 1,200 AZN, which she will use to purchase more poultry. With an increased monthly profit, she will be able to reinvest in her business. She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and increase monthly profit?

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a young resident of the Kawangware slum. He does not have any parents and has spent much of his childhood days in welfare organisations for street youth.  He was previously involved in crime, had repeated periods of unemployment and had taken odd jobs on the street for extremely low wages.  He describes himself as ambitious and determined.  He now sells eco-friendly products such as solar lamps and fuel-efficient cookstoves in slums around Nairobi.  He will use the loan to buy more stock to sell so that he can earn a decent wage and help his community.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 5 Thôn 2 -Quảng Thai Group

texts.en:
Hà works in agriculture raising poultry. Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

Hà is 34 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 5 Thôn 2 -Quảng Thai solidarity group. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
 
With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Reina is a 51 year old mother and wife of three energetic and mannerly children. 

She is hardworking and committed to providing the best products and services possible to her customers and prides herself on being both business and family oriented.

Reina is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to renovate her business, and also to restock beverages which are currently in high demand.

Please assist this determined and honest lady grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and drinks to restock her business.

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en: Sern’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sern makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer, construction worker and seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has 8 year working in the elaboration of tamales business, which sells in different parts of her community and also she comments that approximately can produce 4,000 tamales monthly. She has one kid and her husband worked as a plumber but his salary is not enough to maintain his family and by the worse he had an accident and he can work again doing what he knew, for this reason, Yolanda had the necessity to do something to live and she as a good housewife and Mexican woman, she knew the art of how to make tamales that also are delicious, so she take advantage of her ability and knowledge and started her business.

Yolanda says that her sons and her husband help her to sell her tamales, and with the pass of the time her business has been growing little by little and her work helps her to maintain and support her family with help and cooperation of all her family, for that reason she is requesting for a loan of USD $ 750 to purchase raw material and big pots because all that she has are not enough to cover her increasing demand, and she appreciated your support and collaboration.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Yolanda tiene 8 años elaborando tamales los cuales los vende en repartiéndolos en diversas partes de su colonia y al mes ella puede hacer aproximadamente 4,000 tamales. Tiene un hijo y su esposo trabajaba de plomero pero con su salario no era suficiente para poder sacar adelante a su familia y luego tuvo un accidente por lo que quedo inhabilitado para trabajar, por ello, Yolanda tuvo la necesidad de hacer algo para subsistir y como buena ama de casa y mexicana, conocía el arte de hacer tamales, los que le salen muy ricos, por ello aprovecho este conocimiento para empezar su negocio de venta de tamales.

Yolanda nos cuenta que su hijo y su esposo le ayudan a vender, y con el paso del tiempo su negocio ha ido prosperando poco a poco y le ha ayudado a poder sacar adelante a su familia en cooperación de todos en el hogar, por ello esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 750 para comprar materia prima y vaporeras por que debido a su demanda con las que cuenta ya no son suficientes.

loans.use: Purchase raw material and big pots

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is 23 years old and single. She was set up by her mother in the selling of household consumables some two years ago. Some of the items include sugar, milk, bagged water, and kenkey. She needs some funding to add other items equally in demand in her area. She is eagerly looking forward to the KIVA assistance to achieve this objective.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana is 23 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement and single.
She has run this business for 2 years. Having borrowed a loan of $500 she increased the variety of wares for her shop. Now she needs a loan of  $700 to start selling clothing.

loans.use: Yegana would like to start selling clothing.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica B. F. is the single mother of Angel Miguel F. (4). She is currently selling frozen products such as ice cream, frozen juice drinks, ice, etc. With this loan she is hoping to buy more supplies such as bags, ice chests, and bottles in order to be able to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by buying fresh fruit to make and sell her own fresh juices in order to be able to better provide for her son.

NOTE: Jessica is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and goods for her store

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: I am Samina S., and my husband and I are flower bouquet makers. We both love the work we do and do it with great zeal. Earlier on I took out some loans, which enabled me to construct a house of my own on the piece of land I had bought with my savings. I now want to expand my business and so require a loan of $300. Your loan can help me to provide much better clothing and food for my family.

loans.use: To expand her flower bouquet making business

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en: Firdavs is one of the active clients of Microinvest. He has his own DVD shop in Panjshanbe for over 2 years. He is married and has 2 children. He lives with his old parents. His wife is a teacher and in their big family they both earn money for family needs. His business is renting out DVDs and videocassettes for several days, and also he sells them. He said that the success of his business depends of regularly updating and upgrading his assortment. Presently he has a lot of disks of different movies and cartoons, songs and concerts. Today the movies and songs produced in Uzbekistan are in high demand among customers. Of course, Firdavs has several clients who prefer oldies songs and old movies. He every day in the morning buys new movies from the DVD seller. Evenings he often receives many orders and he always try to meet clients' requests. For the future, he wants to buy one TV set and DVD player for his shop, giving opportunity to customers to review disks before renting. For this purpose he needs in $350 for 5 months.

loans.use: Purchasing TV set and DVD player

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence B. is a mother of 2 and she is 51 years old. She hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and drinks. She has been in this business for the past 6 years and needs a loan of $1200 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Changamoto Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, age 30, is married with 3 children (ages 9, 11, and 13). She has a business selling clothes, which she began 2 years ago. She works daily from 8am to 3pm and now makes a monthly profit of about $180. Her dream is to one day have a shop for her clothes business.

Sharifa hopes to take out a loan to increase her clothing inventory. She with share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in hardware and general goods.

loans.use: To expand their various businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more material to make her products.

loans.name: Ivone Ingrid

texts.es:
Ivone lives with her husband and children. Her husband is a security guard at the CENDI school. The couple has a family business which they take care of with the support of her mother in-law, who helps out at their stand.
They have several businesses. During the day Ivone and her brother run an internet cafe which is located in Villa San Andres. On the weekends, together with her mother in-law, they sell chicharrón (a dish make of pork) and chicha (a drink from fermented corn).
The competition in both businesses is very high, but what differentiates this family from others is that they mobilize to sell their chicharrón and chicha in different places, and they also treat their customers in a very preferential manner.
The current loan request is to increase their working capital, as they need money to buy computer equipment. The prices for the equipment vary depending on the quality and above all the memory.
Ivone is approved with this institution as she has had several loans and has always demonstrated responsibility and punctuality. 
Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ivone vive junto con su esposo e hijos, su esposo es guardia de seguridad del colegio CENDI. La pareja tiene un negocio familiar que lo llevan adelante con la ayuda de la suegra que les colabora con la atención del local.
Tienen varios negocios Ivone junto a su hermano atienden un café internet durante el día que se encuentra ubicado en Villa San Andres y los fines de semana atienden junto a la suegra el negocio de venta de chicharrón y chicha.
La competencia en ambos rubros es muy elevada, lo que diferencia a la familia del resto es que ellos se movilizan para vender su mercadería de chicharrón y chicha y así dstribuyen en varios lugares, además que tratan a sus clientes de manera preferencial.
La presente solicitud es para el incremento de capital de operaciones, ya que le faltó dinero para la compra de un equipo de computación, en cuanto a los precios de los equipos de computación varian dependiendo la calidad y la capacidad que tienen estos sobre todo de memoria.
Ivone esta muy fidelizada con la institución ya que lleva varias frecuencias en la misma y siempre demostro responsabilidad y puntualidad.

loans.use: Increase working capital.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
“The roof of my home is not in good condition, due to it being made of wood, and for this reason I’d like to put in a concrete slab.  In the rainy season water leaks through the wood and causes a lot of humidity inside the house.”  I am requesting $1,000 to put a concrete slab in my home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

“El techo de mi vivienda ya no esta en buenas condiciones, debido a que es de madera por eso me gustaría poner una losa de concreto ya que en épocas de lluvias el agua entra a través de las maderas y provoca humedad adentro de mi casa”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner losa de concreto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of a concrete slab

loans.name: Youssifou

texts.fr:
Born on August 5th, 1975 in Kpalimé, in the county of Kloto, about 120km from Lomé, Mr. D. is married and the father of two children. He sells leather shoes and wallets at the Main Market in Lomé. He started this business in 2006, and performs it with a professionalism which has won him the confidence of his clients. This is his first loan, and it will permit him to increase his stock by buying four boxes of shoes of two different qualities.

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES.

Né le 05 août 1975 à Kpalimé dans la préfecture de Kloto (à 120 km de Lomé), Monsieur D. Youssifou est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Il a pour activité principale la vente de chaussures et de porte monnaies au grand marché de Lomé. Il a commencé cette activité et l’exerce avec professionnalisme depuis 2006 ; ce qui lui fait gagner la confiance de ses clients. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter son stock par l’achat de quatre (4) cartons de chaussures de deux qualités différentes.

loans.use: To purchase two different styles of shoes to offer a variety to his clients.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir is 32 years old. He is married and has 2 children. He has been in farming business for 8 years. He lives in Khachmaz region. Now this young man requests a loan of  $975 to buy spare parts for his tractor.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his tractor

loans.name: Las Mujeres Luchando Contra La Pobreza Group

texts.en:
Lucia M. is a middle-aged woman who came to Esperanza in search of her first loan. She has begun a small “colmadito”, or store that sells staple foods and accessories. However, she is lacking adequate capital to buy enough inventory for the store. The money from this loan will go towards purchasing cooking oil, rice, sugar, and crackers. Lucia said that she hopes to continue to grow her business, so that she will be able to help support her two grown children (23 and 25) to attend college. When she is not working, Lucia enjoys attending her local church several times a week.

Lucia Matinez is the leader of the 10 person micro-bank, Las Mujeres Luchando Contra La Pobreza, which means, The Women Fighting Against Poverty. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together. One of the other women in the group has runs a small salon, one sells vegetables in the street, and several of the others sell clothing to in the streets and markets of Puerto Plata.

On behalf of Lucia, the Mujeres Luchando group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oils, sugar, and vegetables.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is single. She lives in Simferopol, Crimea, with her mother and sister. Olga launched her enterprise 12 years ago with the assistance of her partner. Today she is still selling women's clothing in the central market of her city. She charges only 50% extra on each piece of clothing, which has become one of the best attractions in her business. Olga has about $2,000 invested in merchandise, and her net profit is about $400 each month. Her affordable pricing policy causes good turnover of her inventory and brings Olga high profits. 

Olga is seeking a 2000 Grivna ($450) loan to increase her turnover and sales rates. Olga started this business when she couldn't find any other way to support herself and her family, so this venture is just like her baby, and she is very excited to see it expand and become sustainable. Olga is hoping to make good money in business and eventually do some repairs to her family's house.

loans.use: To increase her stock and turnover

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo A. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle demeure à Danyi, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est revendeuse des médicaments génériques. Adzo espère par ce crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant beaucoup plus de produits afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et par là gagner plus pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adzo A. is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three. She is staying in Danyi, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is a retailer of generic medicines. Adzo hopes to use this loan to increase the size of her business by buying a lot of goods in order to meet the demands of her customers. Thus, she also hopes to earn more to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals to sell

loans.name: Ramiro Pedro

texts.es:
Ramiro R. es taxista y trabaja en la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto, el vehículo es de su propiedad. Vive en la zona de Villa Salome, en la casa de sus padres, pero es el único que genera ingresos para solventar alimentación y otros gastos de la familia. 
Solicita crédito para construir una habitación para ampliar sus comodidades. Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito en Impro y la segunda que espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva. El anterior crédito le sirvió para mantenimiento de vehículo, lo cual le permitió mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ramiro R. is a taxi driver and works in the cities of La Paz and El Alto and he owns his vehicle. He lives in the Villa Saloma area in a house with his parents, but he is the only one that generates income to provide for food and other expenses of the family. He requests a loan to construct a room to expand their facilities. It is the second time that he has asked for credit from Impro and the second time that he hopes to have the support of Kiva. The previous loan was for vehicle maintenance, which enabled him to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for investment

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor K. lives in Novomoskovsk, in southeastern Ukraine.  He sells men’s jackets and knitwear in the local market, and has been in business for 9 years.  He is an entrepreneur of integrity and consistency, and is very committed to developing his business in the future.  He currently makes about $1400 in gross income.

Viktor is requesting a 3000 Grivna loan ($500 US) to purchase inventory.  He will repay the loan in 3 months.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Catarina Rossana

texts.pt:
Catarina Rossana S. é natural de Xinavane distrito de Manhiça, tem 45 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 29, 27 e 25 anos respectivamente, ninguém estuda. Para alem dos filhos sustenta enteados. 

Catarina estudou até 7ªclasse, em 1978 saiu de Xinavane para Boane por missão de serviço, trabalha como auxiliar no instituto pedagógico de Umbeleze em Boane a 25 anos, tem um horário das 6:00h as 14:00h, com um salário mensal de 2000,00mt.

Para Catarina este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva nunca teve noutras instituições, os três primeiros destinou para compra de material de construção nos montantes seguintes; 10000,00mt; 7000,00mt e 15000,00mt respectivamente. Com este valor de 20000,00mt pretende dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. E pretende pagar antes do tempo regulamentado para solicitar outro afim de construir o muro de vedação. 

Catarina aparece na foto com o seu marido.
texts.en:
Catarina Rossana S. is a native of the Xinavane district of Manhiça. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children with ages 29, 27, and 25 respectively. None of them are students. Besides her children she also supports stepchildren. Catarina attended school until the 7th grade. In 1978 she left Xinavane for Boane for a service mission. She has worked as an assistant in the Pedagogical Institute of Umbeleze in Boane for 25 years. She works from 6:00am to 2:00pm with a monthly salary of 2,000MT This is Catarina's fourth loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. She has never had loans with other institutions. The first three loans were used to purchase construction materials in the following amounts: 10,000MT, 7,000MT, and 15,000MT respectively. With this loan of 20,000MT she intends to continue the construction of her home. She intends to pay off this loan before the term so she can solicit another loan to build a wall around her home. Catarina appears in this photo with her husband.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase construction materials

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es: Margoth tiene 28  años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Desde su niñez ha conocido lo que es trabajar en las actividades de la panadería, y hoy es su fuente de trabajo, cada día trabaja en este negocio que le permite solventar sus gastos.  Margota es muy dedicada en la preparación de los panes, conoce a la perfección cada parte del proceso para obtener deliciosos panes. Y diariamente también, ella misma comercializa su producto, ha notado que en estos últimos meses ha mejorado su venta, eso le trae satisfacción y le da mas ánimos de seguir adelante. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y ha sido muy responsable en la devolución de su préstamo. Margoth solicita este dinero para adquirir sacos de harina al por mayor, así como también comprar manteca en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Margoth, 28, lives with her husband and their children. Since she a child, Margoth worked in a bakery and now this is her business, which allows her to supplement her family's income. Margoth works hard in preparing and baking bread; she knows perfectly each step in the baking process. And she also distributes and sells the bread herself. In the last few months, sales have increased, which brings her satifaction and motivates her to work even harder. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP; she paid back the first loan in a very responsible manner. Margoth will use this loan to buy four sacks wholesale, and to buy a large amount of shortening.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing flour and shortening for bakery

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Mrs. Torn E., 49, and her husband, Mr. Korn Kim, 52, live in a small village along National Road Number 5, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1969 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. Two sons are married and live outside the family home. Their daughter is a garment factory worker, one son is a farmer and the other son attends school. They also have two grandchildren who are living with them.

Torn is a rice farmer. Her husband has been a fisherman since 1979. He catches fish in the river near his house and sells the fish in his village. Torn is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase fertilizer and diesel and to pay the rice-planting fee for her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and diesel, and to pay the rice-planting fee

loans.name: María Duela

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 42 años de edad, tienen 05 hijos, y es casada y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace 01 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir alimentación para sus toros.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra de ganado para engorde (01 toro) y compra de bebidas gaseosas para completar su tienda de bebidas que también posee y vende en las ferias de Ilave y Pilcuyo; ello le servirá para poder ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos y llenar mas su negocio de bebidas.
Ella se siente muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo.
texts.en:
María es a member of the Miraflores Communal Bank in the district of Pilcuyo, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 42 years old, has 5 children, is married, and completed a high school education. She has worked for the past year with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos, and her business is buying, fattening, and then selling cattle. Her first loan of 500 soles (about $175) helped her buy food for her cattle. With this loan of 1,500 soles ($475), which she will repay punctually over 3 months, she will buy a bull for fattening. In addition, she will buy soft drinks for her store and to sell in the Ilave and Pilcuyo markets. The loan will help her to pay for her children’s studies and stock her beverage business. She is very grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for their help.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bull for fattening and buy soft drinks for her store and to sell in nearby markets

loans.name: Ni Ketut Soli

texts.id: Kerja keras Ni Ketut Soli sebagai petani kakao belum memperoleh hasil yang maksimal .Tanaman kakao yang di kelola Ni Ketut Soli bersama Tamayana suaminya masih mengalami kendala berupa penyakit/ hama sehingga buah coklat yang seharusnya menghasilkan buah yang baik hampir 60 % mengalami gagal panen . Buah kakao mengalami penyakit yang oleh petani di bali dikenal dengan penyakit kanker.yang disebabkan oleh suatu hama yaitu lalat Buah . Meskipun begitu Ni Ketut Soli Dan Suami Tak Menyerah begitu saja karena dari hasil pertanian ini lah satu-satunya yang menjadi tumpuan kehidupan keluarga ini. Berbagi Upaya akan dilakukan Oleh Ni Ketut soli Dan Suami untuk dapat meningkatkan hasil termasuk dengan penyemprotan dengan anti hama dan pemupukan yang Rotin . Untuk itulah Ni Ketut Soli Sangat berharap mendapat pinjaman lagi dari Kiva Melalui Yayasan Dinari yang akan di pergunakan untuk membiayai perawatan tanaman Kakaunya. Membeli Obat-obatan  anti hama menjadi Prioritas sehingga setiap 2 minggu sekali bisa melakukan penyemprotan.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Soli's hard work as cocoa farmer has not reached its full potential yet. They are experiencing a 60% failed harvest as many of their cocoa trees are plagued with diseases this year. Cocoa trees in Bali area are experiencing diseases called "cancer" by local farmers. The disease is caused by fruit flies infestation.

However, Ni Ketut Soli and her husband are not giving up, as she depends on the farm for her livelihood. She is exploring all options to improve her farm, including increased insecticide and fertilizer treatments. She is applying for a second loan from Kiva for this purpose. It is her priority to purchase insecticide as soon as possible to start biweekly treatment on her farm.


Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insectiside and fertilizer

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза 27 летняя женщина, мать двоих детей. Муж уже третий год на заработках в Российской Федерации. Шахноза сама занимается бизнесом откормом и продажей коз и козьей шерсти.У неё сейчас около 20 голов коз, белых как молоко. Шерсть белых козочек очень ценится на рынке, из них получаются очень красивые носки .  Шахноза сама прядет шесть и продаёт своим постоянным клиентам. Шахноза получив  займ,  хочет купить прядилку и несколько коз.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a 27-year-old woman, a mother of two children. Her husband is in his third year of working in the Russian Federation. Shahnoza works fattening goats and selling them and their wool. She now has around twenty goats which are white as milk. The wool of white nanny goats is very much in demand in the market since that wool makes very beautiful socks. Shahnoza spins the wool herself and sells it to her regular customers. When Shahnoza receives the loan, she would like to buy a spinning wheel and some goats.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening and selling goats

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La señora Marcela, es una mujer muy trabajadora y comprometida con el desarrollo de su trabajo, familia y de su persona. A pesar de estar separada de su pareja siempre les brindó lo necesario a sus hijos, y gracias a la ayuda de sus padres y familia tienen un calor de hogar, pues todos viven juntos en la casa de sus padres. Sus necesidades como madre y padre la impulsaron a buscar trabajo para cumplir con sus responsabilidades, hallando la oportunidad en una empresa telefónica, donde se desempeñó como promotora de ventas desde hace quince años. Luego inició un negocio más independiente, pero dentro de la misma empresa, que consiste en la venta de teléfonos prepago, útiles para las personas con bajos recursos y con escasa posibilidad de poseer una línea telefónica en casa. De esta manera ayuda a las personas de bajos recursos a tener un medio de comunicación, siendo  esta su mayor satisfacción, no sólo por las ganancias o por la demanda, sino porque contribuye con el desarrollo de su distrito y de su ciudad. Sin embrago, Marcela espera en el futuro instalar un negocio de venta de teléfonos y tarjetas telefónicas en su casa para brindar un servicio a tiempo completo, sin dejar de salir los fines de semana para seguir ayudando en lo posible a las personas que están en zonas más pobres. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, está comprometida a ser responsable y puntual, y junto al equipo de compañeras, quienes son muy dinámicas y trabajadoras, hacer crecer su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo estará invirtiendo en la compra de teléfonos que requiere para las ventas de estos meses, ya que en algunos casos la venta es al crédito y hay que cubrir los pagos durante algunos meses.
texts.en:
Ms. Marcela, is a very hardworking woman taking on the improvement of her business, her family and herself. In spite of being separated from her partner she always provided what was necessary for her children, and thanks to the help of her parents and family members they have a warm home in which they all live together in her parents’ home. The demands of being a parent pushed her to look for work in order to manage her responsibilities. Finding an opportunity in a telephone company, she worked as promoter of sales over the last fifteen years. Then she started a more independent business, within the same company, that consists of selling prepaid telephone calls, useful to people with limited resources and scarce possibility of having a telephone in their home. In this way she helps people with limited resources have a means of communication. Doing this gives her great satisfaction, not only for the financial gain or the demand, but because she contributes to the development of her district and her city. Nevertheless, Marcela hopes in the future to set up a business selling phones and phone cards in her home to provide a full-time service while leaving the weekend to continue helping, as much as possible, people in poorer areas. This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to being responsible and punctual, and work alongside teammates who are very dynamic and hardworking, to enable their community bank to grow. The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of telephones that she needs to sell in upcoming months, because in some cases the sale is by credit, and she has to cover payments for several months.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie D. is 32 years old and a resident of Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with one child who is in grade four. Her husband is a part-time driver and at the same time lends a hand in farming, specifically in corn production which is their primary activity.

They own a little parcel of land. It began as a back-yard gardening project with onions planted on it and eventually led to corn production for consumption and for business too.

Rosalie has been a member of Paglaum MPC since June 2008. She is now applying for Php 6,000 intended to buy farm fertilizers and pesticides. She dreams that maybe someday she will be the supplier of corn in the market.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Two years ago, Mary K. got her first loan from Sudan Microfinance. That was when she started a business selling charcoal in small quantities. Her business nearly failed due to the demolition of her house which was in the way of a new road. Nevertheless, she fully repaid her loan to Sudan Microfinance. 

Mary has now joined the Kiva field partner, Brac South Sudan. She sells charcoal wholesale at her store and wants a loan to hire a lorry for the transportation of charcoal from the producers to her store.  Mary is thirty-two years old and married to a businessman. She has three children who all attend school, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Hire a lorry to carry charcoal to her store

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en: Chhim C., 43, is a local construction worker in the Takeo province. He typically makes US$2 per day. His wife makes and sells silk skirts and cotton scarves and makes US$3 per day. This couple has five children and all of them are in school. Chhim C. would like to take out a loan to purchase more silk skirts and scarves for his wife to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase more silk skirts and scarves.

loans.name: Chit

texts.en:
Chit C., 28, has had a job for years selling various kinds of fruit by mobile transportation. She typically generates an income of $40 each day to meet her family's daily food needs. She is married but has no children. Her husband works at fishing in the Public Pond of their community for income.

The family is always paying much money taking taxis because they do not own a vehicle. Therefore, Chit C. has decided to seek an $800 loan in order to purchase a new motorcycle for her family’s riding needs, as well as for her to use to pick up her vegetables to sell more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle  for her business and for her family’s riding needs

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Pastor #1 Group

texts.en:
Maria lives in Barrio Azul Andres, a town in the municipality of Boca Chica, a well-known tourist area. Boca Chica is known for having soft, white sand; a place where the water is calm, clear and shallow. But what tourists don’t normally see are those who are trying to survive in the nearby communities. Especially now in the down-turning economy, many are left without employment because businesses keep on shutting their doors.

That is why Maria started her own business four years ago -- to try to secure a steady income. She has her own shop where she sells clothes, intimate wear, kids' school uniforms, school supplies, and decorations for the house. Often, when Maria finds it is time to re-stock, but doesn’t have much money saved up to do so, she borrows money from local lenders. The local lenders charge a 20% interest rate per week!

Maria found out about Esperanza through her neighbor and close friend and now she is seeking a loan through Esperanza. Esperanza charges a 2% declining balance interest rate every two weeks; 4% per month. Esperanza also helps its clients with complimentary services, such as a savings account, medical and life insurance, literacy courses, and business management training, just to name a few.

Please strongly consider lending to Maria and her group. They deserves a fair interest rate and an opportunity to grow their businesses. Esperanza thanks you for your time and consideration.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to make school uniforms, school supplies, candles, aromatics, intimate wear, and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 45 years old and a widow with six children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She has been in the business for a long time and hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia P.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. She is 48 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of Colambutan Bajo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Dionesia has been in business for over 21 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Dionesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Dionesia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise.

Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her ninth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 52-year widowed woman with five children between the ages of 6 and 17. All her children go to school. Rose owns a four-room house where she stays with all her children and with four other family members she takes care of. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.

She owns a shop near her residence where she sells her food items. She says her business is good. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and medical bills. She has been in this business for the last five years. Rose has been with MCDT for eight years, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock.  Rose aspires to see her business grow to enable her to educate all her children up to university.

loans.use: To increase stock of food and be able to serve more customers

loans.name: Nicolasa Antonia

texts.es: Nicolasa Antonia G. U. de 53 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento de Cuscatlán. Nicolasa vive solamente con su hija Ana de 24 años de edad. Nicolasa posee un negocio de venta de productos plásticos, ubicado en el mercado de Cojutepeque, son 17 años de experiencia que Nicolasa posee como comerciante mismos años que hoy le dan la ventaja sobre otros negocios; ya que Nicola es muy conocida en la zona y como resultado sus clientes son estables. El crédito que solicita Nicolasa es para invertirlo en su negocio, con la compra de nueva mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nicolasa Antonia G. U. is 53 years old and lives in the town of Cojutepeque, in the department of Cuscatlán. Nicolasa lives only with her 24 year old daughter, Ana. She owns a small store where she sells plastic products, located in the Cojutepeque market. Nicolasa has 17 years of experience working as a shopkeeper, and this experience gives her an advantage over other competitors, as she is very well known in the area and has a stable group of customers. The loan that Nicolasa is asking for would be invested in her business through the purchase of new merchandise to sell to her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her shop with new merchandise.

loans.name: Inacio Francisco

texts.pt:
Inácio nasceu na província central de Sofala, no distrito de Marromeu, tem 33 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos com 3 e 7 anos de idade. O mais velho freqüenta escola. Fez nível médio de Magistério Primário há 13 anos no instituto no distrito da Manhica e leciona na Escola primaria completa de Boane com salário mensal de 7.500m, 00mt que aplica no sustento da família (esposa e filhos). Vive na casa própria na vila de campoane, distrito de boane.

Saiu de Marromeu juntamente com os pais no ano de 1988 para a vila de Boane e em 2000 construiu a sua própria casa.
Já teve empréstimo para compra de Bens de consumo, num banco comercial (BIM) e decidiu não continuar com o banco para novos empréstimos por ter enfrentado dificuldades para pagar prestações  foras das suas capacidades e durante muito tempo.

Após informações obtidas acerca das actividades da hluvuku através de colegas, decidiu aproximar a instituição solicitando o presente empréstimo no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, areia e outros).
Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder a ceder a mais crédito com intuito de terminar a casa posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Inácio was born in the central province of Sofala in the Marromeu district. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children ages 3 and 7. His older child attends school. He completed a degree in Elementary Education 13 years ago in a school in the Manhica district. He teaches at the elementary school in Boane, earning 7.500,00MT per month, which he uses to support his wife and children. He owns his own home in Campoane in the Boane district. He left Marromeu along with his parents in 1988 to move to Boane and he built his own home in 2000. He previously had a loan to purchase consumer goods through a commercial bank (BIM) and decided not to continue with the bank for additional loans because he had faced difficulties making payments beyond his means for a long time. Upon learning about Hluvuku from colleagues, he decided to request a loan. This loan is for 12.000,00MT for the purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, etc.) He plans to pay back the loan without any problems in order to have access to future loans with the goals of finishing his house and equipping it.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, stones, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia es una mujer colabora y perseverante, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 46 años, es madre D. seis hijos D. los cuales cinco son mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, también venD. turrones (dulce), al por mayor,  cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo para realizar las diferentes actividades que desarrolla.
