Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” desD. hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en perfumes, en la actualidad Adilia necesita un crédito D. 1700 soles que le permitirá invertir una parte en productos D. belleza y otra parte en prendas D. vestir para luego vender a sus clientes. La meta D. Adilia es tener una boutique y seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Adilia is a persevering and cooperative woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 46 years old and has six children, five of whom are now adults. She sells beauty products by catalogue as well as wholesale candy. She has her husband's support in developing her various activities. She has been a member of the "Mujeres Valientes" Communal Bank for the past six years. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to purchase perfumes. She currently needs a loan of 1700 soles which she will use partly to buy beauty products and partly to buy clothing to resell to her customers. Her goal is to have a boutique and to continue working to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Gale

texts.en: Gale E. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials. Gale is 20 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma B. is a small business entrepreneur and a Tanzanian married woman.  She has three school children, one in kindergarten and two in primary school. She runs a business selling traditional clothes (Kanga and Vitenge) at Mtakuja Street in Vingunguti –Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods direct from the wholesale shops at Mnazi Mmoja traditional clothes shopping center. She sells to retail customers at Vingunguti. The business income is used to meet her daily family demand and business capitalization. The business plan is to open and run wholesale shops and open up another business. She is requesting a loan of T.shs 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 37 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Esther sells secondhand clothes. She is a focused, hard worker and puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. She plans to rent a store in future.

Esther is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie L. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Virgie is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Virgie has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007 Virgie joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and expand her business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Virgie from HSPFI. Most recently, Virgie repaid a loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou G. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Marilou is widowed and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities. In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Marilou from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos. Angélica se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y mandar a sus hijos menores al colegio. Angélica tiene su propia chacra donde siembra hortalizas y verduras. Angélica también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuy, gallinas y chanchos. La socia nos cuenta que los días sábados lleva sus productos a vender al mercado de Wanchaq de la Ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Angélica requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas y alimento para los animales. Angélica pertenece al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Rayanniyoc esta ubicado a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Angélica is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and three children. Angélica wakes up very early to do her household chores, such as preparing breakfast and sending her younger children to school. Angélica has her own farm where she plants vegetables. She also raises small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. She tells us that on Saturdays she brings her products to sell in the Wanchaq market in the city of Cusco. She has worked in this business for many years and has done well thanks to the effort she has put in to her work. Angélica needs a loan to buy more seeds and animal feed. Angélica belongs to the “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” community bank in the Asociación Arariwa.

She is thankful for the opportunity that this brings and also promises to complete all the payments according to schedule.

The city of Rayanniyoc is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and animal feed

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old single man. He lives in Ramallah, Palestine. Ahmad has owned a bakery since 2002. He supports his mother and younger brothers and sisters. 

Ahmad needs a loan of $3000 to buy the essential equipment to improve his bakery. Ahmad’s bakery is special because he uses wood to cook the baked goods. It would be nice to see this successful business grow even larger.

loans.use: Buy equipment to improve his bakery

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena forma parte del Banco Comunal Damas de Éxito, este banco esta formado por 19 socias  muy unidas entre sí ya que se agruparon en busca de mejores dias para ellas y sus familias, el banco esta situado en la provincia de Manabí región costa del Ecuador muy visitada por sus hermosas playas que ofrece al turista nacional y extranjero.

Nuestra socia nos comentó que es de profesión modista lleva  20  años  ejerciendo esta actividad gracias a estudios en academias y cursos de capacitación impartidos en la ciudad de Portoviejo,    vive sólo con su  hija de los cuatro que tuvo ya que los otros son casados y viven independientes  a sus  51 años  sigue trabajando muy duro para salir adelante y fue gracias a una amiga que se enteró de los benenficios que brinda la Fundación Espoir desde entonces es socia activa de éste banco en el que lleva ya varios ciclos.

Con el préstamo solicitado podrá invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, encajes, plumón, etc.   de diferentes tipos tanto para elaborar toldos, sabanas y edredones que realiza solo bajo pedido como para la confección de ropa en general y para ello en su casa  tiene un pequeño taller donde trabaja sola y dispone de  dos maquinas de coser. 

Maria Elena tiene como sueño comprar unas vitrinas para vender cosas de bazar y  una maquina de coser idnustrial para realizar más rapido sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Damas de Éxito” (Women of Success), which consists of 19 members who are very close and have banded together to improve the future for themselves and their families. This Communal Bank is located in the province of Manabí, which lies in the coastal region of Ecuador and is frequently visited by foreign and domestic tourists for its beautiful beaches.

Maria Elena says that she has been a professional seamstress for 20 years. She pursued this profession as a result of her schoolwork and training classes she took in the city of Portoviejo. Maria Elena lives alone with one of her four children. The others are married and live independently. At 51 years of age, she works very hard to get ahead. Thanks to a friend who heard about the benefits provided by Fundación ESPOIR, she decided to become a member of this Communal Bank and has participate in several loan cycles.

With this loan, she will buy fabric, thread, lace, feathers, and other types of material to make awnings, bed sheets, and quilts that can be purchased only by request as well as general clothing that she sews. She has a small shop in her house where she works alone and has two sewing machines.

Maria Elena hopes to buy two display cases for selling bazaar items and an industrial sewing machine so that she can complete her work faster.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a hardworking and honest woman who wants to improve the quality of life for her family. She is 35 years old and is married with two children. She hopes to give her children a quality education.

Deborah sells groceries at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: François

texts.fr: Né en 1976, D. François vit depuis 6 ans environs à Tchonvi dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. François est marié et est père de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. François vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. C'est François qui assure l'essentiel des charges de la famille. François n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a près de 12 ans, afin de répondre aux exigences de sa famille, François achète et vend divers produits électroniques (ampoules, fils électriques, postes téléviseurs, etc.) à son domicile. C'est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que François achète ses produits. C'est la première fois que François sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1976, Mr. D. François has lived for six about years in Tchonvi in the town of Sèmè-Podji, Benin.  He is married and the father of three children, some of whom are in school.  He lives together with his children and wife.  François is the one who covers the bulk of family expenses. François did not attend school.  For nearly the last twelve years, in order to meet the requirements of his family, he has been buying and selling various electronic products (light bulbs, wiring, TV sets, etc.) out of his home.  He buys his goods from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  This is the first time François is requesting a loan from ALIDé for bolstering his business and coping better with customer demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying electrical wire, light bulbs, DVDs, etc.

loans.name: Suo

texts.en:
Mrs. Suo L. is 51 years old and she is a villager who lives in Ta Ou Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a grocery seller who owns a general store to support her family. She is also a pig breeder at home from which she is able to earn a small income to support her family.

In order to increase her income to improve her family’s living conditions, Mrs. Suo L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. The rest of the loan she wants use to buy feed for her pigs.

Her husband, Mr. Choeun Chum, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which he cultivates rice to support the family. This couple has a child who is a seamstress in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina tiene 55 años, casada, es una madre de familia muy responsable, tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 6 de ellos. Hace más de 32 años se dedica, a la fabricación de muebles, en donde se encarga de lijar la madera, mientras que su esposo fragmenta por grosores y medidas. Su taller está ubicado en la parte inferior de su casa, por lo que es muy reducido el espacio donde trabaja. Sus vecinos  y amigos reconocen la calidad del trabajo que realizan, ya que siendo su única fuente de ingresos, trabajan con mucho esmero para sacar adelante su familia. Disfruta mucho lo que hace, aunque a veces es difícil mantenerse en el mercado, debido a la competencia. Es por ello que mas adelante espera contar con madera en cantidad para poder trabajar sin dificultad. Este es su crédito número 32 y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, además en su grupo comunal es una compañera muy alegre y responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, se comprará madera al por mayor, para brindar un buen acabado a sus muebles.
texts.en:
Dina is 55 years old, she is married and is the mother of a very responsible family. She has eight children, but she lives with only six of them. For more than 32 years she has built furniture, she is responsible for sanding the wood, while her husband's responsibilities are divided between weights and measures. Her shop is located in the lower part of her house, which means that there is very little space to work. Her neighbors and friends know the quality of her work. This is their only source of income and they work with great care to get ahead with their family. She really enjoys what they do, although sometimes it is difficult in the market because there is so much competition. This is why she wants to get ahead, in having a quantity of wood to be able to work with out difficulty. This is loan number 32 and she knows that they have to make repayments punctually, what's more in their community she is known as very happy and responsible. With the loan that she is seeking, she will buy wood at wholesale to provide a good finish to their furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood at wholesale

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar is 58-year-old married woman with four sons. She lives in Vehari, a mid-sized city in Pakistan. She is a self-made woman who keeps herself busy sewing clothes even in her old age. She has given birth to four sons. 

By the grace of God her first three sons completed their education up to 10th standard and then got busy in their own jobs. Her elder son sells sewing machines with his father. The next son got a job in a factory earning a monthly wage. The younger son operates a business selling clothing. The youngest one is currently reading in 9th standard. Naseeem and her husband are very happy and satisfied that they brought up their children with discipline and good manners. 

Naseem has successfully completed her first loan with Asasah (a micro-finance institution in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and now she is applying for the second time for a loan to purchase more clothes for her son to sell so he can make a good profit and expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
Sat M. is 41 years old and the leader of this group loan, located in Thnal Louk village in Takeo province.  All the members will use their share of the loan for different purposes.  Sat is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of land to cultivate and sell rice to support her family.  She is also a farm laborer. 

Her obstacle is that her field has infertile soil.  To improve production Sat is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.  Her husband is a fisherman. She is a mother of three children, two attend a local public school and the youngest one is three years old.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is a widow who takes care of her mother.  She is 50 years old and has four children who are between the ages of 12-30 years.  Her eldest child graduated from high school, the second born is married, and the other two are in school. Salima has a small shop in the market and a charcoal store. Her shop contains onions, sunflower oils, small dried food, cassava flour, tomatoes and other food stuffs. She is requesting  a loan in order to stock more foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum. She hopes to expand and renovate her house with her profits.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs for her store.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina pertenece al Banco Comunal Despertar hace 2 años y lo que mas le gusta son el incentivo del ahorro y las reuniones amenas que la distraen mucho.
Albertina es conviviente y tiene 31 años, Albertina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, negocio que inicio hace 2 años, Además Albertina vende emoliente de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de las Americas, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta.
Albertina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo.
texts.en:
Albertina has belonged to the Despertar (Awake) communal bank for the past 2 years, and what she likes most about it is the incentive to save, as well as the meetings she enjoys so much. Albertina is 31 years old and cohabits. She has a shop in her house, where she sells general groceries. She started the business 2 years ago and is also a street vendor in the Americas market, selling ‘emoliente’ (a traditional hot drink) from her cart. Albertina needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of sugar, rice and noodles.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and noodles.

loans.name: Sop

texts.en:
Sop L. has a recycling business and earns an average of US$ 3 each day to help cover her family’s living expenses. She is 46 years old, married and blessed with two teenage children. One of her daughters helps support the family by selling cakes. 

Sop L. is married to Sman Yass, 50 years of age, who earns a living selling ice-cream to school kids. Sop L. buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. As her recycling business is very profitable, Sop L. hopes to sustain its growth through using the loan she has requested.

loans.use: To sustain her recycling business's growth

loans.name: Mrs. Ly Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people located I. Boeng village, Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. L. S., who was born I. 1959, as the village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan I. a different way to support their business I. the current year.

Mrs. L. S. owns a general store I. the local village where she is able to earn a large profit to support her famiL.. She is also a chicken breeder.

Since both her businesses are going well, Mrs. L. S. wants to expand them. So, to achieve this goal, she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to sell and more chickens to breed.

Mrs. L. S. is a widow with six children, three of whom are seamstresses I. a garment factory, another is a laborer, and the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell and chickens to breed

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is  43 years old. Her two children are still going to high school and secondary school. She has a shop that sells chicken meat in the village market. Each day, she can have 130,000 VND  profit  from  her  sales activities, so she has been able to maintain it for 4 years. Participating in the credit program   has helped her a lot in developing capital. Currently, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to invest in these trading activities.

loans.use: Invest in trading activities

loans.name: Buenaflor

texts.en:
Buenaflor J. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 28 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Buenaflor owns & operates a specialized retail store where she buys and sells used clothes. Buenaflor has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Buenaflor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Buenaflor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Coralitos Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Coralitos y está integrado por 10 clientas, en él se encuentra L. señora Lidia S. N. D. 49 años D. edad, quien cuenta con una miscelánea desD. hace 6 años, tiene 4 hijos y el menor D. ellos depenD. económicamente D. elL.. L. señora nos comenta que hace tiempo empezó vendiendo elotes con sus conocidas y familiares, posteriormente pudo adquirir un carrito para L. venta D. su producto, ya que, su domicilio se encuentra cerca D. L. central D. abastos D. L. ciudad D. Toluca, poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo, con los ahorros que pudo juntar durante mucho tiempo decidió emprender un negocio con su familia y así comenzó L. historia D. éxito D. L. clienta. A pesar D. tener “Labio Leporino” y ser victima D. burlas en su comunidad, ha sabido salir adelante y apoyar a su familia, su máxima ilusión siempre ha sido que su hijo menor D. nombre Juan Pablo, quien cuenta con 11 años D. edad y quien cursa L. primaria sea Licenciado, ya que con ese logro valdrá L. pena tanto esfuerzo y sacrificio, los crédito que L. institución le otorgo le han servido para desarrollar su negocio y con ello procurar una mejor calidad D. vida para elL. y su familia, con los próximos créditos que reciba desea trasladar su negocio a otro lugar y con ello tener mayor ganancia.
texts.en: This group is called Coralitos and is maD. up of 10 clients. Mrs.Lidia S. N. is in it. She is 49 years old and has had a variety store for 6 years. She has 4 children and the youngest is financially dependent on her. She tells us that some time ago she began to sell sweetcorn to her acquaintances and relatives. Later she was able to acquire a cart to sell her product, since her residenc is close to the central market in the city of Toluca. Little by little her business grew. With the savings she was able to amass over a long time she decided to start a business with her family and thus began the client's sucess story. Despite having a "harelip" and being a victim of teasing in her community, she has been able to get ahead. With her family's help, her greatest dream has always been for her youngest son, Juan Pablo, who is in elementary school, to be an attorney. With that achievement all of her hard work and sacrifice will have been worth it. The loans that the institution has given her have been to develop her business and with it obtain a better quality of life for her and her family. With the next loans she receives she wants to move her business to a different place and with it obtain more profit.

loans.use: To move her business and have better sales

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria De Jesús tiene su actividad económica que es la venta de ropa y una pulpería. Hace más de 12 años que tiene esta actividad, pues inicio como una opción porque no tenía un trabajo y no ganaba un salario que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su hogar, también tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 menores dependen de ella. Con el apoyo de su esposo fue que dio inicio a este negocio, por lo que con el paso del tiempo fue que adquirió más experiencia  para con su negocio. El motivo de este crédito es para invertir en la compra de ropa y productos necesarios para su pulpería. Sueña con mejorar su actividad económica y seguir adelante.
texts.en: Maria De Jesús is in business selling clothes and running a general store. She has done so for over 12 years, having gone into business as something that could help her meet the household expenses at a time when she didn't have a job or any salary coming in. Her 4 children are dependent on her, with 2 being of school age. She started the business with the support of her husband, and as time has passed she has gained more experience. Her motive for seeking the loan is to invest in clothing and merchandise for her store. She dreams of improving her economic situation and progressing.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 32 year old farmer.  He practices mixed farming in the Kiambu area, which has a favourable climate for farming.  He has been farming for five years and he hopes to grow his business in the future.  Besides farming, he does masonry for extra income. Since he joined Faulu kenya, his financial status has changed for the better. He has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy masonry equipment.

loans.use: To buy masonry equipment.

loans.name: Maria Aparicia

texts.es:
María, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vende comida y tortillas en el mercado municipal de Gotera, tiene 42 años de edad, vive con sus 4 hijos y es madre soltera, este negocio lo posee desde hace 8 años ya que es la fuente de ingreso con la cuenta para mantener a sus hijos, su única dificultad ha sido que en momentos enfrenta problemas de liquidez y es por eso que hoy solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, con este préstamo comprara más insumos para preparar alimentos y estar preparada para atender a todos los clientes.
Ella sueña salir adelante con su negocio y así poder ayudar a sus hijos para que también se desempeñen en un futuro como profesionales.
texts.en:
María lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  She sells meals and tortillas in the Gotera town market.  María is 42 years old.  She lives with her 4 children and is a single mother.  She has had this business for 8 years.  It is her source of income which she relies on to support her children.  Her only difficulty has been that at certain moments she has faced cash flow problems.  For that reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  She will use her loan to buy more supplies for preparing food and to be ready to serve all her customers.

María dreams of getting ahead in her business and thereby being able to help her children so that they can have a future as professionals.

loans.use: To buy products to prepare her food

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates business manufacturing hollow blocks to sell in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for five months and earns approximately 2,000 a month from this activity.

In June 12, 2008, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her manufacturing business.

loans.name: Meltcher

texts.en: Meltcher C. owns and operates a grocery store. She is 18 years old, married and has a baby at home. She is from the village of Poblacion, Concepcion. Meltcher has been operating her business for a month. In 2010, Meltcher joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Meltcher is requesting her first loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store

loans.name: Royer

texts.es: Royer, de 23 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro. Los extensos campos de sembrado que posee Royer, son el fruto de una vida de arduo trabajo y una firme convicción de sobresalir en la vida, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de calidad le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de café y plátano, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda hacer más fácil el traslado de sus productos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas para sus sembríos, ya que desea que sus cultivos sean más productivos.
texts.en: 23 year old Royer is a straightforward and hardworking young man. He lives in his own house, and what he most wants is to forge himself a good future. The extensive planted fields that he owns are the fruit of a life of hard work and a firm intention to succeed in life. His produce is very sought-after in the market of the city Pichanaki. His fame for harvesting quality produce helps him to sell his crops at very good prices. What he most likes about his work is guarding his plants from the pests that may afflict them. He has been doing this work for 7 years and thinks that the most difficult thing is transporting the sacks of coffee and bananas as they are very heavy and tire him out. In the future, he hopes to buy himself a car, which will make it easier to transport his produce. This is his first credit from MFP, and he knows that this will be very beneficial to the development of his work. He is a very cheerful member of his community bank and always keeps order at meetings. With the $375 that he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer and insecticide for his plants, as he wants his crops to be more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Poderoso De Israel 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Aida is a 34-year-old borrower from the rural batey of Romana, Dominican Republic. She is a member of the group, Poderoso D. Israel (The Powerful of Israel)1, 2, and 3; the name is an allusion to J. Christ, and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Aida lives with her three children, who are currently in school. She lives in a batey, a rural community built by sugar companies for their workers. Aida and her long-term partner and children have a difficult life – little access to electricity, no running water or medical services, and insufficient roads. Bateyes are maD. up of the homes of some of the poorest people in the Dominican Republic, not to mention the entire Western Hemisphere.

Despite these difficulties, Aida runs a business where she sells different goods, including beans which she has boiled at home.  These beans are ready to eat and customers can add their own sauces. With her loan, Aida plans to buy bags of beans, rice, and other vegetables to sell in her home.

Aida is very thankful for this loan, her second with Esperanza, and she hopes to continue her successful borrowing in the future.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, vegetables.

loans.name: Kodamine Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KODAMINE (4 mariés et 1 veuve) ont en moyenne 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt passé a été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus brodés à travers ASSITAN C.. 
ASSITAN C. compte acheter avec son prêt, 35 pagnes de  tissus brodés. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso. Elle effectue sa vente au marché de SANOUBOUGOU I à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the KODAMINE group are 4 married women and one widow. They average 30 years of age and 2 children, and most of them live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the neighborhoods in Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their second loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. The previous loan was repaid without problems. This group of women trades embroidered fabrics through ASSITAN C..

ASSITAN C. intends to use her loan to buy 35 embroidered "pagnes" (colorful African cloth). She gets her supplies at the grand market in Sikasso. She resells, for cash and on credit, at the SANOUBOUGOU I market in Sikasso, as well as at her home, to a clientele comprising men and women.

She foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 45'000 (ca US$ 90), to be used to provide for her family's daily expenses and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy and resell cloth

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is a married woman with one daughter who attends school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills. With the proceeds of this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she plans to her daughter's pay school fees.

She has operated a tailoring business for over fifteen years, and her customers are people in her community. Anjelina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. One day, she hopes to establish a tailoring college and improve her business.

loans.use: To  pay her daughter's school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of Irish potataoes and cassava to offer for sale

loans.name: Baylagsuren

texts.en:
Baylagsuren, 38, lives with his family in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has two kids who attend kindergarten and an elder son in secondary school. He owned & operated a bus, as a means for public transportation, from 2004 to 2008. 

Since 2008, Baylagsuren has been transporting goods by a truck with towing capacity of 65 ton. He transports goods in the country as well as from Ereen, a border city of China. He is busy all the time, driving from one location to another since he gained costumers who constantly trade goods from Ereen and other places. 

Baylagsuren is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase new tires for his truck. He is a responsible and trustworthy, and  dreams to establish his own public transportation company.

loans.use: To purchase new tires for his truck

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. V.  tiene cinco  años trabajando en la industria maquiladora, teniendo como puesto  líder de área , en esta  ocasión solicita  el  crédito  para  mejorar  su  vivienda  ya  que  en la  actualidad  cuenta  con la  barda  lateral de   su hogar pero le  hace  falta el  acabado con estuco, ve   en el  crédito  la  oportunidad  de realizar  su  proyecto  además  de  proporcionar a  su familia    una mayor  privacidad  y  protección a  su  domicilio.
texts.en: Senor V. has been working in the garment manufacture industry for 5 years, holding a post as Area Leader. On this occasion he is seeking a loan to improve his home. It already has a wall around the yard, but it was built without being finished with stucco. He sees the loan as an opportunity to complete the project and thus offer his family a greater measure of privacy and protection in their home.

loans.use: to build a wall around the property.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey, who was born in 1967, is the mother of six children. Three are employed in garment factories, one is a farmer, and the others are attending local public school. She is married to Mr. Ret. 

Both of them are farmers who own a small piece of land where they can grow rice. They sell some part of the rice and the rest of the rice they keep to support their family. Aside from farming, they own an agriculture machine, and he is a palm juice collector. 

In the rice field, they face a problem because their land is infertile soil. So to improve the crop, Mrs. Srey is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, and with the rest of the loan she is going to buy a cart. 

Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Marjune

texts.en:
Marjune is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. He  is 28 years old. Marjune is single. To make a living, Marjune owns & operates a specialized retail store. Income from the business comes primarily from buying and selling gasoline per liter in the local community. Marjune has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marjune joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marjune is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional gallons of gasoline. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marjune from HSPFI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline

loans.name: Lilet

texts.en:
Lilet P. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 45 years old. Lilet is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lilet owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling wood & wood-related products in the local community. Lilet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Lilet is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional lumber for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Lilet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional lumber for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has operated his bicycle repair business for the past 10 years, catering primarily to bicycle operators in his area. His chief business challenge is the problem of delayed payments by debtors. He dreams of eventually establishing a spare parts shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan his has requested, he wants to purchase bicycle spare parts for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando is married with three adult children. He has been a farmer working in the Philippines for 33 years. Armando is asking for a loan of Php 27,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure and rice seeds to plant in his farm. Oscar hopes this loan will grow his operations. Currently, he earns PHP 30,000 every cropping season. Armando wishes to enlarge his farm for additional source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow rice

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de Hot Dog, vive con su esposo y una hija de 16 años de edad, ella trabaja vendiendo todos los días cerca de su casa, este negocio surgió por la necesidad de mantener a su familia, ayudando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Su objetivo actualmente es comprarse una máquina de coser  ropa, para instalar una sastrería, por eso solicita un préstamo que le permita obtener dicha maquina y dar inicio a una nueva actividad.
Con esta inversión podrá aumentar sus ingresos, pues sería una nueva actividad la que tiene que atender, de la que espera mejorar junto a su familia y un día lograr comprarse su casa.
texts.en:
María sells hotdogs.  She lives with her husband and a 16-year-old daughter.  She sells every day near her house.  The business came about because she needed to support her family and help her husband cover household expenses.

Her goal currently is to buy a sewing machine to set up a tailor shop.  This is why she’s asking for this loan that will make it possible for her to acquire said machine and start a new business.

With this investment she will be able to increase income because it would be a new business to tend to which she hopes will help her and her family improve and one day be able to buy herself a house.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 45 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married with 3 children. 
Lourdes works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 25,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 
Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina is married to Jesús and the couple have three children who are still under their care. They live in a very beautiful place where there is a lot of vegetation and many people work making traditional crafts. 

Catarina looks after her home and she requested this loan to invest in buying school supplies.  She has been in this business for six years and says that it is doing well.  Her business is growing every day.  One of her sisters supplies her with merchandise and things are going well.

It was Catarina's sister, who worked in a stationery store, who inspired her to start her business.  As there is a high school nearby, she told her that she should set up a stationery store as it would be a good business that would make her profits.

What Catarina would like is for this business to make her better income so that she can get her family ahead in life.  The most important thing for her is to provide her family with what they most need.

Translated from Spanish:
      La señora Catarina es casada  con el señor  Jesús y con quien procreo tres hijos  que aun están a su responsabilidad, en donde ella vive es un lugar muy bonito donde hay mucha vegetación y las personas se dedican a  la artesanía.

Ella se dedica a su hogar y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de útiles escolares ya que se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares desde hace seis años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello esta aumentando día con día, ya que una de sus hermanas es la que le surte con la mercancía.

La que la inspiro fue su hermana quien trabajaba en una papelería y es quien le dijo que sería buena idea abrir una papeleria ya que cerca de la casa de la señora Catarina hay una escuela secundaria y así tendría buenas ganancias.

Lo que desea con esta actividad es que pueda  tener un mejor ingreso y con ello salga a delante con su familia que es lo más importante para ella darle lo más necesario.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and stock her stationery store.

loans.name: Fortune

texts.en:
This borrower is a 41-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between 2 and 9 years old. The older two are in school, and her husband is a driver.

For the past seven years she has owned a general store selling various goods such as mineral water, sugar, and beans.  This business has enabled her to feed her family and develop herself and her family’s standard of living.

She will use this loan to reinvest in her general store and buy various items such as rice and sugar.

With additional profits she will buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, sugar, beans, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Villaluz

texts.en:
Villaluz is 47 years old and a widow with three children.

Villaluz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Villaluz has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from her shell buying and selling business.

Villaluz aspires to save enough money so she can provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Kegbekpe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KEGBEKPE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sinatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sinatou est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Sinatou est mariée à un certain Ibrahim. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge dont un seul est le leur. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Sinatou n’a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Sinatou mène comme activité depuis vingt ans la vente des vêtements pour femmes de façon ambulante. Sinatou s’approvisionne  dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sinatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KEGBEKPE, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group KEGBEKPE is composed of three persons who are friends. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Sinatou, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 47 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a man named Ibrahim. They have two children to support. One of them is their own child; both are in school. 

Sinatou never attended school. To support herself and her children, Sinatou has been running a business selling women's clothing door to door for 20 years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Sinatou and the other members of the group KEGBEKPE are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es:
Gloria, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 5 años de edad, ella lleva 7 años en el negocio, comercializando mariscos para poder contribuir a los gastos del hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos, pescado seco y fresco, camarones, cangrejos, con estos podrá continuar comercializando con los clientes, ofreciendo productos frescos.
El propósito de ella es ser cada día mejor comerciante, ofrecer para los clientes los productos frescos atendiendo la demanda.
texts.en:
Gloria sells seafood. She lives with her husband and five-year-old son. Gloria has been selling seafood for seven years in order to contribute toward the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy shellfish, fish (dried and fresh), shrimp, and crabs. This will allow her to continue selling to her customers and offering them fresh products. Her goal is to become a better merchant each day by offering her customers fresh products and meeting their demands.

loans.use: to buy shellfish, fish (dried and fresh), shrimp, and crabs.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
22 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción se unieron con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, con lo cual podrán ayudar a sus hijos y demás familiares. Ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, denominaron al comité con el nombre de Virgen de Fátima, actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo. Podemos decir que el grupo es muy responsable, trabajador y muy solidario las unas con las otras.
La señora Elvira es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas, comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella logra obtener los medios necesarios para mantener a su familia. Dice que tiene mucha demanda, en especial los fines de semana donde siempre tiene el doble de ventas.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de bebidas, como ser cervezas, gaseosas, vinos y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
22 women from the city of Asunción joined together to improve their living conditions so that they can help their children and other relatives.  They are friends and neighbors from this city.  They gave the committee the name "Virgen de Fátima", and currently they are in their fourth lending cycle.  We can tell you that the group is very responsible, hard-working and very united.

Señora Elvira is one of the members, she works selling all kinds of drinks.  She comments that thanks to this work, she has been able to earn the money necessary to support her family.  She says that she has a lot of demand for her products, especially on weekends when her sales always double.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of drinks such as beer, soda, wine and other things, with which she can stock up and meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, wine and other drinks.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yenny ; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones,chompas,polos,casacas y blusas, la socia también se dedica a trabajar en una cevicheria,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y el negocio de la ropa lo vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y mejorar en su trabajo en la atención de la cevicheria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, blusas, casacas y polos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yenny, 22, belongs to the “Kanchary” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and a son.  She alternates her daily activities with a clothes selling business.  She sells pants, sweaters, polo shirts, jackets and blouses.  She also works at a marinated seafood snack bar from 8am until 7pm.  She’s a street vendor of the clothes.  Through these small businesses she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand the clothing sales and improve customer service at the snack bar.  She’s asking for the loan to buy pants, blouses, jackets and polo shirts at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en: Maricor is 43 years old, married and has six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is seeking a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her animals. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and earns additional income by farming sugarcane. She is working to achieve her goal, which is expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her herd of pigs.

loans.name: Jenny Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se conforma de tres mujeres trabajadoras, de este grupo Jenny es la presidenta ya que es una persona emprendedora, colaboradora y alegre. Jenny tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive con su hija de 7 meses de edad. Recide en la ciudad de Ibarra que es la Capital de la Provincia de Imbabura en el Norte de Ecuador.

Jenny trabaja en su casa en la compra-venta de cosméticos que le ayuda para mantener a su hija. Es el primer crédito que le solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de perfumes, desodorantes, cremas para incrementar los productos en su negocio y poder obtener mas ventas y mejores ingresos económicas.

Su sueño es poder tener un negocio grande de cosméticos y con las ganancias que tenga poder seguir manteniendo a su hija y darle lo mejor.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hard-working women.  Jenny is the group's president.  She is an entrepreneurial, cooperative and cheerful person.  Jenny is 22 years old, single, and lives with her 7-month-old daughter.  She lives in the city of Ibarra, the capital of Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador.

Jenny works from home buying and selling cosmetics.  This helps her to provide for her daughter.  This is the first loan that Jenny has requested from Fodemi and she will use it to buy perfumes, deodorants and creams to increase the products she sells in her business so that she can make more sales and more income.

Jenny's dream is to have a large cosmetics business and to use the profits that she makes to continue supporting her daughter and provide her with the best in life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, deodorants and creams to increase her sales

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, 36, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ireneo, a shoe repair man, and is the mother of two children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Delia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Celia earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 45,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Delia dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Estrella" se originó a traves de promociones  que se realizó en el barrio de las miembros. Los objetivos de cada de una de ellas son trabajar en equipo, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa. Gracias al programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras las señoras valoran la importancia de un crédito y la oportunidad  de estar en un comité, conocer gente nueva, cosechar amistades, tener fuente de trabajo digno y mejorar la educación de sus hijos mediante las capacitaciones brindada por el programa.
Claudia, tiene una peluquería, en la que trabaja todos los días. Comenta que recibe todos los días a muchos clientes y clientes, por lo que nos comenta que le va muy bien. Ella gracias a su amabilidad y a su buen trabajo atrae a las personas para que puedan volver siempre, es por ello que ya tiene una buena clientela. En su afán de seguir dando lo mejor a sus clientes, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, esmalte para uñas, spray, gel, y demás insumos necesarios para su profesión. Ella al igual que las demás están muy agradecidas a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The committee Nueva Estrella began as a result of ads in the members' neighborhood. All of them want to work in a team, encourage a spirit of unity and reach the highest level of the program. Thanks to the trainings given as part of the Enterprising Women program, the women understand the importance of a loan and the opportunity to be part of a group, meet people, make friends, have dignified work and improve their children's education.

Claudia has a beauty shop where she works every day. She has customers every day and tells us that it's going very well. Thanks to her friendliness and hard work she attracts customers who keep coming back. Because of that she already has a good clientele. In her eagerness to continue giving her customers the best, she asks for a loan to buy hair dyes, nail polish, hair spray, gel and other materials that she needs for her work. Along with the others, she is very thankful to the foundation for the opportunity that this gives her.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, nail polish, hair spray, gel and other products.

loans.name: Kusema

texts.en: Kusema is a twenty five year old married man living in a permanent house in Kyenjojo,Uganda. His personal goal is buying land in town and constructing rentals. He has been operating a retail shop for two years, despite challenges in limited capital to meet the increasing demand. His business dream is to have a wholesale shop. Kusema needs the loan to buy sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar to sell.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: La señora Emiliana trabaja como secretaria en un Instituto Médico de la ciudad de La Paz; además de esta actividad, se dedica a la elaboración de calzados para damas, para cubrir el saldo de sus necesidades mensuales. El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital y comprar material, como cuero, hebillas, gomas para tacos, etc. Emiliana es casada y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona  de Villa Nueva Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz. Emiliana se encuentra muy satisfecha con los  créditos anteriormente  otorgados y esta es la tercera vez que su solicitud será enviada  a kiva.
texts.en:
Emiliana works as a secretary at a medical institution in the city of La Paz.  In addition to that job she makes women’s shoes in order to cover the balance of her monthly necessities.

She needs the loan to increase her capital and to buy material like leather, buckles, and rubber for heels, etc.

Emiliana is married and has two children.  She lives in her parents’ house in the Villa Nueva Potosí zone in the city of La Paz.

Emilia is very pleased with the previous loans she was granted.  This is the third time that her request will be sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy material like leather, buckles, and rubber for heels, etc. to continue in her business of making women's shoes.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is the father of one child, age 5, and has been in mixed farming for three years. He produces tomatoes, maize, and milk for the local market. To earn additional income, he also runs an entertainment joint with pool table games and a retail shop.

Andrew has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. The acquisition of an additional dairy cow will boost his farming income and enable him to acquire more land, which has been a limitation for him to achieve the farming volume he wants.

He notes unreliable rains and high costs of inputs as additional challenges to farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora con ganas de superación, es madre soltera y vive en compañía de sus 04 hijos de 14, 12, 10 y 7 años de edad, a quienes quiere mucho y se esfuerza por darles lo mejor y no les falte nada en esta vida. Vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Elva, consiste en la venta de pollos, en su local propia ubicado en el mercado, el cual lo abrió ya hace 02 año tiempo y que le valió para hacerse conocida en la zona. Impulsada por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico pues la pensión que le pasa el padre de sus hijos no les alcanzaba, ahora  contando con la apoyo de su hija que le ayuda  en la labores de la venta en sus ratos libres. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida  a sus hijos, y le ha permitido darles la mejor educación ya que ellos son su inspiración para seguir progresando. Asimismo nos comenta que tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y poner una tienda de venta de verduras. Este sería su 03 préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente muy contenta y agradecida con el apoyo que viene recibiendo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. 
Con el préstamo solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará un puesto para su hija para la venta de verduras además  de implementarla con productos para la venta.
texts.en: Elva, 36 years old, is a woman struggling with desire to excel.  She is a single mother and lives with her 4 children, aged 14, 12, 10 and 7, whom she loves very much and strives to give them the best and that they lack nothing in this life. She lives in her own home. Elva's work consists of selling chickens in her own place in the local market, which she opened 2 years ago and has become known in the area. Driven by the need for income as the pension that the father of her children has did not reach them, she now has the support of her daughter who helps with the work in her spare time. What she likes about her work is that it allows her to have an income that gives her peace of mind in providing a better quality of life for her children, and it has allowed her to give them the best education because they are the inspiration for further progress. She also tells us that she plans to expand her business and put in a shop to sell vegetables. This would be her 3rd loan with the MFP institution. She feels very happy and thankful for the support she has received, for which she agrees to be punctual with her payments.  With the loan requested of 1000 nuevos soles she will buy a place for her daughter for the sale of vegetables and also starting her off with products for sale.

loans.use: to buy a stall to sell vegetables and also buy vegetables.

loans.name: Rawafid

texts.en:
Rawafid is 50 years old married, mother of three children. Rawafid is working as a genitor for eleven years. Even with the low salary she is proud to contribute to the family income and assisting her husband to provide the needs of her children and as a teacher she values the importance of education and wants her children to attend best schools. With this loan now she can accommodate her son's expenses. 
She is requesting a 1200$ loan to pay for her son's school fees and other study expenses. Rawafid aims to see here children get high grades and finish school.
The story of Rawafid and her son is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients that are able to get better education.
She preferred to blur her face for cultural reason.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel lives in San Nicolas de los Garza, Nuevo Leon, and have a unisex beauty salon business called “Divas”, in where she offers to her clients hair cuts, hair paint, etc., she started her business since 5 years ago, and she decided to start because her husband was paying the credit of the house and his incomes were not enough to cover his family expenses. One of her sons had to leave his college studies because Maribel and her husband had not money to pay his studies, for that reason, Maribel decided to support her husband in their family expenses started her business. Now two of her sons are studying at the university, she works alone in her business and also one of her daughters help her in the beauty salon.

Maribel is requesting for a loan of USD $375 USD to purchase hair paint and mirror to her business.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Maribel vive en San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León, tiene una estética unisex llamada “Divas”, en la cual hacen cortes, tintes, peinados, etc., ella inicio con este negocio hace 5 años, y decide ponerlo ya que su esposo estaba pagando la casa y los ingresos no eran suficientes para los gastos de comida y escuelas. Uno de sus hijos tuvo que truncar sus estudios de preparatoria por no poder solventarlos, por lo cual Maribel decide ayudar a los ingresos de la casa poniendo su negocio. Ahora dos de sus hijos ya están cursando la universidad, ella no tiene empleadas en el negocio, una de sus hijas le ayuda en la estética.

Maribel esta solicitando un crédito por USD $375 para poder comprar tintes y espejos para su estética.

loans.use: Purchase hair paint and mirror

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Samani

texts.en:
Samani, a member of MBK, is requesting for a loan of $150. She is expanding her duck breeding business. Prior to becoming a member of MBK, she is only able to raise 200 ducks but with this loan she is able to increase her farm to 800 ducks. Apart from ducks, Samani also raise 15 goats. Every alternate day, Samani sells 600 duck eggs at IDR700 each.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Duck breeding

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 36 years old. She makes tostadas for sale and is now expanding her business to sell school athletic clothing. She purchases the items at a clothing factory and sells them to the schools close to her home. To make the skirts she purchases fabric and makes them herself together with her friend. Maria Teresa has 3 children, her husband is a carpenter's assistant. She wants to grow her business with this loan and thereby improve her family's financial situation. Maria Teresa belongs to Grupo Azalia 2.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch.

MARIA TERESA TIENE 36 AÑOS Y SE DEDICABA A LA ELABORACION DE TOSTADAS Y AHORA EMPRENDIO EL NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE: PANS, SUDADERAS, PLAYERAS ESCOLARES. ESTO LO COMPRA EN UNA FABRICA DE ROPA Y LAS VENDE EN COLEGIOS CERCANOS DE SU CASA . PARA LA CONFECCION DE LAS FALDAS COMPRA TELA Y LAS ELABORA JUNTO CON SU COMADRE MARIA TERESA TIENE 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES AYUDANTE DE CARPINTERO , DESEA INCREMENTAR EL NEGOCIO CON EL PRESTAMO Y ASI MEJORAR LA SITUACION ECONOMICA DE LA FAMILIA MARIA TERESA PERTENECE AL GRUPO AZALIA 2

loans.use: COMERCIANTE

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es:
Oralia is a hard-working and enthusiastic woman. She is married with three children; they have motivated her to start her own business since the salary of her husband, who works as a stonemason, is too small to support all the family's needs. Because Oralia is a self-starter, four years ago she decided to start her own business selling jewelry and hamburgers. Fortunately, the business has done very well, and her requests and sales have grown.

Her desire to improve her family's quality of life motivates her to work everyday, and now, she wants to see her business grow. She asks for a 250 dollar loan to purchase merchandise. She pledges to pay off her loan in 3 months. By supporting Oralia, you can become a part of this business' development and the well-being of Oralia and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Oralia es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, es casada y tiene tres hijos que han sido el motivo para iniciar su propio negocio, su esposo trabaja como albañil y su salario es muy bajo para poder cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, por lo que Oralia siendo una mujer emprendedora decidió comenzar con las ventas de joyería y hamburguesas desde hace cuatro años. Afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien y cada vez se incrementan más sus pedidos y ventas.

El deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la motiva a trabajar mucho día a día, y ahora quiere hacer creer su negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes formar parte en el desarrollo de este negocio y en el bienestar de Oralia y su familia, ¡apóyalos!.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Amaka Ojinaka

texts.en:
"I hope to invest in my business," says Mrs. Amaka E.. She is 29 years old, married, and hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells women's wear and cosmetics and rents VCDs to people in her area. She has been in this business since 2001.

Amaka is looking forward to receiving a loan in the amount of US$ 400 to buy more women's clothing, cosmetics, and VCDs.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing and cosmetics for sale and VCDs for rental in her boutique

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is 49 years old and is a hardworking woman who has maD. great sacrifices in order to achieve some assets to support her children. She has dealt with many misfortunes like the abandonment of her eldest daughter's partner and the death of one of her daughter-in-laws (who was a mother, had become a friend, and used to help her in her business of breeding animals). Her goal is to help her children and in turn assist with the welfare of her grandchildren. The shortcomings Victoria and her family have experienced have been endured by their immense effort and purely because of the love she has for her grandchildren and the joy they bring to her. In order to continue supporting her family, and improve the breed of the animals she maintains, she needs to buy her own small corral space, in which she can breed and raise her animals and stop paying a considerable amount of money for the rental corral space she currently uses. Victoria needs your help in order to grow economically and to continue to proviD. for her beloved grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria tiene 49 años y es una mujer empeñosa que con mucho sacrificio pudo alcanzar algunos bienes con los cuales apoya ahora a sus hijos, que tuvieron que afrontar algunas desgracias primero el abandono D. la pareja D. su hija mayor y luego la muerte D. la esposa D. uno D. sus hijos D. los que se ha convertido además D. madre y amiga en socia con el objetivo D. que cada uno D. ellos pueda otorgarle bienestar a sus pequeños niños. Las carencias D. su familia se han visto muy bien copadas por el inmenso esfuerzo D. sus hijos y la alegría que le otorgan sus queridos nietos. Con el objetivo D. seguir otorgándoles bienestar y ayuda a sus hijos e incrementar y mejorar la raza D. los animalitos que alberga en su corral y conjuntamente con ello comprarse o establecer un amplio lugar donD. criarlos para dejar D. pagar una considerable suma D. dinero por el alquiler del espacio que ocupa solicita un préstamo con el que podrá establecer y ambientar un pequeño corral. Victoria requiere D. su colaboración para poder crecer económicamente y convertirse en un sostén para sus nietos que ahora forman parte D. su corazón.

loans.use: To purchase a small corral in which to breed and keep her animals safe, and eliminate corral rental fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To diversify his merchandise and buy essential products in bulk

loans.name: Sylvia's Group

texts.en: Sylvia is 28 years old. Her current business is poultry farming. She plans to use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: To increase her poultry stock.

loans.name: Valida

texts.en: Valida (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children. She started a farming business 2 years ago. They plan to buy seedlings and pesticides to improve their farming, which is why they are applying for this loan of $1200. Valida is 43 years old.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Epifania Francisca's Group

texts.en:
Francisca and Cirila have been members of the community bank Manantial for close to ten years. In that time, they have learned to save, be punctual, and to be responsible.

Francisca is 50 years old. She is married and has six children. Francisca is from the community of Rancha, which is a little town outsiD. the city of Ayacucho. Francisca travels to different markets in the region where she sells fruits and homemaD. breads. From the markets, she buys meat and cheeses that she sells in the city of Ayacucho and sometimes in the city of Lima. Recently, Francisca started a new business raising chickens and pigs.

Cirila is 50 years old. She is married and has eight children, three of whom live with her. Cirila buys chesses from various markets around the region of Ayacucho. She then sells them to restaurant and middle men who take them to the jungle region.

Francisca and Cirila need loans of 1000 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying things such as pigs, chicks, potatoes, and cheese.

One of the most important things about the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Francisca and Cirila plan to use their savings to pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are that their businesses will continue to grow and their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Francisca and Cirila need loans of 1000 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying things such as pigs, chicks, potatoes, and cheese.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina is forty years old and the mother of two boys and one daughter. Her husband works for a construction company. To supplement the family’s income, Guillermina sells used and new pants, shoes, shirts, blouses, and the like.

Guillermina would like to have money enough to support their children’s university studies, and also to buy a house some day. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more clothing to supply her business and increase her revenue.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to retail

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina is a 64 year old woman that has spent all of her life looking for ways to bring income into her home. She has always taken advantage of any business opportunity. Throughout her life she has sold everything from seafood to pants during the Christmas season. She says she was 12 years old when she started to work, including offering cleaning services inside some houses. Once she was married she managed to have a family and have six children, whom are all now adults. When she separated from her husband, the need to have a more stable job increased. It was with the help of one of her daughters, Elena Suarez, that she started a business selling food. It has been 13 years that they both have been selling sandwiches, sodas and beer at nights in a counter outside of her house.

Despite the adversities that Sabina has faced, such as the passing of one of her children four years ago and the aggravation of her illness (due to circulation), she has continued ahead because she has the unconditional support of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabina es una mujer de sesenta y cuatro años que ha pasado toda su vida buscando el modo de llevar un ingreso a su hogar. Siempre aprovechaba cualquier oportunidad de negocio. Así, a lo largo de su vida ella ha vendido desde pescado hasta panetones en temporada navideña. Ella cuenta que desde que tenía doce años empezó a trabajar, incluso ofreciendo servicios de limpieza dentro de algunas casas. Una vez que contrajo matrimonio llegó a formar su familia y tener seis hijos, quienes ya son mayores. Cuando se separo de su esposo, la necesidad de contar con un trabajo más estable creció. Fue con la ayuda de una de sus hijas, Elena Suarez que se animo a empezar el negocio de venta de comidas. Desde hace trece años ambas se dedican a vender sandwiches, gaseosas y cerveza por las noches en una especie de fuente de soda afuera de su casa. A pesar de las adversidades que se la ha presentado a Sabína, como el fallecimiento de uno de sus hijos hace cuatro años y el agravamiento de su enfermedad (de la circulación), ella sigue adelante pues tiene el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos.

loans.use: To supply her food kiosk

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is married with four children. Three of them are currently in school. Eating cereal in the morning as breakfast has become a regular meal for the working class in Ghana as one does not need to spend much time preparing it. Therefore, the demand for cereal is very high. Justina has been engaged in her business for 10 years now. She wants to use the loan to buy more boxes of cereal to increase inventory and also to avoid price hikes. Justina is a member of the group called Sons of God. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cereal
